Weber's accessories tend to be hit and miss. At first I thought this spatula was nice but in the end it's not the type to last. The steel is extremely soft and cheap; plated steel like most of Weber's Chinese made junk. It's nice and large but if you chip anything expect it to rust within a short period of time. As their normal grill plates are cheap steel so goes the accessories like this. Ordering a SS grill plate costed 70 bucks direct from Weber for me. Most of what they manufacture is simply sub-standard stuff meant for profit. This is no different. Rated 3 stars because it works decently. Otherwise try and find something that isn't so soft for outdoors use.

Die Hard 3 is still an amazing action film. The best or second best in the series depending on how you look at it. It's sad the series became a joke after this, catering to the new generation with terribly soapy scripts and weak acting. This one is actually for real. McTiernan was brought back on board after the little bit over the top nature of D2 and he brings a nice subtlety here that was missing in the second go around without dousing any major flames. Great acting all around with a good to great story that plays out pretty well in the end. Some elements are a little fantastic but it all comes down well in the end. I look at this as the last Die Hard. 4 was watered down entirely and 5 was embarrassing.The bluray transfer is pretty decent but probably could be better. It retains grain and has a pretty high bitrate, though likely comes from an older master. For the price you can't really go wrong. One of top two entries in the series and it isn't even debateable.

I like this floss the best. It gets everything out. After a night of drinking and whatever else--maybe you forgot to brush your teeth--you will definitely notice that this floss cleans well and thoroughly. It is not just a piece of flat tape. But it's not some rope like others are describing either. This works well for people that floss once a day or possibly once every other day or so.I wouldn't really recommend it for twice a day flossers as it is a deep cleaning floss that has some thickness. For me I love it. I floss once every other day and do a thorough cleaning as that is how I feel the best with my gums. The floss can break apart a little if you do not keep your metal slicer on the package clean of excess floss, but otherwise I have no problems with this stuff. It feels great on my teeth. If you are bleeding from a thicker floss you might want to try a little less thick version. If it's only a slight amount of blood that really isn't a huge deal compared to how deeply you will be cleaning your teeth with this product. A tape floss does nothing for my teeth and I still feel gunky after using those products. This is the best for me and I buy 6 at a time with S&Save.

My teeth are doing wonderful with this stuff. I have been using this specially forumlated toothpaste with nanohydroxyapatite for three weeks, and I can tell it is definitely filling out my teeth, at least a little bit anyway. A very smooth feeling. Slightly uneven enamel has been getting more even over the period of time in use. There is a shade of whiteness after three weeks that was not there previously.Of course for some major rebuilding you would want to check back in three or four months. Obviously, this is not going to prevent cavities or make you healthy, nor will it make deep grooves magically disappear. What it seems to do is strenghten what you have and polish things to a shinier level. I think you can expect a shade of whiteness as well. You still need a diet with proper mineral balance in your body to accommodate remineralization.I am using this along with a couple other toothpastes; one including Uncle Harry's Cinnamon... the other a Jason tea tree oil product. I also do regular oil pullings with sesame or coconut oil every week. In combination I could not be happier with the results.I will update the review at a later time to see how things are progressing. What I wanted from this was a slight whitening and some leveling and polish applied to a few teeth that could use it. I don't expect miracles or anything, but so far I am VERY pleased. You get a lot of this stuff in the Premio version and it seems a decent deal to me. I brush for about 2.5 minutes with a medium brush using this paste. I think it is fluoride free as well for those that are wondering.I think you can trust the scientific results here that were published; see google and appropriate chemical terms. This stuff seems to have a good effect after three weeks. There is no doubt whatsoever that this stuff has strengthened the outside of my teeth a bit. I have been viewing them up close with a flashlight to see the various lines and irregular surfaces, and I am happy with the results.I must highlight that this is not for major problems that require surgery or medium to large resurfacing of any kind. See a dentist for those problems. All in all highly recommended here.

These are the new version of the old and legendary Quest 4D boots. The major difference as many have noted is in the toe box. It's a bit roomier, which is nice. The toe room is ever so slightly improved. I went with my size 11 for the last boots and they do a times fit a little narrow near your big toe. The rest fit my feet perfectly. These boots are an ounce heavier, and remain the most stable boots for their weight class, rivaling other boots a pound heavier. They also remain supremely comfortable in most situations. The heel is ever so slighly more normalized and a bit straighter than the last version, though it was hard for me to tell much of a difference without full throttle hiking. All in all I recommend these to anyone wanting to hike, but probably not for people that very wide feet.

Nothing more nothing less. You really don't need these. They come free with the Master Touch if that is your thing. I have the normal Weber as I prefer the aesthetics of the wheels and the lid hook versus the metal lid rest that can scratch the top. I mention this because you may want these if you get the normal grill. I would honestly say they are pretty useless. As another user mentioned you can just use bricks if you need to direct heat and it works better in all honesty with more room for charcoal. These will rust. Cheap metal. Not worth 15 bucks. They are made in a factory in China for well under a dollar rest assured.

Okay and nothing more. Plated nickel will not last. You are better off investing in their stainless steel version available directly from their customer service. Another reason to just get the normal version of the grill and save your money. I cannot stand plated grates and will mostly likely be shelling out for the overpriced but better quality product.Hinged Cooking Grate, 22.5", Stainless Steel Part# 80728 for 58 dollars plus shipping. Expensive but probably going to be needed in the end. I've already seen pictures of the plated grates with rust.Rated 3 stars because it works and it's decent. It should also be noted that if you are constantly using a cheap wire brush, or any brush for that matter that is metal, your grates will be a lot more prone to rusting over time. And that is why I always recommend a wooden grill scraper.

The cheapest most dangerous thing you will ever use on your grill. Sure, the chances are slim one of these wires falls off and you actually swallow it, but who and the hell wants to take that chance? I have personally found one of the bristles in my mouth and will never use a wire pad again. Many horror stories abound of people swallowing these things. Very hard to pass. Stay away from these and get the big bad Woody Paddle for a bit more.

This thing does the job. Most people buying this will want to know what is different from other years in the Weber lineup. Well, quite a bit and mostly for the better. The handles no longer have hinges that can rust. You can hang a few appliances on them. There is a decent thermo on the top of the grill and a heat shield on the handle. The ash catcher is very nice and a solid improvement from years past. The legs are not too wobbly anymore and I had no trouble with the height of this thing being a little over six feet myself. All in all this is a very solid upgrade if you are using an older Weber. The sides of the main grill grate also flip up for easy access to charcoal. You can fit comfortably about 3.5-4 racks of ribs on here. It's definitely enough for a 3-4 person family in most cases.I prefer this model based on a few pointed observations that I will get to in a little bit. But let's compare this to the other models directly: that would be the Master Touch, which is 50 dollars more expensive, and the 26 inch version of that grill without the Gourmet BBQ centerpiece or warmer. The 26 inch is 300 dollars. It will all come down to personal taste here between the grills. There are some things that you should pay attention to though, as it is not cut and dry which model you will want just from looks or lists.The 22 inch Master Touch and the 26 inch grill are a tiny bit taller, 39.5 vs 42 inches per the Weber site. I'm not sure what adds into the height to be honest or how they make it ever so slightly taller.  It could just be the wheels for all I know or possibly the legs are a touch longer. It doesn't make any difference in my experience. The MT has a center piece that is removable for "gourmet BBQ". A quick point here: I don't personally like this addition. I use a nice wooden grill scraper--chinese wire brushes are the bane of existence and a real danger at times--and the center piece would screw up the burn lines on my large and heavy duty scraper. The normal plates are already a tad off on the moveable sides. You can however purchase this version and then get a different grate if you want, but that is adding a decent cost to an already extra 50 dollars.**You must purchase a stainless steel grate for over 60 dollars with shipping from Weber directly over the phone. Part# 80728 @ 58.47 dollars--comes out to about 70 total. I advise most to actually do this. Another reason I prefer the cheaper model as I use the extra 50 for the better grate. The SS grate is heavier, larger guage steel, and in general does not rattle. I love it, though it was expensive. And it will also last a LOT longer than the mediocre plated steel grate at high heat.I'm not entirely sure what the point of the center piece is but to sell more Weber accessories. And these accessories are not super high quality either. Anything like a cast iron griddle or pan is easily placed on the 22 and 26 inch grill surface. I don't cook pizza on my grill and have no use for extra grill patterns or a wok. IDK your mileage may vary but it just seems to me they want to sell you more things. In my case it would burn awkward lines into my expensive wooden scraper. I don't want a lot of extras hanging around for the grill that need to be cleaned and preened. And without the attachments the center piece is useless. Add in the fact that all I want is a stainless steel grate and there is no point in getting this grill for this extra feature.They do however include two of the cheap charcoal holders on the MT. You can arrange your charcoal fine without these holders IMO, and when you actually need to move things around I find they become a bother more than anything else. If you want them they are an extra that costs 15 dollars otherwise.BOTH the 22's have plated nickel steel cooking grates as opposed to the stainless of the 26 inch. As noted Weber does provide the little known stainless upgrade for more cash. My grilling grate has a slight uneven rattle, though, I have not cooked on it yet. It seems fairly durable but I have to somewhat doubt its longevity. I will order the SS version soon. It is thicker and heavier.There is also the metal side holder for the lid that is engrained into the grill on the MT and 26 inch. From the pictures and videos it looks like it may actually touch the enamel lid of the grill. While pragmatic I am not sure if this will scratch the grill or not in normal practice. On the other hand the hook on this model will not be to everyone's preference, though, it lines up with the damper and is honestly pretty easy to hook onto the side with some practice. Minimal scraping of the edges of the basket will occur more than likely as opposed to the possible scraping of the top by the other method.I'm not too keen on extra holes in the heating basket from the lid holder on the upper models, but it's hard to say how well they will seal in the end. In practice I would prefer a lid holder with some rubber protection from scratching the top of the lid. I think this is something they will improve on future versions. Beware, the enamel WILL scratch easily on these models.The wheels are slightly different on the MT and 26 inch models, though I prefer the aesthetics of the originals by a decent margin. The gray hubcaps with a grill logo are kind of well not all that pleasing to my eyes and look no more useful. Neither seem much different in practice. The MT has black handles as opposed to grey. Both look nice. A secondary warming rack is also equipped on the MT. I personally have little need for something like this, but others may find it handy. The MT and 26 inch grills come with a heat grip on the top damper. This is really the only thing I wanted on the normal model. Why this could not be included on the normal 22 I have no idea, but it really isn't needed anyway. I'm usually only using the damper once or twice and have a grill glove on hand or a metal tool to slide it. It should be noted that the rib roaster fits fine in any model. I recommend the higher priced stainless steel version.The 26 inch grill is wider and heavier, for twice the price again. To me, as someone that does not cook for more than 4 people, I don't need something that large. It takes a bit more charcoal to heat up a larger grill to the proper temps and the legs seem to be the same thin design that have to accomodate more weight. For a larger family you will want this option as it is quite a bit more space. The only downside again is that it's very expensive. Per the Weber site they list stainless steel for the cooking grate vs plated steel on the cheaper model. 508 square inches of cooking area vs 363. The cooking grates are honestly the biggest deal to me about these grills. It is a nice feature of the 26 inch to include a stainless as they are expensive to buy separately.So I have spelled out the major differences here. For me it comes down to preference. I don't really care about cost, but 300 was a teensy bit more than I was willing to spend for something I am not totally sure of the long term quality. I like the MT but have absolutely no use for the center piece and the wheels and lid holder to me are very questionable. If the lid holder does not scratch I see no problem with it, but metal against metal is going to scratch a bit if it makes a lot of contact at high heat. Not a huge problem but the basket and top are easily the most expensive parts of the deal and I want to keep them looking nice. All in all the last Webers had more than a few problems that seem to have been corrected in the new models. Only time will tell.I did also get two damaged tops with this grill. I don't mark down the grill because customer service was fantastic at Amazon. Just beware you may have to take one back if you get a damaged top. Weber should invest in some better packaging. Otherwise. this thing is a beauty. Highly recommended.I do not however recommend the cheap and terrible cover for the 22 inch grills. It has a hanging bag sewn to it and only one main velcro strap. It looks cheap. It is cheap. Yet it's 30 dollars. I bet it's made in China for about a dollar. Just a warning. You might want to look elsewhere to see if you can find a better cover. I will wait until they improve it before I buy anything of such low quality.I will also update this review as I keep using the grill.

I absolutely adore the solo guitar work on Casbah, Smokey River, Finches, and the other selections, but some of the lyrical content sounds just a little too traditional for my tastes compared to some of his other selections. I think he branched out on the second album in a very good way and continued to do so throughout the 70s. You can't go wrong here at any rate; it's definitely an album that turned a lot of people on to this style of folk. A very solid and great album.It contains more solos without singing than the second album as well. But to me it is also a little less cohesive and has worse production--Do You Hear Me Now seems a touch out of place on this record, and a couple of the songs are a little monotonous. At 15 tracks it does very well with its time on the whole. I do think that people will really love the various guitar solos sprinkled throughout, and that alone is worth the purchase as there are quite a few of them. Jansch is a pioneer that should be automatic listening for any music lover. Highly Recommended.

A great sequel to the first album and quite honestly, overall, an album that hits a slightly higher peak in the lyrical selections for me. I actually prefer my favorite tracks from this one. Top stuff in the blues/folk genre. He even seems to gives each song a flavor that seems to add up to just a bit more than the debut IMO, which was more or less a great album that introduced you to his style but had a few more songs that started to grate at times. I can't say I like every song here but the best ones are truly great. The Eastern influences are very much appreciated and give the album a fresh outlook.Songs like My Lover, It Don't Bother Me, Anti Apartheid, and 900 Miles are absolutely fantastic lyrical productions while The Wheel and Lucky Thirteen are beautiful guitar pieces. You can't really go wrong with this one or the debut, but I feel this one is slightly more cohesive and distinct with its lyrical selections. They both sound fantastic on CD right now in their remastered form. Go check this guy out if you have not had the chance to.

Cheaply made and largely a pile of crap. Not sure where all these reviews are coming from. I can tell you right now this is made for about 50 cents in China, if that much. Thin. One velcro strap, with another tiny one at mid level on the other side--idiotic beyond belief--and a terrible bag that just hangs from the bottom for storage. Why attach the bag to the grill cover? When the grill cover is covering the grill where do you put the stupid bag that hangs over a foot from the bottom. Who designs this kind of stuff? The tiny velcro patch on the inside isn't enough to hold the storage bag or much else. What are you supposed to use this tiny thing for lol? It's like 3 inches long. The other velcro strap is fine. But that's only one decent strap!This is the bare minimum that SHOULD have come with the grill. I don't plan to have my grill out in the elements much and with this cover I wouldn't trust it in MN winters anyway. I heard they improved this cover and honestly it's pretty hard to believe. It doesn't look like this thing would make two years in the sun.I'd be OKAY with the cover, for the record, if they had simply had some quality stitching and had the storage bag separate or with a pouch of its own inside the grill cover itself instead of just randomly hanging from the cover. Charging 30 dollars for a thin cover like this I at least expect some conceptual design that isn't ridiculously out of date.That would consist of two decent velcro straps at the bottom and an inside storage bag, or another longer strap for the bag to be tied, for the storage bag itself. There are not many options for people here so I guess this is what you have to get. It's pretty obvious their profit margin on this thing is pretty huge. They could stand for a redesign.

You have to remember to handle all flakes with care. Mine are still very big portions because I barely touch them and only use them to supplement a diet along with fresh food and granules. I have no complaints here. I got a fairly big bottle so remember your needs if you want to keep things at the freshest level. There are a lot of flakes in the mid to large bottles. IMO these are not really meant to be an entire diet's worth of nutrition. But I have no complaints here. Also, your fish doesn't need but 4 or 5 large flakes if it is an adult. They don't really dirty my water as my fish eats all of what I put into the water quickly. Recommended.

These are the fabled yeast vitamins. They do seem pretty high-quality and have some good additions like vitamin C from orange and A from carrot, but most of them are from the S. cerevisiae process of converting whatever they use with yeast to a more bioavailable product. Not really sure where they get most of the vitamins and minerals. They do have a nice proprietary blend in here but they are also pretty overpriced. Even with 15% with S&S I am paying 40 bucks.I tend to switch multis every 5 months or so and these are in rotation at times. For 90 tablets they are actually about as expensive as some other brands like Garden of Life, which holds only 60. It's up to you to do your research on what you prefer. The GoL product does actually seem to be produced from more food sources. As to how bioavailable or better for you all this is.... well again you will have to come to your own conclusions.FWIW this company is generally of high-quality throughout their product line. These ARE better than normal vitamins and are more bioavailable. But it's hard to say how much without any concrete science.

I love this stuff. All of NOWs organic grasses are from Kansas or around that area and they are great! No complaints whatsover. Remember the juice is a little different from the whole leaf stuff. I use both. This is very green and potent so a little goes a long way. I use them in water shakes with RAW powders and other supplements. I can choke these down well. In fact, I barely even notice the taste anymore. One of the healthiest products out there. Truly for the health conscious crowd. Not too different from the barley grass juice. I use both products as well as some whole leaf stuff with more fiber. Highly recommended.

I love this stuff. All of NOWs organic grasses are from Kansas or around that area and they are great! No complaints whatsover. Remember the juice is a little different from the whole leaf stuff. I use both. This is very green and potent so a little goes a long way. I use them in water shakes with RAW powders and other supplements. I can choke these down well. In fact, I barely even notice the taste anymore. One of the healthiest products out there. Truly for the health conscious crowd. Not too different from the wheat grass juice.

My goldfish loves these. Nothing bad to say about them at all. There are a ton of them and one can misjudge how many are in between your fingers so feed lightly if you only have one fish. They don't need mega doses of these concentrated granules. Supplement with fresh food and other things for a fully balanced diet. I also use the flakes and they both work wonderfully.

I'll never buy a metal brush again as I have almost swallowed two bristles in the past couple years. Those things can do mega damage to you as a quick search on google might tell you. Though, expensive, this is the ONLY thing I will use to clean my grill ever again. I cannot believe the number of people that use metal brushed. While they may not fail, the problems occure if you use any kind of oil or other like substances that can make grates sticky. When you clean any amount of these bristles can come off. The cheaper brushes with shorter strands are to be avoided at all costs.This here tool is flawless mostly. Just make sure you burn it in right for your grill and you will have no problems whatsoever. Nice oak hardwood and finish. Work as they advertised. Also will not harm any kind of metal finish on grill plates if that is a fear. Never go back.I recommend a full plot of charcoal and high heat to burn it in. Doesn't take more than a couple of times. It does not totally clean the grates, obviously, because it's just a wood finish scraping the top. But it does the job just fine for me. Wash your stainless steel grate with hot water if you really need it to shine.

Still going strong after about 8 years. I bought one of the originals and it doesn't look to have changed all that much. It still works very well. I use it mostly just for the pulley system and back in the day it was this or a couple others like the Chuck Norris machine lol. This one won out despite being a little spendy and it has totally held up and improved my health. Nothing bad to say about it.Using weights seems to work well too if you need that. I just put it on the highest height and use it for medium exercise along with dumbbells. I couldn't really ask for more. There are a bunch of extra add-ons for pullups, foot ties, and various other things that will be of use to many. The company seems pretty good about warranty and other things like that. There really are not that many choices when it comes to these types of machines and the Total Gyms looked a lot cheaper by comparison. Supports my 200 pound weight with ease. Fold up very well for portability.

A new take on the formula that just works. Period. I'm not sure where the negative reviews are coming from but it possibly has to do with Uplay. I have a very nice PC and tbh I don't have many problems at all with Uplay. You can basically disable the thing and play offline just fine. Graphics drivers, at least for Nvidia, have come a long way here and I get 60FPS pretty solid with all but Nvidia shadows on. The rest is Ultra plus HBAO. I get a few hangs now and then from Uplay but even that service has drastically improved for me. Watch your overclocks for a game like this.Getting to the game: let's get the only negatives out of the way. You have done this before in many ways. And the LOD pop-ins when flying over the island are still a little bit last gen as is the anisotropic, or lack thereof, filtering on the ground. Other than that this is easily the most polished iteration of the series and the best one by a fair margin. The story is fun if not always great, the missions are much more polished and interesting, and the overall aesthetic is just wonderful. It's like playing Uncharted 2 in an open world. And there is a lot to collect and do in this version. More so than Far Cry 3.Your preference of which game's locale is better comes down to taste, but I find myself more and more preferring the realistic and very well done natural habitat of the Tibet region. On PC this one looks more polished than 3 by a decent margin. The vehicles are as good or better. The weapons are about the same. But I think the NPCs and all around direction of this one remains more confident. The story is less annoying and more fun, the enemies have better AI and the missions on hard are definitely at the right difficulty for a game like this.If you can afford to run this with all settings on max you are in for a treat. The only aforementioned problems in graphics are due to this series still being stuck on the old gens systems. I think that will change with the next iteration. But for what they could do here they did a damn fine job. I haven't even touched multiplayer and don't really plan to. There is so much to do in the main game that it's basically all I really care about. I think the balance is pretty good in this one too. You don't feel too overpowered on hard. The guns come at a decent clip as you complete the lower and upper parts of the island. The places you visit are distinct and very detailed.That isn't to say this is a brand new take on the series. It's a more polished version of Far Cry 3 in Tibet, with all the mountains and vistas and secrets you could imagine. No, it's nothing new, but it's all true fans could ask for in such a short period of time. I really look forward to where they take this series next.

Did they ever step up their game with this album. The voice. The guitar the bass the drums. EVERYTHING! I'm not sure there has been too many albums where a band has suddenly transformed itself into a juggernaut like this. Sure, old fans including me loved these guys before but this is when they HIT their peak and went on strolling. You cannot miss this album. A staple of alternative-grunge rock or whatever you want to call it. DOES NOT MATTER. Goes way past that man. Soundgarden rewrote the book on what you could do with a unique singer on this album. The riffs and the lyrics along with the voice are just innovative in their pure, driven necessity. Highly recommended.

Point Break is a very good film overall from the 80s/90s heyday of action-dramas. Kathryn Bigelow's first box office smash, starring Reeves and Swayze in roles that fit them well, deserves a look from people that haven't seen it before. It doesn't have much wrong with it from a critical perspective IMO, and most scenes still work well today.The Bluray is good quality with a nice bitrate and a transfer that at times can be soft but is mostly pretty decent for a minor catalogue title. I was happy with how transfer came out. For 5 bucks the action and surfing sequences are usually very well done and the story is fairly creative for its day. Recommended.

Another of the famed Sapphire series of blurays that went to the cellar for whatever they did here and came up with garbage. An old master, a sharpened and harsh image, yadda yadda. If it's your favorite film it may be worth 5 bucks, but I'll hold out for something better. The film is a masterpiece, but much like Gladiator, which actually had a reissue because of the massive campaign against its awful first release, this one just looks like a rushed product not fit for release. It deserves so much better.

I'm not going to go too much into the film. Other reviews cover that well. It's a pretty great retake on Hairspray and done very well on all accounts.The bluray is bad. It's a bottom of the barrel 15Mbps transfer that is soft, nasty, and looks nothing like film. I get the stylized look but in no way should a film be treated like this. For 5 bucks it is up to you if you want the film. I don't really see much difference from the streamed version on any number of HD services.

One of the best western games ever made really. The COJ franchise took a wrong turn there with Cartel and even before that their engine just wasn't very good to be quite honest, and it made their games, which are somewhat linear, kind of a drag.Well, all that is fixed and more. This is one of the best Western genre games ever made. Informative, with the many nuggets you can find while playing, which lead to material to read about the West, to highly entertaining with the very talkative narrator who will trick you quite a lot throughout. The graphics to me are actually pretty amazing. Get the HBAO+ code working on an Nvidia card and play this in 1800p or higher for the best time. I use a 970 overclocked and I'm doing fantastic on maxed settings and 1800p.The environments have been improved a ton since the old days of the first couple games. No longer do things pop in and out everywhere. The textures are decent, the sounds and the guns are interesting, and the upgrade system is pretty fun on the harder difficulties. I recommend starting off on hard. I'm playing with a DS4 and each and every environment evokes the West perfectly. You can get rid of the vignette with a simple tweak on PC as that is annoying. Otherwise now complaints the shooting is fun and fair and the old time vibe is just killer!I cannot recommend this game enough if you have a nice PC. Go for it. You are missing out on a really swell take on the genre. No, it doesn't really do anything new but it has a lot of style and the gunfights are fun. That along with some very decent graphics and stylized art makes it a no-brainer.

The good news is that the main album sounds as good or better than it did before. It will be near indistinguishable for those who are not careful listeners, and even I had trouble hearing much difference. A little more clarity, however small, matched with some more neutral and toned bass it seems. But no one is going to care much. You came here for the outtakes and extras.Pretty strange no one here mentioned how loud Howie Weinberg made ALL the demo discs and outtakes. Each and every one of them is mastered to a ridiculously high level. DR4-6 all around on these discs. The third disc survives at DR6. It's a little tough to care about demo and outtakes to be honest in some kind of definitive way, but that doesn't mean you need to push this stuff. Adjusted for volume they don't sound horrible always just very LOUD.A lot of us were really looking forward to the set, and for whatever reason Billy has chosen to go back to this guy again and again. It must be said that it is nice and punchy, but when a full band gets going or complexity overwhelms a naturally loud track these mastering techniques start to fall apart. Howie mastered their newest studio album in the DR5-7 range mostly. I would have preferred that here and more range.One listen of To Sheila on the Mono disc tells you all you need to know about these mastering techniques. Even though Howie backs off it is still way too loud for material like that. Plus Mono being that loud really doesn't make a lot of sense to me. He really butchered the Mono disc IMO. Honestly, it sounds like a badly recorded SP live album lol. The stereo version kills this version PERIOD.Corgan had Ludwig doing ALL the mastering work for the remasters up until the Pisces Iscariot Disc 2 in the deluxe version, which was crushed by Howie accordingly. Luckily, Ludwig did ALL their MAIN albums and their outtakes besides the outtakes from Adore and Pisces. Now don't get me wrong Howie did the original SP albums in the 90s, but around 1999 or so he just started maxing out all his discs for whatever reason. I'm not sure if this comes down to bass or what it is that makes these guys use the brickwall techniques. Bass is very good on these discs but a DR7-13 mastering would have preserved the dynamics and soft to loud transitions MUCH better. Howie USED to do DR7-DR13 or so up until his turning point in the late 90s. Now almost everything he touches is DR4-DR7 and way too loud and overblown.It must be asked if you wanted Howie's style at all why choose Ludwig for all the main albums and most of the earlier outtakes? It's obvious Ludwig is keeping the dynamics intact where as Howie is going for some kind of modern, compressed, and very bassy presentation. The crazy thing is most of this Pumpkins stuff doesn't seem to need anything in that range. DR7 at most to my ears. And even away from the numbers you can hear just how loud and uniform everything sounds. I would have died if Billy let Howie do the main albums!I have to tick my stereo back 3-6dB to volume match properly. I'd like a good article on why people go to the levels that Howie goes to on almost all his albums now. I don;t see any reason to do it when most of have very nice stereos. We have VOLUME KNOBS. Keep the dynamics! At least some of them.I honestly would not pay for this as is. I don't even really like the new artwork either. In fact, I don't like much of any of the new artwork on these remasters. This one is the worst of them all though. Just not digging all the red with the chick on this one. Looked much better in its original style. And the price is again pretty steep. I have no intention to support a millionaire many times over with hundreds of dollars. You all know where you can go for this.I'd say Disc 3 is pretty good. From there it gets fairly iffy. There are no whole concerts on the main discs. Nothing in the outtakes but the acoustic stuff is really my kind of thing. A lot of the songs on Discs 4 and 5 aren't really the best of material to be frank, and a lot of it is taken from Machina II sessions. The Sadlands demos are pretty good. But mixed in with all this other stuff I'm not really sure what the point is.... some of it is obvious filler. The usual stuff that is thrown away or kept safe somewhere for archival reasons. So if you are a collector by all means get this. But the single album remaster will work for most people and the original album also sounds just as good.

One of their more complex works with excellent guitar, possibly their best, and lyrics just as suited to their style as their oft-quoted best album in II. If you buy II first then this should be the second or third album of theirs you try out IMO. The remastering is fantastic and you won't be disappointed there. Give it a try.

This newer Shout! version has compression issues and a much worse grain structure than the MGM 2010 release. I'd stick to the trilogy when it goes on sale. 25 bucks last time I bought it. I cannot stand when companies fiddle with the grain structure too much.The original MGM release has a bitrate of 36.6 Mbps. This one is not even close or it has severe issues with the compressionist at the company. There is literally no reason for people to get this other than interviews.

If you can get past this director's constant need to make scenes more dramatic than they need to be, and quite over the top in places, you can probably agree that this is still quality film-making with a pretty good script. Crowe does well here and most involved also the same. It's quite manipulative but it's also dramatic in a good way that keeps you in the seat. I give it 3.5 stars on the whole and I usually just round up as it gets a B from me. It's better IMO than his ridiculously overrated Crash.

A fantastic noir with simple values. With most action films being so randomly mindane and terribly shot this film is a nice respite to the junk hollywood usually peddles out. It's funny reading some of the negative reviews on this film for sure. I'm not sure what people expected here. The dialogue is laser tight for the most part, the characters are interesting, and the circumstances are fully engaging. I appreciate all the work that went into setting up the backstory and environment here, which is very subtle but well-planned and intriguing.This isn't a period drama folks. Nor is it Blade Runner. As long as you have a brain going into this you can sort out the rest and realize what the intentions of the film are rather than hope it to be something it never set out to do. Great choregraphy and acting all around for what amounts to a very terse picture based on simple values with a load of pretty violence to follow in wake of its vengeance. Give it a try. I had a blast.

This is another decent Fincher flick that rises above on its great direction and soundtrack along with great acting by all involved. The problem again is a script that doesn't seem to tidy itself very well toward the end. Same with his Tattoo film, which gave no context for the ending, as we assume he will never make another of them, and kind of robbed the viewer of the relationships it portrayed. But this one held so much promise that it inadvertantly started making me a little angry when the last 30m just falls apart and starts to reveal the flaws of the source material.I didn't like how Tattoo ended because it was obviously not complete, and this one is similar in that no ends are tied up, but then again not tying them up leaves no one satisfied either. Some of the ending scenes are completely amateurish and not in the least believable, where most of the picture is believable and strives to be this way. I get that it says something about marriage and love, but it doesn't quite follow through with its message imo. Fincher's films are increasingly becoming without substance near the end, and completely overcome by the textural sounds.Where Seven and Fight Club had something to say against their pop veneer all the way through, this one seems to start wearing out its welcome by the end. I loved this film before I suspect it followed the book into a hole of its own making. The last 30m were a whirlwind of awful and great. Some of the scenes are so over the top as to be completely ridiculous, but in the end it is good, just WAY too slick for my tastes.I'm just going to stay thankful that this replaced the absolutely awful Button film as his highest grossing picture. I couldn't make it 30m through that pile of crap. This was at least fairly entertaning until the off the scope endgame that seemed like it was written by some high school kid wanting to bleed out the novel. More subtly please.

People tend to go crazy for new products because they love their hobby, but for a lot of people that have simple setups none of this is actually needed.There are only certain people that truly qualify to use things like this on a regular basis IMO. You also have to be very careful with things like this. A product that uses bleach needs to be studied for any kind of chemical reactions with any of your other products and organisms.Whereas Stability has a known, versatile, and needed chemical concoction--as does Prime--the other products they are selling are usually for the more complex setups.For this product it will work better for you if a dirty tank is your problem, most likely stemming from wood or plants or many fish that you cannot seem to keep stable. This can also harm certain plants and fish and other types of animals if you don't know what you are doing.For people with minimal systems you don't need anything like this at all IMO. My tank has some plants and one goldfish in a 20g. It is already crystal clear. So make sure you NEED something like this, otherwise you are just making things harder for yourself.

What more can be said? It improved on the first game in every way. Revisiting these classic games through ePSXe has been a joy. Apply a great filter like xBRZ or xBR and just marvel at how these still hold up today. This one even has a fan patch you should check out as it fixes a couple bugs and errors in the game. What you shouldn't probably do is by this for 300 plus dollars LOL.Anyway, this sits there with the Lunars, Grandia, Arc the Lad, Alundra, Wild ARMs, and a couple others as the best RPGs the PS1 had to offer. Extremely playable to this day in an emulator. Better than you will ever see it look emulated through a modern system on a console, meant for purchase. These games look and play exquisitely through an emulator and that is where you should be revisiting them if possible. Filters make the sprites look near perfect and there are many to choose from. Amazing how PS1 RPGs hold up and many of the PS1 and even PS2 3D games look awful in comparison. The same could be said for 2D games on the 16 bit systems; a joy to behold. xBRZ filters and their brethren have made a lot of these games timeless.

I'm not even that great at these games but they are still treasured classics. Playing them now with a nice filter on ePSXe could not be more fun. Pick them up however you want but don't forget these treasures exist. And my oh my do they look fabulous with an xBR or xBRZ filter through emulation. Don't miss out! You can give yourself as many credits as you want and you will need them. This is not an easy game.

For people like me you want a good transfer for your bluray collections. The main film here, Silence, is just another MPEG-2 transfer from the old HDDVD days. I for one cannot believe they haven't revisited such a classic release. It seems they might be doing that in the next year or two though. Hannibal is the same way, a lesser film but one that is nonetheless pretty decent just with an average at best MPEG-2 transfer. Manhunter, a film I find to be fairly dated--I have no idea why it still gets so much praise--has the only modern transfer yet looks fairly average at best. At least they all have lossless soundtracks.For 7.99 I'd say if you really want to see these go ahead. I have no intention of paying for old stuff thrown on a disc though. I'll wait for proper masters. The only film you REALLY need here is Silence and it doesn't look all that great to be honest. So there ya go.

I always trust this for my car. Yet I don't use it all that often as I don't think modern engines that are efficient and mostly clean already really need it on a regular basis. This also isn't going to save your engine or anything. It can only do so much in the fuel system. What it will do is make your driving experience as smooth as possible. I use it every 40k or so. When I was using it too often, and in my 13g tank, it may have contributed to a failure of an early failure of an oxygen sensor that wasn't made very well. Not the product's fault really but mine because this treats 21g and it is strong. It's one of the best products on the market along with their MOA for oil. I recommend both. If you have a modern car that gets really good gas mileage you won't be needing this very often.

This stuff has worked great for goldfish that had a problem with water quality in a 20g. I now feed him less. I used this along with Jungle Nitrofurazone and theses two worked together very well. I would have liked if the flakes stayed slightly larger but oh well. This is also quite healthy food with quality ingredients. I really would like to get some non-medicated food from this source to be honest. Five stars for helping my godfish Morty heal up. Just remember to vacuum the gravel well if your fish does not consume it all.

This worked perfectly. My first mold turned out okay, but my second one is the most comfortable mold I have ever had for my teeth. I have a problem with clenching or bruxism, and this has so far been THE most comfortable product I have used for my medium to large mouth.MY ONE warning is that after boiling water you do not need to wait 20 seconds. I think for me in MN it is more like 7 seconds and no more. I made a perfect fit by lightly biting down after taking it out with a cold metal tongs. I can sleep with this in my mouth. I made it for the top teeth to set it as that is more comfortable for most. I give this product five stars. I have one mold left. The first one was okay and it works but I didn't push on the mold enough and didn't indent my teeth in it enough for it to be as comfortable as my second one.After the boiling water was left to sit for about 5 seconds I dipped the piece in fully for 7 seconds, as it then was starting to curl, and then I took it out and basically put it my mouth and used my fingers to place just how I wanted. I like how they give you three molds here. Their customer service seems pretty decent too.

My favorite Curcumin supplement out there. Sure, you may not absorb everything but it's my opinion that if you are not treating cancer these are still helpful in the long run. There is simply too much evidence about the good effects of this supplement even in smaller doses, not to mention a whole host of ancient literature that has prescribed some for of this for thousands of years. Curcumin and it's main source Turmeric have been used for so long that it would be stupid to think they are simply a useless supplement imo. This one has black pepper to aid digestion and assimilation and I'd say so far this is my new favorite company for everyday supplements and few of these plant extracts. A little spendy but I think overall it is worth it with their standards, which are above and beyond most of the companies out there.

The best mints out there. These are hands down my favorite breath freshening mints. Less sugar than something like altoids and they may not last quite as long but they are simply better. Organic and sweetened with natural sugars including maple syrup. A little spendy but oh so worth it in the 6 packs.

A very nice and informative book to have. I guess it is a little expensive in the newest version, but I am going to still give it 5 stars as this will go down in price. I don't really see any reason you NEED this version, but it still is a worthwhile purchase for anyone serious about English and the arts that follow from it. Detailed and handy for anyone in college. Recommended.

Just everything crushed to s***. No dynamics nothing. And this deluxe is DR6 mostly. Too crushed for me to purchase. The original being DR11 already had a loud mix. Whatever. Torrent. Either make your albums listenable or people don't buy. Deal with it. Classic album 5 stars.

An bottom of the barrel transfer. Does not even manage 15Mbps and it is slathered in DNR. It doesn't get any worse than this really. If you want it for 5 bucks be my guest but don't pay a dime more. A minor comedy classic that really needs a better transfer and bitrate. It deserves better than this.

I feel like being an objective review, so I can't totally recommend this for 60 bones, but then again I rarely can say that for any game. The Order is painfully short because you want more, you need more, and in the end there isn't more.... yet. We can only hope for a sequel. So I will try my best to posit some semblance of  a decent review.First of all, if this game is a 5 or 6 out of ten, then games like COD, Asscreed, and Halo: MCC, which I own broken still to this day, are nothing more than the same scores dressed up with 9s and 10s because people are getting paid. For some odd reason this game is being picked apart by an industry that just doesn't seem to be able to handle graphical innovation very well.But it sure can handle broken games and POS campaigns with no objective sense in them.... because well IGN and Eurogamer and the rest rate all these other games quite highly; only now have they even given any inclination to being even slightly critical about these franchise games. When an industry shills us a Halo game that is still broke after three months with 9s, 10s, and everything else you know something is wrong with said industry. It just ain't tellin' the truth for whatever reason.To the game: What else need be said about the visuals. As a high-end PC owner these visuals compete with anything I have ever seen on PC, though it obviously only runs at 30FPS... and pretty solid at that. You can say what you will about the length of the game but what we have here is a technical showcase that at least needs to be seen by just about everyone that calls themselves a gamer. I say the same thing for each new Crysis game and each new game in general that pushes graphical fidelity forward.There is honestly no other game with such macro detail to objects. The shaders are getting Hollywood-like here and no other dev so far has put forth such a presentation that is as consistent across the board. Anywhere. The IQ seems about on par with a normal downsampling option in a PC game with some added AA here and there. It's a little softer but still ultra-gorgeous and clear for the most part. You will not confused this with sub-hd. Shadows are amazing and feature high-resolution and accurate detail not seen in any console game to this degree as of now.The black bars obviously enable them to push more with less but they are at least natively displayed on a 1080p screen and actually give the game a fairly cool 'lens' that the devs have worked in their favor. I expect the few people with 21:9 screens are going to love this game ever more. You can always zoom on your TV if you really want to be rid of the bars. The game even looks good on a zoom option believe it or not. I've actually considered getting one of these TVs, if I have money lying about, just for film and possibly a few games like this one.As for the 60 dollar thing.... it all depends on what you are doing. Huge backlog? Maybe wait a few months and pick it up at 30. Casual gamer that just wants a fun romp with insane visuals? It is probably worth it. I have no problems with the gameplay other than they needed more environements to explore. They needed us to really feel the city for it to be one of the greats, and we needed a few more things to do around the city. It doesn't have that oomph and I have to dock a star for it. I can't give this game a six though. In 6 months the game will be 30 bucks and my review would look completely asinine and lame. The game is worth it. If it gets a sequel even doubly so.... you can't miss a product like this whether you rent or buy.It's more Gears of War than Uncharted, and it brings with that moniker all the things you associate with cover shooters. It does it well with a little too much hand holding. All of these things for me are usually expected with a developer's first big game. I fully think their inevitable second game is going to be so much better, kind of like many other games such as Uncharted that were totally dwarfed by their sequel.All in all the game is a mind bender. Insane graphics that make you want a 100 hour game. You just gotta sort through all the fanboy nonsense and BS being spewed by people who cannot handle a game being crowned as the new graphic king. I can see people rating it a 6. But 5s and 4s? Nah, that is just pure clickbait at its finest. I can also see people who look beyond price, rating it a 9. Storytelling it does pretty well. The dialogue is decent enough, and for a videogame it nears the top of the heap. It just doesn't quite feel complete enough to me and it ends too quickly.All in all this game was needed by the industry. We always need the people that are going to push the graphical innovations. I don't want to be stuck playing Pong for 30 years. I want to move forward. And Ready At Dawn has done something to move the industry forward. They didn't quite hit their mark on the first game, but I think they totally deserve a second chance.

Definitely a positive experience here. The graphics are pretty good, though there are noticeable jaggies in some places. It is usually good looking and does its job well. The sound is okay, the story is decent to good, and the platforming is pretty fun. More of a combat/platformer without too much in the way of super complex jumping segments.I don't really like how the different Knacks you can get have to be used on different playthroughs. I wish the devs could have incorporated all the Knacks into the actual game. You only get so many relics so if you want to play with the other Knacks then you have to play multiple times. And really I don't see the point. I have absolutely zero intention of playing through this again. On hard the game is only mildly challenging from time to time. The story isn't that great and all in all it's very linear. Gamers amaze me with their patience, or obsession, in completing menial tasks and then doing them over and over again for little gain. For what it is this is a solid 20 dollar title.I should mention you can even shareplay this with a friend and play Coop throughout the story! Definitely a very cool feature to have around if you have no in the house.

I feel like I need to write a review to balance out all these reviews of the condition of the book. This book is terrible for someone that wants to be led through each section slow and steady with optimum examples and reasoning corresponding directly to the examples. The 'appendix' for each section, especially complex sections like Phonology, is painfully short.It has exercises but absolutely no way to understand how to do those exercises except within the framework of the main definitions of the book and the aforementioned appendix sections. Think of it like a math book with no answers and very few examples on how to work your way through the various problems presented. A study guide is usually very helpful with math but I find it absolutely necessary here.In short I find this book lacking for sections like Phonology. IMO you need the study guide or it's not going to be as clear as it needs to be. I guess with a great teacher and the book it is possible to work your way through it, but for me I was hoping for more.TLDR: Get the study guide. This book by itself is mediocre for learning HOW to actually do problems.

Wow, the reviews on this website for a great film.... never fail to make me laugh. Apparently, with this film the audiences of America thought they were going to get an emotionally--read soap opera--inviting film with everyone having a great time and also a happy ending. For what it is worth rampart is an actual word too. Just saying.... it may have some meaning to the film beyond the police department, as some people seemed to think the film should have been more about this whole scandal.Woody gives one of his very best performances. In fact, all the performances are great. The whole film flows very well to me. Not getting the complaints about the flow of the story at all. It follows this man around during various portions of his daily dealings and introduces us to his home life. It's pretty simple and straight-forward to me. Especially egregious and surprising is not one mention hardly of the excellent father/daughter screenwriting in this film, in all its horrible glory. No, nothing in this film is meant to entertain you really. It's about immersion, it's about coming to grips with reality in a very negative situation.Dealing with Race, Police, Relationships, Brutality, etc. No other film has been this honest for a while about some of these events. It's apparent that most Americans would rather live in a fantasy. It's honestly appalling reading some Amazon reviews. The ignorance is so ridiculous that it becomes a farce just reading through them for me. While not a perfect film, more like 4 stars, I have to give it the fill five here to balance out heavies below. Apparently, this film was badly marketed.

Say Anything is a great film. Probably still Crowe's best film. As you get into the lives of the characters and identify with them, the film becomes more personal. Crowe leads Cusack and Skye to a pair of their best performances, despite their youth. The writing is what brings out the virtuosity in the talents at hand but the soul and heart of the film is in the acters and their ability to play the leads near perfectly.Not much more to say. A classic that holds up to standard even with it's quirky 80s characters.

I got the 770 4GB for a little under 450 dollars. I loved that card and the windforce design. This card is better, has a backplate, and is overall pretty much the same type of experience I had with that card. The 970s are savvy, powerful, and well-made. I have no coil whine on my 1.0 revision. I also use a nice Corsair 750w power supply. This thing is a beauty and actually smaller than I pictured. It is long though with the backplate though so make sure it fits. I for one love it.The major differences from my last experience are that this card retails for 360 dollars and has the performance edge by a mile on high-resolutions and anti-aliasing performance. And after one year and half, a long duration in the tech world at times, the 770 just wasn't quite cutting it with what I wanted: more MSAA, downsampling, supersampling, and also some of the other options like SSAO and high shadows and post processing.Also, because of memory configurations and the new chipset, the 970 uses 3.5GB of its RAM as the main stack and .5 more for lower bandwidth. So far it hasn't been a problem for me at all as the performance is ridiculously better than the 770. My stable overclock right now is a 1404 MHz core with boost, 1853MHz on the memory pool, and +15mV on voltage. It puts the 770 to shame and for much less money.Like people with more tech knowledge than me have said, a lot of it comes down to the design of the card. It has near double the ROPs and near 1/3 more transistors as well compared to the 770. This has to play into what I am seeing in performance, as I can FINALLY play Far Cry 3 with Ultra except High for Post FX, MSAA on 4x or 2x if you want better performance, and more importantly the HDAO on, which is the only good looking SSAO option in game. This with 1080p and it looks amazing. Almost a buttery smooth 60FPS even at 4xMSAA. A couple hiccups here and there.Those settings murdered my 770 for the record. The 970 usually runs through it with only a trip here and there. Fantastic I say. The performance goes on and on. This card is simply a better design all around. I paid a lot for my 770, but I did sell it back for a half as the 4GB version is still a decent card. I have no qualms about it. I love the upgrade. Totally worth it. Just make sure you have a nice power supply. And be sure to get more info on the 3.5GB RAM partition to make sure it doesn't affect your gameplay.Really, this card for me is a transition card. If you are keeping a card for say 4 years, simply don't buy the 900 series at all. If you are keeping this card for 1 year, two years max, then it's totally worth it, especially if you are gaming on your backlog or with games that are current. I assume in 2-3 years games will require more than 4GB of GPU RAM so keep that in mind.All in all the performance was too hard to pass up. I sold my 770 for decent money and paid about 100 more to upgrade this. Well worth it in every way. Just watch out for the 3.5GB RAM line and you are fine. An upgrade to the '1070' is in my future when Nvidia releases the 16nm designs because quite honestly the power of this one card with even full 4GB is not enough to sustain much past another year or so in technology.Ultra settings will be boosted accordingly as consoles are already upping the bottom line by a high standard. Expect 6-8GB of RAM usage in the next 2 years or so. For what you get here this is a great temporary upgrade. All the people that are whining about the .5GB seem to think the card was going to last them for years or something. That is ridiculous. There are already huge limits on this card that will be easily overcome with Nvidia's 16nm cards, which we will probably hear about in the winter. I find the 900 series to be just another solid step in progress line. It's cheap and offers great performance on just about anything out today.

I'm just gonna give this the full five stars. I like this album a lot and it has a lot of different styles to it. The artwork is expressive and the songs are notable. It's definitely its own sound and that is what is best about it. It has a multitude of different variations on sonic themes, and fans of Roy's past work I would think should be fine with it. You get a little bit of everything here and I think the entire thing benefits on the whole from good sequencing as well. It's not my favorite, that would be Temple IV, but it's good. 4.5 stars.

One of his most thematic and enjoyable. Low-fi guitar driven cycles that really make you think and dream. On this one the lull is strong. I like most of Roy's albums, and though he is little known, this stuff is actually very accomplished and fun to enjoy on a day by yourself. Accompany it with an open mind and some herbal love. The album was made after a visit to a rainforest when Ray was dealing with the loss of a loved one. Drone on.

The amazing adventures of the Vampire Empire created by Clay and Susan Griffith continues with the release of The Geomancer.This story begins with Gareth and Adele residing in Britain dealing with the aftermath of The Kingmaker. Excluding Gareth, the vampire presence was eradicated by Adele’s unique gift. So, when gruesome vampire inflicted murders start to plague Britain, Adele and Garth realize someone with abilities in geomancy must be behind this new threat. To stop cataclysmic devastation, Gareth and Adele must face a new quest that takes them across the globe in search off an ancient artifact. It all comes down to a battle of The Geomancers. Whoever controls the artifact will win the war. Unfortunately, Adele is up against a much more knowledgeable foe.First, let me preface my review by saying I’m a total Vampire Empire fan girl. I fell in love with this world and its inhabitants instantly and truly can’t get enough. When I heard about the The Geomancer's release, I was thrilled with the prospect to dive back into this amazing world…I was not disappointed.There was quite a few, I didn’t see it coming and even better, some amazing character developments that left me in awe of how it was masterfully handled. The possibilities are endless and leave you contemplating the what ifs long after you turn the last page.The Geomancer is a dark steampunk fantasy that had me white knuckle reading and leaving me wanting more. This truly is a book that has earned a place on my favorite read shelf and a saga that I'm sure I will be re-reading many time over.I received this ARC copy of The Geomancer from PROMETHEUS BOOKS in exchange for a honest review. This book is set publication November 3, 2015.

While Pia is on an official diplomatic mission to the Light Fae Court, Dragos, undercover, is attacked by creatures that are spreading a horrible plague through Tatiana’s kingdom.It is discovered that Pia, Dragos and all of the Elder Races are at risk from this deadly plague. Not only must they play the political game but they must stop this infection before everyone is at risk.I absolutely love Pia, Dragos and cast but add in Liam and “stink pot” and I’m completely there.I just can’t seem to get enough of Thea Harrison’s Elder Races world. Even this short story had me clinging to the pages. If you are a Harrison fan, don’t miss Pia Does Hollywood.I received this copy of Pia Does Hollywood from Teddy Harrison LLC in exchange for a honest review.

Tayln is the hot commodity and all the shifters want her for their own. How can she ever be safe with so many powerful beings wanting to possess her?Dragons, wolves, mutables, prehistorics Oh, MY!Lycan: Alpha Claim 5 is another action intense installment in the Lycan Alpha Claim serial. Great witty banter, attitude and over the top lust and alpha antics creates a great reprieve from the real world.I received this copy of Lycan: Alpha Claim 5 from Tamara Rose Blodgett in exchange for a honest review.

Post 911 and the Twin Tower attack, a family relocates to the remote town, Arnn, for a fresh start. Orphaned and in the care of her aunt and uncle, Honoria is struggling with her new circumstances.When the town’s witch story reaches Honoria, she wonders if this witch can reunite Honoria with her lost parents. You see, citizens of Arnn have been disappearing for years. Honoria is determined to uncover the secrets behind the woods that have claimed so many, in the hopes to reunite with her parents.The time line jumps back and forth between past and present.Escape from Witchwood Hollow was interesting and suspense filled but keeps children fiction readers in mind with its complexities.The ending was quite shocking and definitely not what I anticipated.I received this copy of Escape from Witchwood Hollow From Jordan Elizabeth Mierek in exchange for a honest review.

You had me at Fey, but Feldman kept me with the new original tale.Nessa is a happily married woman that left her home town and never looked back. Faced with a family emergency, Nessa discovers a family secret that will rock her childhood perceptions.Will she find the strength to carry on and protect the one’s she loves?This was a slow building story that eventually I realized I was completely sucked in.I am a huge, HUGE, fey, fairy, fae, fan so when I was offered C. S. Feldman’s first Fey story of course I was on board. That being said, I am very picky about this topic and I was pleasantly delighted with Feldman’s story.Although, it did have a good amount of suspense and a very creepy villain there was nothing that would keep recommending it to a fantasy teen reader.I’m hopeful that this is a start to a new Feldman world to explore.I received this copy of Fey from C. S. Feldman in exchange for a honest review.

Looking for some holiday fun, check out Three Nights before Christmas.Lacey is a recent parole, thrust back into a life she was ripped from 3 years prior.The man who was the catalyst behind her incarceration doesn’t think he can trust her but needs her train expertise to make a Christmas wish come true.This is a slow building romance, with lots of character growth and mutual appreciation.I have to admit, I was a little reluctant about an ex-con falling in love with the lawman storyline but Latham works it out perfectly. My apprehension was for not.Cute, quick and very enjoyable, Three Nights before Christmas is a heartwarming Christmas love story.I received this copy of Three Nights before Christmas from Tule Publishing- Montana Born Books in exchange for a honest review.

Kenna’s StoryWhen someone is banging on her door, Kenna is sent down a path that will change her life forever. Everything she knew about herself and her life with her mother is about to drastically change. Kenna discovers the world of the Fae and that she is one of them.Now that she knows they exist, she visits the world often but won't truly be one of them until her 18th birthday.It all comes down to Light or Dark Fae and which world Kenna must abide.I loved Blood Tree: Part 1. I'm a fae junky to begin with but this offers such a unique and original tale, I devoured the story and still wanted more. Thankfully its just the beginning, because I can't wait to see what comes next.Juliet’s StoryJuliet’s side of the story, Juliet being Kenna’s mother.Ostracized from the light fae world by her own parents because she is pregnant with what could possibly be a dark fae child, Juliet must traverse a new world on her own.Juliet has sacrificed and done everything she could to give Kenna the best life possible while trying to guide her into the world of the light fae but ultimately blood can’t be denied.Now it seems Juliet has decided to take something back for herself and oh, boy is it something big. Maybe back isn't the right word but she is realizing that Kenna won't always be around and needing her, so its time she starts living for herself too.Juliet is unexpected reunited with Kenna’s father on the very night Kenna discovers her true mate.It all comes down to light and dark, love and lust... Can the two every meet and what happens when it does? Honestly, I can’t wait to find out!Part Two gives us greater insight into the Blood Tree community with some shocking and amazing revelations to boot.Susan’s StoryTo Susan, Losing her best friend, Juliet, was devastating. She has always hoped for the reconciliation of their friendship and always watch from the side lines to help when needed.Susan is under Randor’s command, on a special mission for the light fae, watch over their leader and his mate. This puts her back on the side lines watching but this time its Juliet’s daughter and her King lives at stake. Whispers of a plot that could tear their world apart is all Susan has to go by but she will do her best as always.Susan has always harbored a yearning for her commander, Randor, but he’s never shown her any signs of interest. Now he is dropping hints, he wants more. Can she have everything she dreamed of having, her friend, Randor, or will a pride filled plot tear her dreams of friendship and love to shreds?Wow, I didn’t see that coming. Talk about serious family issues.With the addition of Susan’s side of the story, I just can’t help but still want more.The combination of these three character’s story to make Blood Tree: Silver Edition truly a romantic urban fantasy on steroids, you can’t help but become engrossed in their lives. Total. Book. Hangover.First I have to say, OMG! Where does Dawn come up with these fabulous stories? They seem to just pop out of nowhere and blow me away every time. Her creativity is pure genius and her writing style completely sucks me in…EVERY.FREAKIN’.TIME.Blood Tree: Silver Edition is another obvious must read by Ms. Dawn; an imagination explosion put into a marvelous storytelling for us to enjoy. Light Fae, Dark Fae, we have been gifted with an entirely new world to explore!I received this copy of Blood Tree: Silver Edition from Scarlett Dawn in exchange for a honest review.

The Blue Dagger and the Prince of Illumine is a fantastical debut novel by Thomas J. Lupo.In a world saturated by magic, Galatar, with his family’s blue daggar, heads out to stop the destruction of the villages and solve the mystery behind the missing children. Galatar is accompanied by an eccentric crew that he picks up along the way. Facing an evil beyond compare, they must band together to survive and maybe just spark the start of an ancient prophecy...As an epic fantasy, I couldn’t help but be thrilled by this new adventure created by Thomas J. Lupo. The cast faced unsurmountable danger and evil but with mishaps, humor and mayhem they trudge on. Lupo has found that balance of emotions that is required to connect the reader to the story.Told with the tactility of a scifi fantasy, The Blue Dagger and the Prince of Illumine pops off the pages and brings this magical world to life.I received this copy of The Blue Dagger and the Prince of Illumine from Thomas J. Lupo in exchange for a honest review.

The queen of writing alpha males, Kristen Ashley, does it again with her newest Steaming. Hot. Alpha. Logan “High” Judd.Logan “High” Judd was always the troubled brother at the Chaos motorcycle club’s compound. Walk Through Fire is Logan’s story.Years ago, Millie Cross broke Logan’s heart. He thought she left because she was too good for him, but she really left to give Logan his dreams. Logan recovered, Millie never did.An unexpected Logan sighting rips the festering wounds in Millie’s heart wide open. Millie wants a chance to tell Logan the truth behind their break up but when Logan sees Millie, he takes all his hurt and pain out on her again.Walk Through Fire is an extraordinary and heart felt story of second chances. You get a front row seat to an amazing story.With Ashley’s brand of storytelling, you can’t help but become riveted to the pages, while experiencing their hurt and ultimate joy.I would highly recommend Walk Through Fire. This novel actually ignited my re-read-a-thon of all of Ashley’s works. Yup, still as awesome as I remembered.I received this sweet arc copy of Walk Through Fire from Forever (Grand Central Publishing) in exchange for a honest review.

If you are looking for a brilliant and steamy romantic suspense, check out Shattered.Bad boy, Jax goes head to head with Sarah, the profiler. When they met, they had a connection, now Jax wants to see where it will lead. He hires the Lost team and specifically Sarah to help uncover his past.Sarah has always been a unique character, growing up with a love of a father who happened to be a serial killer. Her past gives her unique insight into the minds of others. She is reluctant to let anyone in but there is something about Jax that keeps pulling her closer.Could you say I didn’t see that coming, I was left wow’d and stunned.This novel was absolutely adrenaline inducing, the pages’ burn with emotions and pulse pounding action....and if you want to talk about tension, you can practically see the sexual tension; it is such a physical thing.Cynthia Eden shoots it out of the ball park with the hot as Hades, fabulous new addition to LOST series, ShatteredI received this ARC copy of Shattered from Avon in exchange for a honest review.

Callie just found out that the gods and goddesses really do exist and she is caught in the middle of a war. To top it off, Callie is believed to be the Viking leader reincarnated. Training as fast as she can, Callie who didn't even know Vikings still existed is facing a seriously uphill battle.When frost giants threaten everyone she holds dear, Callie must do whatever she can to save her family and friends, even if they don't have much faith in her ability to pull them through.Goddess is a very creative and original take on gods, goddesses, demigods and vikings all existing in the modern world.I enjoyed the story but never felt that connection needed to completely pull me in. 3.5 Stars.I received this ARC copy of Goddess from Kensington Books - Lyrical Press in exchange for a honest review.

Reid Parker owns multiple car restoration shops. When some of his prime business is going to a rival shop he goes to investigate, only to find an all woman shop with top grade work...but what captures his attention the most was a fiery and very sexy woman, Rusty, at the wheel. Now Reid has found two things he must have West Restorations and Rusty West.Rusty, her sister and best friend have taken over her dad's restoration shop, West Restorations. They are known for the quality and workman (or should I say workwoman) ship. Rusty doesn't have much trust or use for a man, so when her belly quivers at the sight of her competition, Rusty does everything she can to avoid him.Lots of sexual tension makes the boiling attraction explode in this marvelous contemporary romance.I couldn't help thinking of the common restoration shows that have crowded the airwaves lately while reading, Revved. My only thought was, how great would it be to have a female ran garage...it would be the making of an awesome TV show especially if it was anything like this incredible story.Rusty is strong, independent, motivated and absolutely one smart cookie.I absolutely loved delving into these pages and can't wait for more.I received this ARC copy of Revved from Entangled Publishing, LLC - Indulgence in exchange for a honest review.

First Time with a Highlander brings us a business advertising mogul who finds himself swept back in time to 1700 Scotland. Not only does Gerard wake up in the past but he is buck naked in bed with the beautiful Serabeth.They must work together to traverse treachery, betrayal and the romantic tension that blooms between them.I liked First Time with a Highlander. It has plenty of humor, romance and strong women leading the charge to save Scotland.A quick, easy, entertaining read, First Time with a Highlander has it all..Kilts, Romance and Time Travel, where could you go wrong.I received this ARC copy of First Time with a Highlander from SOURCEBOOKS Casablanca in exchange for a honest review.

Laurel MacTire and her sisters have a successful business of renovating and flipping old hotels. This time they might have bitten off more than the can chew. The hotel is claimed to be haunted, the town is filled with unmated shifter wolf males and CJ has an undeniable pull toward Laurel. So, why take on this hotel? The ladies know that their long lost aunt disappeared years ago while visiting their newest project. They are keeping their ears and eyes wide open, hoping to find out what happened. Is their aunt the ghost that haunts their hotel? Can the local pack be trusted? Trusted or not, the bottom line for the pack is she wolves have moved into town and all the unmated males are about to come sniffing around.A Silver Wolf Christmas is another wonderful shifter romance from Terry Spear, a fun, fast, and a delightfully charming Christmas based read. More romance, less wolf story, this little gem is just in time for the Holiday Season.I received this ARC copy of A Silver Wolf Christmas from SOURCEBOOKS Casablanca in exchange for a honest review.

Sometimes scars go deep and sometimes it’s almost impossible to pull yourself out of that abyss those scars push you to. Lead guitarist, Noah, has known the scars that hit deep. With no support from his family, the scars where left to fester, turning Noah a man looking for a way to forget.Kit befriended a group of artist when they were just a bunch of unknown musicians and she was just a waitress.
