Now their band is topping the charts and she is an up and coming actor.Kit knew Noah’s history with women but the more she got to know him the more she fell in love…until he devastated her heart with one planned, careless, act that destroyed their friendship and caused a rift that seemed unbreachable.Years later, Noah finds himself at a particularly low point in his life and Kit comes running to the rescue. He realizes that he should of never of let her leave his life and has no intention of ever letting her get away again.Emotionally gripping and heartfelt, Singh writes a love story that comes with a bite. Sometimes life plays you a hard hand. Once again, Singh captures the essence of that hard life and marvelously converts into the art of words. Rock Redemption is a moving story to devour.Always one of my go to authors, I highly recommend Nalini Singh's Rock Redemption.I received this ARC copy of Rock Redemption from TKA Distribution in exchange for a honest review

A cute and touching holiday novella, Unwrapping Her Perfect Match, makes you want to drag out the Christmas decorations and get into the spirit of the holidays.Rugby player, John, and nurse, Gwen, had a rocky start. After a tragic accident, John ends up in Gwen’s hospital in need of home care over the holidays. Gwen reluctantly decides to help him out…but soon she is swept up by his charm and his French daughter who is visiting for Christmas.Delightful, sweet and endearing but still having plenty of steam, Unwrapping Her Perfect Match is a great book to add to your Christmas reading list.I received this copy of Unwrapping Her Perfect Match from Kat Latham in exchange for a honest review.

The Dark Savage: 6.4 is the next addition in the serial paranormal, steampunk, scifi, fantasy by Tamara Rose Blodgett. In this installment, Jim finds himself once again in enemy hands. Betrayal, unexpected allies and intrigue surround the cast while they traverse this harsh world created by greed and evil intent.Once again, Blodgett pulls us into her extremely vivid and imaginative world and gives us enough story to whet our appetites but keeps us coming back for more.

Dragos and the rest of the Wyr leaders have decided to face the rising tension between the humans and Wyr kind by meeting with the human political leaders in Washington DC. It is quickly discovered that many humans are using the discord between Wyr and human kind to enhance their political aspiration. When a political figure is found murdered, in the Dragos home, during a cocktail party, he must pull out his centuries of cunning to keep a bad situation from turning worse.I Love, Love, Love the Elder Races series. Dragos Goes to Washington is a novella that focuses on my core base of favorites from this series, ie Dragos and Pia. That being said, Thea Harrison had me from the start but she then proceeded to provide a wonderfully told story that captured me immediately and held me till the end. Quick, easy and very entertaining!I received this ARC copy of Dragos Goes to Washington from Teddy Harrison LLC in exchange for a honest review.

The battle between the Scintilla and Arazzi is coming to a head. The secrets, deceptions and lies are slowly becoming uncovered. What is truth, myth and religious zealous striving for more power comes to light, pushing the three main characters into survival mode, which also sends them apart for some of their journey to enlightenment.I loved the first two books in this series but I am completely conflicted about Illuminate.The telling is extremely imaginative and original and the ending was totally unexpected but still kind of predictable. You thought that was where it was going but it just was not where you wanted it to head. I held onto hope that Clark was going to pull the proverbial magic rabbit out of the hat and gives us the ending we're all hoping for...that was NOT the case for me.That being said, for me to feel so attached to the story Clark did something absolutely right. I utterly cared about the outcome and the characters plight. Kudos for the amazing storytelling!I received this ARC copy of Illuminate from Entangled Publishing, LLC - Entangled: Teen in exchange for a honest review.

The Heat of the Moment by Katie RoseThe Heat of the Moment is a sweet, sexy and endearing baseball romance.Jessica Hart is a physical therapist for the Jersey Sonics. She has a strict rule, never get involved with her clients which was great until she meets Gavin King.Gavin was at the top of his game until a knee injury might destroy his chances of ever returning at top performance again. Now he just has to keep his head down, take it easy and leave the fiery red headed Jessica be. That is much easier said than done because the pull between them is absolutely magnetic.Gavin is a strong alpha character with just the right amount of vulnerability. He’s not one to sit easily on the side lines.Jessica is a woman who knows herself and what she wants. She grew up knowing a brother had her back. Jessica builds a friendship with Gavin that evolves, it isn’t an insta-love situation, making it realistic and pulling you deeper into the story.The Heat of the Moment was a great contemporary romance. I enjoyed watching the story unfold. If you are a sports romance fan, then The Heat of the Moment is the perfect book for you.I received this ARC copy of The Heat of the Moment from Random House Publishing Group - Loveswept in exchange for a honest review.

Titus is the law in a city that has become pretty lawless. He believes in right and wrong even when it meant sending his own brother to jail. When Reeve returns to the Point, the attraction between them can’t be denied but Reeve has been on the wrong side of Titus’s right.Reeve is a nice person who has made some really bad life choices in her quest for vengeance and now she has to face the consequences. When a bad element makes it self known in the point, Reeve decides she wants to help. Reeve now must prove that she is the good person to herself and those around her.The cop and criminal, both needing something missing in their lives, Better When He’s Brave is the story of Reeve and Titus finding that something.Life in the Point is dark and intense and definitely not for the light hearted reader.I found Better When He’s Brave to be suspenseful, packed full of plenty of romantic steam while still managing to balance the action, love and real life drama.The characters are genuine and their plight heartfelt but the overall tone was a little to dark and the topics they face to cringe worthy for me.I received this ARC copy of better When He's Brave from William Morrow Paperbacks in exchange for a honest review.

Lea's mother married an alien. We come into the story after her mother's bonding, with Lea's step brother's showing up at her office to tell her she was both their mates.Without a doubt this tale is carnal, get your fire extinguishers ready but it is short so just when the story seemed to get going it ended. Lots of sex, sass, more sex and uber alpha aliens.If you enjoy short, flaming hot erotic encounters, Her Stepbrothers Are Aliens is the book for you.I received this copy of Her Stepbrothers Are Aliens from Riverdale Avenue Books - Desire in exchange for a honest review.

Political correctness has never been a consideration for the Dallas SWAT team until the powers to be demand they add a woman to their ranks. Instead of accepting any woman, the team is determined to find a fellow wolfshifter…but none are sure another woman truly does exist…until they meet Khaki Blake.Khaki has been left out to dry one too many times by her fellow officers due to a relationship gone bad with a fellow co-worker. When the opportunity arises to join the renown Dallas SWAT, she jumps at the chance. Khaki quickly discovers that her new found abilities are shared by every other member in this new assignment. She will do whatever it takes to make the grade because this is where she truly belongs, her only obstacle, Senior Corporal Xander Riggs.Xander can’t seem to handle the attraction and protectiveness he feels for the new trainee, Khaki. It is a rocky road they traverse but in the end it becomes beyond what either of them ever considered.Wolf Trouble is a wonderfully exciting, action packed story.The relationship is pretty rough going, with lots of resistance and bad decisions.In the end, I found Wolf Trouble to be a great example of paranormal romance storytelling.I received this ARC copy of Wolf Trouble from Sourcebooks Casablanca in exchange for a honest review.

Starry Knight was a good start to a new paranormal romance series. The overall story and premise was strong which has amazing potential become a favorite read for me. There was a shifter, faery, vampire, ghost and the human element all proposed with a unique and very original view on their creation. For that reason alone, kudos to Nina Mason.For the story, it was a little slow at times going but absolutely found it to be enjoyable and entertaining enough for me to definitely want to continue on.  3.5 StarsI received this ARC copy of Starry Knight from Kensington Books - Lyrical Press in exchange for a honest review.

Willow thinks she's crazy. She was committed to a mental facility for killing someone she saw trying to kill her in her dreams.When a new psychiatrist comes to the facility and its a man from her dreams...in a good way...Willow doesn't know what to make of it. Is her dreams for real?Since this is a relationship building between psychiatrist and patient, it isn't a smooth love match. Mostly Smoke on the Water is the transition Willow makes into realizing her true powers, discovering who she is and the building of the relationship between Sebastian and Willow.This is the final culmination of three sisters coming together, Raye, Becca and Willow. Each sister had an exciting story but putting them together was decadent.The Sisters of the Craft series is wonderfully exciting, highly entertaining and thrilled this paranormal romance reading fan.I give Smoke on the Water 4.5 stars.I received this ARC copy of Smoke on the Water from St. Martin's Press in exchange for a honest review.

Seduced in Secret by Shiloh WalkerA secret admirer has turned Tessa’s life upside down and makes her question her relationship with her fiancee.Tessa turns to her best friend and neighbor, Caleb to help her work through her feelings. But as Caleb start to worm his way into Tessa’s heart as more than her best friend, Tessa must decide between losing her heart to Caleb or holding out for a secret admirer she never met.Seductively sexy, Seduced in Secret was a marvelously entertaining contemporary romance.I received this ARC copy of Seduced in Secret from Shiloh Walker, Inc. in exchange for a honest review.

Utterly cute and absolutely endearing, Right Wrong Guy is that perfect contemporary romance you long to find.Archer and Eden have a chance encounter after what can only be considered hitting the emotional rock bottom. Archer has to return home to take the reins of his family’s ranch, after another unfulfilling one night stand. Eden discovers that her finance is only marrying her for her money and becomes the run away heiress in her wedding gown.When the runaway bride hitches a ride to Archer’s home town the carefully laid plans both have made for their lives get blown out of the water. This is the story of them rediscovering what truly makes them happy.Right Wrong Guy was one of those stories that captures you fully. The characters jump to life off the pages. The story worms its way into your heart and you find yourself delightfully engulfed in Archer’s and Eden’s lives. Making Right Wrong Guy is a splendid escape.THis is my first read by Lia Riley, definitely WON'T be my last.I received this ARC copy of Right Wrong Guy from Avon Impulse in exchange for a honest review.

Primal Heat was steamy, fast paced and action intense.Eli is the sworn protector for the leader of the shifters. Nivea is a trainee that has been on Eli's radar for quite some time. When things all go to hell, Eli and Nivea finally have to admit the animal magnetism that they have avoided for 6 years is real and highly explosive.This was a good story, creative and imaginative but the characters lacked depth. Overall, I enjoyed this read but didn't connect to the characters like I have in previous installments.I received an ARC copy of Primal Heat from St. Martin's Press in exchange of an honest review.

Warning: This is an explicit read.This is Rain's and Dorian's story.Rain is a mortal living in the Tetartos realm and her best friend was mated to a Guardian. After attending the wedding she can't get the big blond Guardian, Dorian out of her head.Dorian knows he found his mate in Rain but refuses to accept it. Destroyed by a past lover, Dorian doesn't believe he deserves happiness and he absolutely doesn't trust a woman...so how can he tie himself forever to a mortal woman?Jay writes ignitable situations that sizzle off the pages. The story is EROTIC with a capital E but is also balanced with a strong plot. If you are looking for a page burning erotic read, Denying Ecstasy is the book for you.I received this copy of Denying Ecstasy from Setta Jay, LLC in exchange for a honest review.

I unequivocally L.O.V.E.D. Reading Obsidian Mask!Russian mafia leader, Daniil Kozar is now in a relationship with pop journalist and minister's daughter, Elizabeth Forter. If that doesn't make for interesting reading then maybe you should come meet the rest of the family.Sexy, fun, fast, and outrageously humorous family dynamics, Obsidian Mask is undoubtedly hitting my re-read worthy shelf. Actually as soon as I read the last page I wanted to re-read both Obsidian Liquor and Obsidian Mask back to back. Yes, it definitely had that WOW factor.I'm anxiously awaiting more of the Kozar and Forter clans Ms. Dawn.I received this copy of Obsidian Mask from Scarlett Dawn in exchange for a honest review.My Rating: 5 Stars

Strung tighter than a bow string, the tension in The Dark Savage 6.3 just keeps building.We delve deeper into Ulric and his role as the lead alpha to the tree people, while he plays host to the group that has escaped by the skin of their teeth...but not all came away unscathed. Jim will forever be changed by his ordeal.This story is a fast and easy read but contains complex details with even deeper insight into these characters. Jim by far has jumped right off the pages with Ulric showing us more depth then I anticipated.The Dark Savage: 6.3 is a marvelous serial read that engulfs us into a colorful science fiction world that is absolutely mind blowing. The perfect balance of snark, action and imagination.I received this copy of The Dark Savage: 6.3 from Tamara Rose Blodgett in exchange for a honest review.

The most lethal and merciless demon hunter, Lillian Dellacourt is about to face her biggest challenge of all, because all hell is about to break loose and she just might be the only thing standing between us and them.Dorian Lambert was sent to keep his eye on Lillian but quickly finds himself neck deep in demons.The attraction is electrifying, the action is non-stop and the suspense will have you biting your nails. Fenichel perfectly combines just the right amount of historical, romance and paranormal making for a marvelously enchanting but also a dark and demon infested read.I received this ARC copy of Deception from Kensington Books - Lyrical Press in exchange for a honest review.

Sight is a great start to a new young adult paranormal series.Savannah is a teen who has just woken up from a coma. She finds herself with the ability to see into the future, but she isn’t the only one changed. It seems that when Savannah woke from her coma, something woke up gifts in her and all her sisters…all five of them. Each gift gives them a different perspective of an event by enhanced senses.Lots of action, wonderful family bonds between the five sisters, and a genuinely sweet but fast paced story, Sight is a great prelude for more to come.An all around delightful read, Sight provides the perfect dose of magic, mystery and just plan enjoyable entertainment.I received this ARC copy of Sight from Diversion Books in exchange for a honest review.

Carolyn was the rich country club girl who lost it all, ending up working at the very country club she use to belong to.Jake was the boy from the wrong side of town, who worked at the country club until Carolyn's father had him arrested and driven away from his daughter. Now he's back, a big wig on the real estate scene, purchasing the country club and becoming Carolyn's boss.The story had lots of potential with some interesting twists and turns but for the most part I didn't feel any character connection. Well, no character connection until the last 1/3 or so of the plot...Carolyn's strength of character was a major plus for the story but that seems to vacillate, which seems totally out of character, when things start to turn around for her.Once and Again was a story of bitter sweet reunions, second chances and making the most out of what life hands you. Overall, I found I liked it. It was an endearing and a cute contemporary romance.I received this ARC copy of Once and Again from Random House Publishing Group - Loveswept in exchange for a honest review.

Lead Me Home is a wonderful contemporary romance.Jaded city girl, Chloe Garrison, gets up close and personal with cowboy, Nick Westing. Every since she met Nick, she’s been drawn to him. She sets her sites on a “vacation” fling while visiting her best friend and makes it very clear to Nick that all. But even with the time they share, Chloe's heart begins to crack open...making her run.Nick decides to joins his brother on a photo shoot for Chloe in NYC; all of Chloe’s perfectly constructed guards begin to crumble. Nick sees her pain but he knows she is worth fighting for and will do everything he can to smash that crumbling wall and make sure it falls to dust.Lead Me Home is a seductive and highly sexual read. Both Nick and Chloe enjoy plenty of play time which leads to many sexual encounters; boy do they really heat up the pages.Nick’s seduction of Chloe is quite sweet. He keen insight into both Chloe’s hidden and visible personas. Although he is willing to give her time to work through her issues, Nick also pushes her gently and erotically the right direction.If you are looking for a hot and steamy contemporary romance, Lead Me Home is excellent choice.I received this ARC copy of Lead Me Home from Samhain Publishing in exchange for a honest review.

Cross once again takes us on an amazing adventure to the bowels of hell and back in Bound in Black.Gen Drake will stop at nothing to save the one she loves from the soul collector, Lethe. Even if it means making a deal with the devil, or should I say demons. But it isn’t about her anymore, she has another life she holds in her hands.The balance of the world lays at Gen's feet. Will good or evil prevail.The prophecy is unraveling and the demon powers that be are not afraid to use Gen’s family and best friends as pawns in their deadly game.Gen will have to make a loose, loose choice and it all comes down to whether she will be able to survive her decision.Pulse pounding action had me white knuckle reading this story. I just couldn’t put down.Cross has created a top notch urban fantasy in The Vessel Trilogy. Even though this is book 3 in this trilogy, I would be all for more of Gen Drake’s world. I highly recommend this trilogy and for anyone to delve into Juliette Cross’s imaginings you won't regret it.I received this ARC copy of Bound in Black from Samhain Publishing in exchange for a honest review.

A human young woman stumbles into the world of dragons by accidentally rescuing aother woman who ends up be a princess to the dragon shifters.Soul of Smoke had a unique and colorful world where dragon shifters remain on the periphery of humankind. The story was interesting leaving the reader with a giant cliffhanger and feeling somewhat incomplete. I will definitely have to read on to get more of a feel for this storyline.The overall read was good, entertaining and had a very interesting premise. In the end, I give Soul of Smoke 3.5 stars.I received this ARC copy of Soul of Smoke from Carina Press in exchange for a honest review.

Baby's Got Bite is a rapid moving love story between Bennett Langdon and Linc Monahan.After a one night stand, Bennett finds herself pregnant with Linc's baby. Bennett was totally unprepared to be a mother but she quickly discovers that not only is she pregnant but Linc is a werewolf and she is now also thrust into the supernatural world she never knew existed and all the politic that entails.It isn't insta-love but a relationship that grows while friendship and mutual trust grow.The story seems to open the possibility for a bridge to branch the divide between of the supernatural community. Leaving a few plot directions open,, you wonder if these questions will be answered in installments in the stories to come.I found Baby's Got Bite to be a nice, easy and entertaining paranormal romance.I received this ARC copy of Baby's Got Bite from Entangled Publishing, LLC - Covet in exchange for a honest review.

Once again Kaite MacAlister, you had me at Jim.Dragon Fall is the first book in a new spin off series by Katie MacAlister. Same world, lots of character crossovers and that same witty snark we've come to love and expect from this wonderfully inventive author.I have to admit, I wasn't sure where the story was heading in the first chapter or so and then I washooked.  I also had serious issues with the sister.I found Dragon Fall a fabulous new urban fantasy to sink your teeth into. Sexy, witty and highly entertaining its a must read for all MacAlister fans.Exciting new dragon tale.I received this ARC copy of Dragon Fall from Forever (Grand Central Publishing) in exchange for a honest review.

I absolutely devoured If He's Noble.Primrose is running from an evil aunt and a horrible marriage arrangement. She hopes to find her brother so he can save her from her aunt's nefarious plans. Instead she runs into Bened Vaughn, who in all good conscience can't allow Primrose to search on her own.The chemistry is electrifying.The story riveting.The aunt absolutely villianess.Wonderfully suspenseful, If He's Noble brings a slightly paranormal flare to a marvelous historical romance.I received this ARC copy of If He's Noble from Kensington Books - Zebra in exchange for a honest review.

Oblivion is the final book and the conclusion to the Nevermore series.You can’t say this book is lacking action, it is intense. Nail bitting, edge of your seat intense...I found Oblivion a little more descriptive than the rest of the series, which I felt slowed the pace down a little.The entire series is going on my re-readable shelf.Creagh has written a mystifying tale that rivets you to the pages. She brilliantly weaves the mystique of Poe into a fresh, contemporary, darkly twisting tale that keeps us guessing till the end.I received this ARC copy of Oblivion from Atheneum Books for Young Readers in exchange for a honest review.

I absolutely love this series. Thirteen books in and its still going strong.Gin is up against a “super power,”  a mysterious new foe and as the boss of the underworld she must maintain the peace. Politics has never been her strong suit so she's learning to rely on her friends and people she trusts more and more. A blast from the past, will keep Gin at the top of her game while she learns to take the reigns of her new position...even if it kills her.Reading Spider's Trap is like coming home to old friends. Estep writes real people that you can't wait to hear how they are doing. The core group seems to continually grow but the ties that bind us, aka Gin, just keeps getting better and better.I highly recommend Elemental Assassin to any paranormal, urban fantasy fan. Its a series that should not be missed. I just can't get enough.I received this ARC copy of Spider's Trap from Pocket Books in exchange for a honest review.

It is finally coming to ahead. The insane and vengeful demigod wants the totally destruction of England and the only thing standing in his way is Simon and his band of supernatural friends.Mystery, suspense, some romance, a group that has slowly developed bonds closer than a blood and magically induces mayhem make The Conquering Dark a fantastical fantasy read.I love the world team Griffith has created. They have created the perfectly dark, magic infused, steampunk action adventure to immerse yourself in.I received this ARC of The Conquering Dark from Random House Publishing Group - Del Rey Spectra in exchange for a honest review.

The Highlander Takes A Bride is a wickedly sensual but sweet historical romance.Saidh, raised by her brothers, has little fear and is ready to take on anyone that gets in her way.Greer is a reluctant Laird that is taken by the unconventional Saidh.Saidh and Greer made a perfect couple with strong chemistry and a burning passion for life. When Saidh’s life is threatened it will take everything they have just to stay alive.The Highlander Takes A Bride is one part delightfully sweet, one part delightfully spicy then turn in an unexpected villain and it makes a highly entertaining read.I received this ARC copy of The Highlander Takes A Bride from Avon in exchange for a honest review.

What happens when Candis Terry combines a tough as nails, wounded marine with sweet single mom… you get an amazing, sweet and endearing romance to get utterly lost in.From start to finish, the Sweet, Texas series has been a delightful journey. Truly Sweet is pure icing on this heartwarming proverbial cake!Swoon worthy, emotionally engaging and completely realistic characters, Truly Sweet was the perfect contemporary romance read.I received this ARC copy of Truly Sweet from Avon in exchange for a honest review.

Igniting the pages with erotic romance, Ecstasty Claimed is a vividly descriptive jaunt into the supernatural world of the “Guardians of the Realm”.Greogoire has guarded the human realm from evil for centuries knowing his mate existed. When he receives a call from his mates family, he rushes only to discover that his mate has run away.Alyssa has always held the fairy tale dream of having a true mate. When she discovers that her family has misled her and her mate hasn’t claimed her, Alyssa feels betrayed and rejected. Instead of taking the blow to her ego, Alyssa decides to find the best happiness she can and runs to a hedonistic paradise to discover the pleasures of life.The evil battle between the gods threatens Greogorie’s chances to claim his long waited for mate in this extremely sensual charged storytelling.Ecstasy Claimed contains a great balance of story to steam. The core is erotic in nature but Setta Jay has paired this tale with an action intense plot that pulls the reader into this battle of good and evil.Holy hotness guardian, this series covers are as flammable as the storyline.I received this copy of Ecstasy Claimed from Setta Jay, LLC in exchange for a honest review.

Page scorching, Ecstasy Unbound is a power packed erotic paranormal romance.Gods, demigods, and all those supernatural creatures in between fill a cast of this action intense plot. Speaking of plots, there is a very strong plot, lots of world building and enough heat to burn the pages right out of your hands, Setta Jay has created the perfect balance of storytelling and erotica.No gentle romance here, the content is adult only and graphic.I received this copy of Ecstasy Unbound from Setta Jay, LLC in exchange for a honest review.

Must Love Chainmail was a marvelously quirky, time traveling romance that captivated me from the start.Katy is a little schedule OCD. So, when she accidentally whisks herself back in time she must learn how to live without her day planner.Sir Robert Beucol, is striving for an English family redemption and nothing is going to stand in his way... until a sassy woman dressed as a lad crashes into his plan.Surviving a treacherous journey across Wales is the least of Robert and Katy's problems when they are faced with the truth behind Welsh uprising.Both characters must reevaluate their life choices and ultimately decide what do they truly value the most.Fun, fast and fabulously entertaining, Must Love Chainmail was a simply perfect reading adventure.I received this copy of Must Love Chainmail from Angela Quarles in exchange for a honest review.

Braita is barely eighteen when her world and own people ships her off to the planet Triaz as a slave. This is Braita’s adventure and battle for freedom.Be prepared to be immersed in Braita’s amazing journey. You will be pushed through the gambit of emotions as the spit fire, Braita faces challenges and choices that would weaken even the toughest of warriors. What I loved most about this tale is Braita’s willingness to fight for the freedom she so desires even if it means bucking the system.I read this story originally as a serial. When I first completed the final serial, I thought it would be great to go back and all the serials whole. That is exactly what Cold Mark – The Complete Saga provided.Cold Mark - The Complete Saga is a non-stop, science fiction, action adventure with heated attractions, incredible world building and also manages to provide heartfelt, emotional connections to characters. In other words, the complete package…making a marvelously and superbly executed entertaining storytelling.I received this copy of Cold Mark - The Complete Saga from Scarlett Dawn in exchange for a honest review.

How can a 640 page novel seem to fly by? Because, Ride Steady is utterly enthralling!Once again, Kristen Ashley rocks the pages with heart, home, romance, seduction and bikers…yes, bikers. The Chaos motorcycle club is back in all their hot alpha glory.Carissa’s high school dream life has completely fallen apart. She is a single mom, struggling financially while her rich, attorney ex is trying to destroy her, when Carson “Joker” Steele, Carissa's high school crush, and the Chaos club comes to her rescue.Bringing in a boat load of past characters to rally around the couple, is only icing on the cake to an already 5 star read making Ride Steady one of my top favorite storylines. Okay let’s be honest here, I haven’t meet an Ashley book I didn’t love and frankly I’ve read them all. From paranormal, contemporary romance to fantasy, Ashley is the queen of hot alphas and the powerful chicks that learn to love them. While I'm at it, I just have to mention as a fan girl, I squeal every time there is a crossover between Ashley's series as well.I flat out LOVED Ride Steady, it’s that simple.If you are a hot alpha loving, strong female with friends, romance reader, you NEED to read Ride Steady.I received this ARC copy of Ride Steady from Forever (Grand Central Publishing) in exchange for a honest review.
This is my second solitaire as I lost my other one but the build quality seems the same as my other one. I would give 5 stars but there are cheaper options for flashlights this size.

In terms of bluetooth speakers, I own a Jabra mini, Jambox mini, Big Jambox and a Bose Soundlink III. I would rate this Philips as ahead of the Jabra mini and Jambox mini in terms of sound quality and volume. The Philips is slightly larger than the the Jabra and Jambox but the sound is much better and worth the extra size. The sound seems much crisper at higher volumes. The 360 sound is perfect for any room or even outdoors since it's omni directional. The speaker itself is very easy to pair and then there is a twist dial which serves as the power and volume control. It's great that the speaker is splash proof so you don't have to be as careful. You can stand the speaker vertically or horizontally so it fits really anywhere you want it to. It does not come with a case but it feels pretty rugged so you can just toss it in your backpack and go. If you really want volume though, the Big Jambox (way bigger and more expensive) is the loudest of any of the speakers I have owned/tried. Overall though, I would choose this Philips speaker for it's size and sound quality at higher volumes!

This is by far the lightest weight stroller that I have used that wasn't an umbrella stroller. We have a 2+ year old toddler and we have been using it around town lifting it in and out of our SUV. Some of the great features are that it is very lightweight and easily foldable even one handed to put into the car. There are 2 ways to collapse the stroller, the most convenient being a twist action on the handle. When you twist you simply collapse the whole stroller. The stroller maneuvers fairly well and can get in and out of crowded areas pretty well. The seat also reclines quite a bit so it makes for easy napping. The wheels have a pretty interesting locking mechanism in that you lock the wheels by pushing down on 1 side of the wheels and unlock on the other side. The undercarriage provides ample storage for the size of the stroller. Now for the some of the bad issues, I am an ok height at 5'9" and I feel pretty comfortable with the handle position but the handle is quite high and I can imagine someone shorter might feel pretty uncomfortable (the handlebar is not adjustable). The canopy provides decent coverage but does not go that far down as to provide full coverage. The last negative is that there is quite a bit of lateral movement in the frame structure if you make a really sharp turn (there is some flex in the frame). Overall though, our toddler seemed very content in the stroller and I would probably recommend this to friends that are taller and were looking for the lightest weight stroller.

If your toddler likes the zoo, he'll like this little people zoo toy set. It also just so happens that our toddler loves elephants and monkeys so he especially enjoys the toy. The toy comes with the main stage with a tree top, washing station and scale. Of course these are all pretend. It also comes with a talking elephant which has a moveable snout and legs. The sound from the elephant comes from pulling his tail or pushing the mouse. There is also a monkey, a zookeeper and girl that comes with it. There are also 2 balls that represent "elephant food". Overall a great toy for those toddlers that like the zoo!

For the price and the compact foldable form factor, these noise cancelling headphones are pretty good! I just traveled with them on the plane and while they aren't as good as my over the ear noise cancelling headphones. I have the Bose noise cancelling headphone but these worked pretty decently. They drowned out quite a bit of the engine noise and I was able to listen to my music peacefully. The headphones run off 1 AAA battery so those are easily findable  There is also a monitor button so that you can temporarily turn off the noise cancelling feature. What I did like the most was that they are so packable versus my huge Bose noise canceling. I have to clip my Bose ones to the side of my bag because they won't fit anywhere else. At least these I can just slip into any of the pockets in my briefcase. Overall, I would buy these for traveling if you are looking to give up some performance for convenience!

These glasses are nice if you are entertaining outside and don't want to worry about anyone dropping their glass and shattering. They are definitely a step up from drinking out of a red SOLO cup. However, they do smell like plastic so if that bothers you, beware. Another thing that I've noticed is sometimes people do spill on themselves because the silicone is pretty flexible so sometimes people squeeze a bit too hard and the glass kind of shoots wine forward a little too much.
Bought this for snack packs out of the house. Perfect size for toddlers!

I really like Viva paper towels. These are not the super soft Viva paper towels but rather the more structured ones which are great for cleaning surfaces because there are a lot of ridges you can scrub with. They are also super absorbent!
These are great wipes to have around. There is no smell and don't leave any film!

Our toddler really liked playing with this tool set but after he saw me using a real hammer and screw driver, he realized that these tools are nothing like the real thing. Overall though this tool set is still pretty good since you can take apart the toolbox and "rebuild" it over and over again. It comes with a toy flat head screw driver, hammer, wrench, saw and ruler. In addition, there's the toolbox which makes sound to encourage putting the toolbox back together. Overall this toy is great for hand/eye coordination and problem solving. I would recommend this toy but make sure not to show your kid the real tools or else he'll want those!

I really like this bluetooth scale in that it is incredibly easy to set up and use. You literally take it out of the box and then you put the batteries in. Then you download the iHealth 2.0 app (for some reason there's a 1.0 but don't use that one). The only hang up for some people is that it prefers you to register with the iHealth website but I didn't think it was that big of a deal. Once you get the app set up, you just tap the scale to wake it up and then it pairs to your bluetooth device (iPhone 5S for me) and then after it registers your weight it transfers to your phone automatically. It does calculate BMI but it's based strictly on your height and age. Overall, I really like the scale for it's ease of use and accuracy. I know the scale is accurate because I've tested it against 3 other scales in our home and they are all pretty close! I plan to use this scale to help me lose some weight since I can see trends through the app and set goals!

Let me first say that a lot of our friends use this Neutrogena sun screen but unfortunately for our toddler, his skin breaks out quite a bit after we use it. Kind of like most baby products, better to test it at first and then see what happens. Instead we are using the baby organics which doesn't cause quite the breakout for his sensitive skin.
Great 2 in 1 shampoo that doesn't leave a greasy film!

We bought this backpack for our trip to the east coast and it was great because the leash came in handy a few times. Our toddler loves the Skip Hop items. The only thing I wish was the backpack was just slightly larger because we wanted to fit just 1 more toy in there! It's a very simple backpack in that it has 1 zippered main compartment! Overall a great quality product and would recommend for daily use!
Not much to really say but the vinyl sounds great! The vinyl has so much more feel to it than the digital version!

This has been our kids favorite toy for the past couple of weeks and our kid is a tough cookie. The track is so big that you can create almost a 4 foot loop. There are so many different areas such as a stunt ramp, multiple steep ramps, a tune up pit and an elevator! It really is a ton of fun especially since the car is remote controlled. You can drive the car forward or backward and it will loop around the track. It really is amazing and it teaches your kid different colors, the notion of backing up if the car gets stuck. His friends really like it too. The track has almost 7 configurations so there's kind of endless fun. Overall a great product!

This toy is good overall probably for younger toddlers though. It is built just like other Green Toys in terms of recycled plastic but this is probably half the size of their normal toys. I know these toys are a bit cheaper but our boy loves the bigger Green Toys like the dump truck and the fire truck and the bus. These smaller ones, he just isn't as interested in. They are incredibly well built and the wheels and the bulldozer part all work really smoothly. There is even a little plastic guy which helps with role play. I know that some children will love this toy but our boy definitely likes the normal size Green Toys!

It's been pretty hot this summer in southern CA and boy has this fan been amazing. The fan has so many features that I haven't seen in a standing fan including a tilt option. When you first open the box, the fan comes with the fan unit and then the base. The base is very easy to assemble and connect to the fan with 4 screws. Then you simply plug in and you're off and running. There is a remote control which can control all options (except tilt, that is manual). There is a dial on the unit for controlling the speed, an on/off button, and timer. There is another button which controls the type of fan speed you want, it's actually pretty cool because you can set it for "sleep" mode which actually cycles the fan so that it's just not constantly blowing. The tilt feature is also very neat in that you can point the fan upwards at an angle to help circulate air more efficiently. Probably the best part of this fan is that it is incredibly slim and doesn't have a large footprint. Another thing of note which is nice is that the entire fan does not rotate but rather the unit itself is stationary and there is a fan within the outside unit which rotates!

So first off, our toddler loves this bottle because of the monkey sleeve. It also matches the rest of our Skip Hop collection. As for keeping his milk cold, it does a great job and the straw is easy to use. In addition the bottle is easy to clean. Now the major issue that we have is the lid, it is very hard to open or close and feels very flimsy. Unlike the Thermos Foogo, the lid springs open and out toddler can drink out of it without our help. The Skip Hop lid is designed so that you have to push the latch and then lift the lid with your other hand (our toddler can't do that). As for closing the lid, it is very difficult in that it doesn't latch that securely, therefore sometimes it might pop open after a few seconds. Unfortunately, I can't really give this bottle that high of a rating.

These are amazing, our toddler and his friends love them! They are essentially large legos so that your toddler doesn't swallow them. We actually own the smaller bag but this larger Deluxe bag is much better since there are more pieces. The smaller bag just doesn't seem to have enough pieces to build some of the structures I want! Overall, this set is great and I would definitely recommend buying for your toddler!

If your toddler likes trucks he'll love this one. It's well built and I'm not sure why there are some complaints about the wheels not rolling on hardwood or that the wheels fall off. Our toddler is very rough with this truck and the wheels still roll fine! He actually likes to put all his weight on the truck and push it along the ground. He does that from the park back to our house which is like a quarter of a mile!

I've never tried one of these pivoting head shavers and wow what a difference it makes! I've never had this close of a shave on my neck ever. The shaver is pretty standard from a charging standpoint, you can charge on the unit itself or you can put the AC plug into the cleaning unit base and then charge from there. Overall, this is probably the closest shave that I've had using an electric shaver and one of the reasons is that you basically can clean the shaver heads everyday with the cleaning base. This shaver comes with a cleaning base that has a cleaning solution which you pop into the base. Of course the downside is that you have to buy the refill cartridges every 3 months. For some people this might be a deal killer but if you shave everyday like I do, this is worth the expense! The shave also comes with a grooming attachment which does some pretty fine work on your sideburns and if you are trying to trim your beard!

This is a great fast action plier tool, it's awesome that you can open 1 handed and the action is incredibly smooth and fast! There are 12 tools on the multitool all of which work very well. The 12 tools are as follows (they are all locking too):1. Pliers - work very well for pretty tough jobs2. Half serrated knife - typical SOG quality3. Large flathead screwdriver - most of these multitools have pretty this flathead screwdrivers4. Bottle opener5. Philips screwdriver6. Can opener7. Small flathead screwdriver8. Awl9. File10. Ruler11. Wire cutter12. Ok I had to look up the 12th one but I guess "gripper" is considered a tool which is the top of the pliersOverall this is a fantastic tool, the only downside might be that it is a bit heavy for EDC in your pocket. If you had a belt case that would probably be ideal!

These knives were incredibly sharp out the box and the weight to them are great. You can tell that these are well made especially when cutting anything from meat to vegetables. The 8" chef's knive by far the most useful, it is well balanced and the weight like I mentioned before makes it incredibly easy to cut through most things. The parer knife is the second one I use most for cutting fruit, that also is very ergonomic and makes it easy to cut the skin off of fruit. The scissors are very sharp but they do not come apart like other scissors that I have used (when the blades separate, it makes it much easier to clean. The bread knife like the others is incredibly sharp and slices right through the hardest of breads! This set also comes with a riveted serrated utility knife which I actually didn't know what it was for but after looking it up, it turns out that you use this knife for cutting things like bagels or stuff with a hard crust and it will cut without tearing. I tried it and it works! I tested the sharpner and it's pretty much a standard sharpening steel. Finally the is really nice, it really makes the knife set stand out. It's not a standard wood block but a white plastic resin which really pops on our dark granite counter! Overall a great set of knives but I probably would get one with 12 pieces!

I was looking for a functional mini flashlight that would fit in my sheath with my leatherman. This flashlight for it's price has an incredibly bright light and is great when I'm inspecting properties. It throws off a simple circle beam which is bright enough to conduct any inspections. It runs on 1 AAA battery which is convenient. Anyways for the price, I think this is a good value pen light!

Our 2 year old loves this T-Ball set. Right now he's more interested in just the bat and the ball. Right now when I put the ball on the tee, he knocks it off with his hand, he still hasn't grasped hitting the ball off the tee with the bat! I'm sure it will come with time. But overall this is a great way to get the kiddos started in baseball/softball!

This is more of what I would call a universal sheath in that my Leatherman Sidekick fits in it but the sheath wasn't built for the Sidekick. For the price and the functionality though, the sheath works great!
These are incredibly soft sheets but unfortunately they start to fall apart after a few washings.
Perfect gift for the Ryan Gosling lover!

These water filters fit our Kenmore side by side refrigerator perfectly. They are incredibly easy to change in that you simply pull out the old one, take off the top cap and place that on top of the new filter. Then push the filter plus cap back into the refrigerator. After running the water for a few cycles, you're good to go! Amazon has the best price I've found on these too!

I read one horrible review for this belt...I try to review products fairly, and this includes the price of the product.  A $100 belt will almost always be much nicer than a $29 belt.While I do not buy a lot of very expensive accessories, I like ones that look nice for the price.  This belt has a very nice buckle, superb.  Clean, modern, stylish.  The leather itself is just plain, no accents, stitches, understated, which is a preference for certain clothes.  The fact its reversable, brown and black, and has a nice buckle, for $29, I had to give it 4-5 stars.  Some may not like the understated simple leather look.

What a clever marriage, a scale with an i device... Not only the obvious benefit, u get a very large screen for a scale... while not paying for all those electronic display technology in your scale..., and you place the i devide anywhere to see, vs. under the bowl, where it often is NOT visible.But, this also is a food making scale... add ingredients in the bowl, all together, watch the weight rise vs. weighing ingredients individually... I would suggest, this is the wave of future cooking.... its not for everyone, not all ingredients are done by weight, most are by volume.  I found it to be very accurate and response time to my ipad was very fast.  very clever, works well...  priced fairly considering all the recipes that can simplify making certain items....

I am a heavy computer user, but by no means a GURU.  I don't run speed tests, etc.  But, anyone who used usb2.0 flash drives will sure appreciate the SPEED this thing works at.  I can't say its 10x, but if I had to guess, 4-5x faster, what took 4 minutes now takes a minute, just an approximate, maybe slightly faster.I used it on a Samsung PC, so of course, it was plug n play.  Not sure if that is the case with any device.  Like all Samsung products, I have always been happy with the price and performance... I own their phones, pc, tv's, sound systems, etc.What this little drive has taught me is.... I now hate devices that have 2.0 ports on them, as, the speed is dictated by the weak link in the chain.  I hate continually upgrading, so will make do with the devices that currently have USB 3.0 ports.  truly amazing how sophisticated all this is becoming....

Wow.  First, I have been using Excel for 15+ years.  I thought I was good at using Excel, not GREAT, but good.  Seems I got the program to give me everything I wanted... kinda.  Like most people, and most companies, they rarely have the time to dedicate to further education of your tools...and software tools are ever evolving.  Excel is no exception.It was nice to read that our largest coruporations such as JP Morgan, also was/is using Excel in a very antiquated way.  My guess is, they too design the use of their software with people who find ways to get it done, but yet, are NOT fully aware of all the power and options u can create with Excel.  Excel is like a mixed bag of tools.  How successful those tools can be, depends on your creativity, imagination and knowledge that comes with books like this.I already got some great ideas from the examples in this book for my application.  I too have been an outdated user of Excel, kinda operating it like it was 2000, and not 2015.  I never updated my knowledge base as I updated the software ;)  This book gives excellent examples... of course, they are likely NOT be perfect for every application.  Instead, u combine bits and pieces of examples to build what works for you.  I love the concept of better interfaces, which now is termed Dashboards.  I really enjoy all the nicely designed Dashboards, it makes my spreadsheets appear inferior.  I must admit, I have a lot too learn, and this book is a great reference tool for me...hopefully I will update this review in a few months with more feedback.....

It amazes what food scientist can dream up to please our pallets.I am not a huge sweet eater, just a few things get me...like toffee, Hershey chocolate and pretzels, so I figured I would enjoy this concoction.Ahhhh, I DO!  The Popcorn is like a base to hold all the items together, so u don't taste much popcorn.  Instead, u are overwhelmed with the delicious toffee and chocolate combination.  It looks delish too, all drizzly.  Nice sized pieces, not too big, not too small.  It comes in sealed clear bag for freshness, then you open, and re seal bag in the canister.  The shipping box was huge and protective enough to ship crystal!  Can is very nice and reusable for sure.  Its costly, but its a very nice gift... a nice change from the boring box of chocolates!  If you like toffee flavor, u will love this!

Gave this as a gift.... the stone was a little smaller than what I thought, but not a deal breaker.  The chain seems of good quality considering the price.  The stone is very nice, quite eloquent IMO, but I don't know fine jewelry.  If your giving this as a gift, the box makes it appear as if whatever is inside is high-end ;)  Very nice packaging for the price.  Hard not to like this, very "middle of the road", but nicely done  jewelry.

Wow, what an incredible innovation.  I am an occasional ping pong player, not a competitive player, just a means to blow off steam.  I just had to try this!!  Its a gadget mans gadget for sure!It senses the ball strike from sensors below the table, so it knows which side the ball bounced last, hence who won the point.  If you hit long, it does not register a strike,  your opponent wins the point.  Of course, your opponent could have mistakenly hit it out of the air ;)  So some human intervention is still required.  This will take getting used to... why?  Mainly because,  we goof around a lot when we play, and the game thinks we are serious players ;)  Also, some strange things occur like when the ball nicks the corner of the table, (winner point) it did not sense the corner strike...no worries, easy to correct score... bottom line, if you learn to look at the score after each point, its a pleasant way to stop arguing over the score...the older we get, the more we keep saying, "what"  I am up 5-3 not YOU!!  hee hee....  it happens, our minds drift.  Anyway, with a little adjustment period to avoid tricking the system, and an occasional correction, I am sure we will refine the process to maintain more accurate scoring.  I also like the notice to change sides... very clever.  Even  though I rarely switch sides.  Overall all, if you like ping pong, its hard not to appreciate the genius behind this.... of all the areas technology has chased, ping pong was prob. not high on Microsofts list of priorities....so Kudos to these niche markers who pursue such small markets.  A lot of technology for the price IMO...  I was torn between 4 and 5 stars.  If you like gadets, and you argue over the score when playing ping pong, u will prob. appreciate it !!  Makes a great gift for the guy who has everything ;)

I gave this as a gift, and watched the interaction for a day.... truly remarkable how far technology has come in kids toys!Many of the reviewers have had serious time watching the interaction with the toy and the child... and their comments seem dead-on!The toy has voice recognition!!  Not only is the child fascinated holding conversations with the bear, but I was too!  I can see how this is very addictive for a child.  Like ET!  ;)I think getting your child away from a PC screen can ONLY be good in todays world, otherwise, they sate at screens all day, which IMO can be somewhat detrimental.Anyway, the description above on this page does an excellent job explaining all the features of the toy, so I won't expand on those.The quality of the toy is excellent, very nice material and workmanship... well done...

I have used a lot of these in the past..., but, ALL have been Schage Z Wave locks.  My first Yale Zwave Lock.  I really appreciate the diversity this line offers.... with matching door handles, integrated lock / handle, etc.  So many options.  Also, keyed, and keyless.  One of the fears of keyless, was being locked out when the batteries die...however, a very clever 9V battery touch point is provided, to always have external power from the outside in the event of battery drain.  Batteries are a way of life with these locks, get used to changing them....or, in this case, keep a 9V in your car, so ur always safe.  Ridding the key, is a Major security improvement, as most thieves can pick a lock very fast these days.  So a lot of thought went into the design of this Zwave lock non keyed system.  Kudos to Yale Design Team.I have installed many of these, so I am not a good judge of how hard it is.... it becomes simple after your 5th one, I  barely need the instructions....but not so for your first install.  Very good instructions.  The unit looks very attractive, sleek and modern.  Keypad IMO is ideal for outside use, however, its black, so maybe direct sun contact is not ideal, u might toast your fingers.  I like the fully rubber coated num pad vs individual keys, which can get dirt and debris around each key.  I won't bore you with the digital set up, as u need to know about Zwave and programming of such, not very difficult if you are PC savvy.  After installation, this was up n running in 15 minutes.  I really like this auto lock feature, very clever... HOWEVER.... always make sure the door is fully closed if you are relying on auto lock, as if the dead bolt is NOT fully aligned, it will NOT lock.... a false sense of security - if your not careful...One thing to consider when choosing a digital lock.  There is motorized locks, such as this, and there is non motorized locks such as the Schlage and other lines.  There is pros n cons to both.  The motorized lock is simple, enter code, door unlocks...or use zwave app, and door unlocks.  However, the motor drains the batteries much faster vs. non motorized locks.  With a non motorized lock, the door unlocks by pulling a pin up, allowing the manual lock turn handle to spin (conventional lock mechanism).  So after entering the code, you must then spin the deadbolt handle to open the door.  Since its ONLY a pin that moves up n down and NO motor, the battery life is quite impressive, well over a year on 4 AA batteries with heavy use.Also, if you have any friction on the deadbolt with a motorized lock, the lock will drain the battery even faster, as it must overcome the friction.  So make sure installation is clean, then check if things has changed during the seasons as wood moves a bit with change of weather.  You can hear when there is friction as the noise of the motor changes, as its burdened by friction.Also, with a motorized lock, the motor can fail, so always be sure there is another way into the facility  Specially if no key back up.  I don't suggest motorized and keyless when there is only ONE access into the building.So lots of choices, u have to prioritize what is important to you.  If security is very important, keyless sure rids the biggest problems of pic'd locks.Very impressive product

I used this brand a lot...overall, decent quality vs. price... lots of organic products as well...but this product seems to have NO effect on me, and I am very reactive to guranna... like most of these products, we have no idea whats actually in the product... i.e. standardized levels of caffeine per weight of powder.  i can only assume, these are very low quality guaranna beans, or, maybe diluted.  As I am drinking the equiv. of 8 cups of coffee in caff, and feeling nothing....whereas, 1 cup of coffee makes me buzz... so, not sure what the issue is... I have taken Guarans in the past and always got favorable reactions to it...

I have been using Cresent tools all my life... IN general they make good tools...NOT the best, NOT the worst, some are very good, some have been OK at best.  But to be fair, with Cresent, u get a lot of tool for the dollar spent.  This matters, as not everyone requires the BEST tools...not everyone uses their tools every day of their lives, so some small variances in the tools might bother a daily user, but not a weekend warrior...I was glad to see these appear on Vine, as I have been a Channel Lock fan for years... they kinda own this tool line being the original inventor.  I think a few of the other Vine reviewers were being very fair by stating these are NOT in the league of Channel locks... the jaws are not as long, and most importantly, the tool is very heavy and bulky.  The obvious reason is, they used a lower cost metal which requires more volume to create equal strength.  The benefit, of course, LOWER COST!  IMO, I think some reviewers miss this point... Cresent is not going after the Channel Lock user, but rather the mid user who will not use the tools hours every day.  In which case these small differences are minor....but the price differential is VERY significant!!!  So, I always try to evaluate a products price vs performance, and in this case, I was between a 4 - 5 rating.  A nicer finish would have pushed me to a 5.  I do like the nice and thick rubber coating, seems very durable and should stand the test of time...Overall, this kit is quite the value, 3 nicely sized angled pliers at a very reasonable price point.... so IMO, Crescent is still doing a great job at picking their market and providing high quality products at reasonable prices...backed up with excellent customer service.  Kudos to Crescent...

My first venture into vacuum tumbling meats with marinades .... I have nothing to compare this unit to.  I never even knew the existed!The premise is novel... create a vacuum in the canister which holds the meat and marinade.  The vacuum allows the marinade to better penetrate the meat.  At first, it thought... no way.  But, my first try at using Chicken Breasts with a lemon marinade, was a total success!I have tried marinading overnight, but the marinade never penetrated as well as using the Chard.  So, the key is a vacuum!  The tumbling simply keeps the marinade equally all over the meat, which solves the problem of marinade falling to the bottom of the bag or tray when you let it sit in fridge overnight.Its a nice size for family use, not too big, not too small, and you need very little prep time....easy to clean, but keep away from dishwasher.  I must admit, I am now spoiled, no more bland chicken for me!!!

First, I am prob. not the best laptop reviewer, as I only upgrade every few years, so I am easily impressed with each new model I use, as the technology jumps are so impressive with each new machine I own.  I was looking for a nice thin easy carry laptop, and this Asus Zenbook is perfect!!  Amazingly thin!  How they pack in that much technology in a PC this thin is beyond amazing.  Build quality is superb, feels very solid.  No backlit keyboard, but when you want tiny, often some features u must surrender.  Other than a back lit keybard, this does everything I want and more.  I love the mini HD port for a 2nd display, great for desk use.  I will upgrade soon to accommodate this.... the unit has no fan, so I will sit the unit on a pc cooler when at my desk.  It gets very warm, but not excessively hot.  But the more you push these PC's, the hotter they run..and heat is the enemy for all PC's.  AT this thin size, an internal fan is not possible...I am a but clunky with Windows 10, but that is another story ;)Two USB 3.0 ports is nice... I never realized how blazing fast these ports are, till I hooked up an external hard drive in one. sheeesh!  The track pad is OK at best, but again, u must consider how thin and small this laptop is.  You can't have the BEST of all features, specially mechanical features,  and maintain the size this small... it works well enough in a crunch, otherwise, I use a small a mini microsoft BT mouse.  Battery life although rated at 10hrs, prob. less if you drive the machine hard... so far, I had it go 7 hours with no problems... so, again, considering its size, that is very impressive to me.Screen colors are excellent considering the size...sure, my $2K desktop LED displays are better, but, they are HUGE... to pack this much light in such a tiny display is again, impressive.  No lag on display when working with files in Photoshop.  Asus mentions 178 deg viewing angle... not sure about that, but its better than any other laptop I have ever used... at least 120 deg with the best views being in the 80 deg range from center (+/- 40 deg).  The "ac" vs. "n" wifi connections is NOTICEABLY faster... but, that is not unique to this PC, but rather, just upgraded technology to the entire industry.  256GB Solid state hard drive... very generous size considering PC size and its thinness.  Its very fast... and with USB 3.0 port, easy to carry a larger drives which are very compact these days.Overall, Assus has packed an amazing amount of the latest and greatest features and offer it a very impressive price point.  The mixture of all this, its hard for me NOT to give this pc 5 star rating.  I know other reviewers are much harder on each feature, but IMO, u have to evaluate the price vs. performance ratio of the product, vs. what other competitors have to offer.  Sure, there is better laptops, but they get bigger and way more costly.Will try to update this review in due time after more use...

This appears to be a very high end product for Artists.  I am a photographer, and never could paint or illustrate.  However, I always had a desire to turn my photographs into paintings.  This software, like many high end graphics programs has so many facets, often users only utilzie maybe 10% of the programs capability.  That is certainly the case with me on program like this, as I have had no previous experience.  My initial impressions, are WOW.  I find it incredible how the software converts photos into paintings, and even more impressed with how many tools we have to manipulate the conversion.  I can see this program taking years to master.... as I need to master the understanding the final product...and get a better feel of how I want the final art to look.  I can see already, this will come through much experimentation.Being a Photoshop user doesn't seem to offer a lot of help for a program like this, as photoshop is quite precise, almost mathematical vs. Painter....but then again, photography is very mechanical vs. creating a painting from a blank canvas.  Hopefully I will learn more and update this review, as it will take me months to get a good grip on all these tools.  Unfortunately I don't work on this full time.  I am sure there is other programs out there that does these conversions as well, but having never used them, I can't offer a comparison.  The corel web site has some great examples that inspired me!

Otter really is atop the "protection" market...not only do their products protect BETTER than their competition, they continue to innovate more features into their design.  IMO, this is the crowning achievement of all of OTTER's design.  It's a one size fits all solution protecting your Ipad.  In my case, I often use mine with a keyboard for email, other times, I just want it upright for viewing video cams, other times, just carry on board the plane.  Of course, you have to buy the accessories, but you only buy the ones you want.... and while some might find them costly, IMO, they are cost effective considering the high quality of the product.  I will surely buy the dock.Some reviewers had problems with adhesive, so far, mine has not had this problem.  The look is industrial sleek, and open / close is a little clunky, but not enough to ding a point.Overall, this will prob. be the new standard for tablet protection... Once u adapt to the Agility Otter system, u will only have to buy new protector for each new sized ipad generation, as I am sure Otter will keep all the matching components compatible.  That IMO is a win / win... win for Otter, they get our repeat business, win for us, we can use the other accessories for many years to come.  Kudos to Otter Design team on this one!!Now, to be fair, if you only want mild protection, and do not use your Ipad except for couch lounging for example, this Agility Portfolio is prob. overkill for your needs.  So, as they say, horses for courses ;)

I have bought hundreds of B+W filters through the years, they are by far, IMO, the best filter maker on the market.  This Kaesemann filter IMO is a breakthrough circ. polarizing filter, as not only does it have classic B+W quality, it uses a new type of glass treatment that reduces light loss by up to 2 stops.  Loosing only 1 stop of light for a circ. polarizer is a big deal.  Specially when shooting fast moving subjects with glare, such as swimmers, water skiing, snow skiing, etc.As with all B+W products, the threads are meticulous and the movement is smooth as silk, with very tight tolerances...

Box is big and HEAVY, be prepared for two man lift.  I own a  lot of Delta ww gear, nearly all of it, is very high quality.  I rate most of it as good as, and some better than Powermatic, two excellent USA makers...of course, no tools are actually made in the USA.  The mid tier gold standard for tool manufacturing is now Taiwan, which is where this Delta is made.  Assembly was smooth.  Anyone buying this product, knows how to read instructions and assemble something like this.  Lifting the motor is the only two man part of assembly.  Like all Delta products, the unit runs well.  Noise is "as expected", but if you have never used a unit like this, be sure to listen to one first, as neighbors can complain, they are loud.  But then again, so is a Table Saw ;).  Love the hip level switch, no bending.  Heavy duty build.  Height is made to just barely fit within an 8ft ceiling... at 93", u have 3" to spare max, assuming no drop lights.  CFM at 1200, this is the most you can expect at 120V and 15amps.  Delta offers a 5 year warranty on this unit, SUPERB, Delta stands behind their products.  I like the 6" hose connection, which can Y into two 4", as often some machines do have a 6" dust port, so nice feature.  To properly size a dust collector, u must know what the CFM requirement is at the tool, and work backwards from there.  Calc. losses from the dust collector to the machine as every foot of hose, bend, etc. all reduces CFM...the reductions are extreme...even the type of pipe used matters a LOT.... for example, clean PVC pipe has less friction than flexible hoses.  There is good resources on the web about how to calculate losses...its important u buy a machine that meets your needs the FIRST time.I have owned several of these portable dust vacs.  For those new to this, picking the right type of dust collector is paramount.  This type of unit, is ideal in applications that require you to move the dust collector to different machines.  They are also ideal where you only have 120V, vs. 220V.  This is about the max. vacuum suction u can achieve at 120V power supply.  If you have only used a shop VAC in the past, be prepared for some serious suction, no comparison.  If you have no need to move the shop VAC around, a wall mounted VAC saves floor space...and if you have 220V, you can buy up to 5HP cyclone arrange and run duct work to each machine.  The more powerful the VAC, the more losses it can sustain through resistance losses through the ducting, WHILE, still having sufficient CFM at the ww machine.  So for 120V on wheels, this Delta 50-767 is more than sufficient for any ww machine with a 4" dust collection fitting as if the machine is very close to the Delta, there is little loss of suction.  Never under estimate how fast suction is lost by hoses, specially hoses smaller than 4" diameter.  Also, with a unit like this, you can set up some adapters and run some shop Vac hoses off it, for other smaller tasks like car vacuuming, etc.The premise of these units is similar to a cyclone, without the circular action...  gravity drops the dust and chips down into the collection bag, while air escapes through the top bag.  The tighter the bag (lower micron rating) the more dust that gets trapped, but less suction.  The looser the bag (higher micron rating), less resistance =  greater suction.  The 1200 CFM rating is with the included 1 micron bag.  This is a critical issue for two reason.  First, with greater suction, the further you can run hoses.  With better filtration, the shorter you can run hoses, but the air escaping the filter bag has less particulate matter, measured in ppm.Since there is several good reviews on the operation of the unit... I would like to write more about health consequences of dust, and ways to best reduce your exposure to fine dust particles.The internet is full of information on this subject...but in a nutshell, for wood workers...It is NOT just the heavy, or large airborne particulate that causes health problems.  Instead, its the < 5 micron size particles that have proven to have the most damaging health effects.  This was first discovered in grain plants, where breakfast cereals were made... u would think since grain is a food we eat, grain dust would not be toxic (vs. wood dust).  However, even fine grain dust from cereal making was producing crazy high levels of lung cancers.  Now, all grain plant workers wear filtration masks.The value of dust collection is to remove the dust at the tool u are working at.  If sized right, and the with the proper dust collection set up at the tool, they do a very good job at this, but not perfect, hence why I still use a dust mask.  Using a particulate meter will easily demonstrate this.  But this air is being pulled from the ww machine into the dust collector..and then, sent back into the room through the top filtration bag.  Unfortunately, what is being sent back into the room is the very fine, invisible < 1 micron size particles.  With no outside air flow in your shop (like many basement shops), the invisible particulate matter begins to accumulate, this is dangerous.  This Delta comes with a 1 micron bag.  You can buy other bags at different micron ratings, such as 3 or 5 which are common.So, the measures to make your dust collection as safe as possible....In order of significance....1)  Place the dust collector in a location where the exhaust air does NOT re-enter the work space...such as an accessory shed u build on the outside wall of your shop or garage.  A good place to put an air compressor too, which is quite noisy.  You can sound insulate this room.  This allows all the small particulate to leave the dust bag into the outside, vs back into your work space / lungs.  If this set up is possible, you can than change the filtration bag to a 5 or 10 micron bag, and the added suction will allow you to run long hoses to your machines and have the same net suction.  This is by far the most ideal dust collection set up....  of course, not always feasible.2)  If the dust collection unit remains in you shop, and the exhaust air dumped into your work space... have windows or doors open with fans, always moving out the invisible particulate.  In a basement, simply build a fresh air intake system with some duct work, and an exhaust fan to pull air out.  In cold weather, this can add to heating costs.  If you use the shop a lot, and it the cost can justify it, consider a ERV, (Energy Recovery Ventilator), these will salvage about 85% of the nrg content of the inside air u are exhausting.3)  If this is not possible, at a bear min. use an overhead, shop dust collector such as a Delta 50-871.  These are also 1 micron air cleaners.... remember, there is a lot of dust that still escapes these units at the machine and other tasks like drilling holes, etc. that we often never use dust collection.  So the over heard units really do a great job of continually cleaning the air.4) Any extreme dust generating task, like sanding, Table Saws, re saw on band saw, planars.... use a good 3M cartridge based dust mask while performing the task, of course, with heavy duty dust collection working.  Belt sanders are nearly impossible to capture the dust.Hope this sheds some light on all the different options for dust collection to assist in maximizing dust removal and reducing the risk of dust related health effects.

First, with any of these supplements, always remember, your mileage may vary...I am not sure if its in my head, but I feel a good recovery from this drink.  I appreciate no caff, so I can take it in the evening.  Flavor is bland, but I am not drinking it for flavor.  I would think the drink is helpful for those who deplete a lot of minerals through long workouts and or excessive sweating.  I sweat a LOT!  Will continue with this, as I am trying to avoid all the sugar drinks, but like something for recovery....surely recommended....it does have that stevia aftertaste, but not horrible, but noticeable....

I am a huge Otterbox fan... I am clumsy ;)Most all of their products are very well made, this case is no exception.....However, for some reason, I am not crazy about this design.... it makes a very slim phone quite BIG....and remarkably, it slips in my hand more vs. without a case... my other otters have a very tactile non slip feel... I guess they did this to maintain the sleek glossy feel?  Not sure...and some people may find it appealing...  I will try it for another week or two..All the usual stuff is dead-on, access ports, camera access, volume, all well designed and properly placed.

This is my 2nd bottle of this tanner.  I love it.  I have tried many in the past, and most are OK at best.  Different problems.... the consistentsy is not right, feels yucky in your skin, the color is not right in certain light, looks fake, it smells, it makes me break out, some, I fear are dangerous as the chemicals in them.So far, Xen-TAN has been my FAV tanner...it looks natural, feels great, and has no odor!  For me, the color is just right... but that might not be true for everyones skin, so these tanners are not one size fits all...but for my use, this product is my go-to tanner!

I was taking a liquid version of L Theanine, and it worked OK, but gave me stomach issues.... too many ingredients, such as stevia which really makes me sick....saw good reviews here on Amazong for Sun version (all natural version of L Theanine), and, like other reviewers, I noticed an immediate effect... both anti anxiety, and much better, and longer sleep!  Will continue this supplement, and will report back.  Hoping no tolerance issues surface....

I have been trying various sun block curtains for many years... its amazing how many are poor.  This pair, worked VERY well!  Yep, almost no light goes through the currtain, and yet, they are not that heavy, impressive!  However, if you want a good block of all light, u must consider the sides, top and bottom, as light can spill outward to these areas and brighten the room, so you have to design your set up accordinlgy, such as, over sizing the curtain on all sides....  Nice fabric, nice look, good feel.... very impressed, will buy more of these as there is never a shortage of windows I am always blocking sunlight from!

I love tool gadgets... I am no stranger to these laser levelers.... to be fair, at this price point, its a unique product for sure.I am curious what the maker had in mind when this product was designed...most levelers are made for specific tasks...The cool factor lies in the units size!  tiny!  6" flashlight size...  The smaller the product, the more compromises have to be made in its capability.... the maker used a plumb bob type of self leveling system.... when the internal plumb bomb settles, the line is suppose to be level... well, within the makers tolerance.  Mine was slightly further out of tolerance than the maker suggested, but not enough to complain.  How well the plumb bomb performs over time, temp, getting banged around, etc, ??
