I picked up this bottle in Wal-Mart some time in mid July becuase I was looking for a skin-toning and smooth texturing to my skin. I have uneven skin tone and dark marks. Now, today, September 10th, this product has not done a thing but leave my skin temporarily dry. I'd have to put on lotion after I rinse the product off. The dark spots are still there. It mentions brightening your skin, but again, I see no difference. I used this product twice a day; morning and night before bedtime. I even left it on my face probably longer than recommended as I'd put it on first, brush my teeth, and then rinse it off. I got NOTHING. There's probably 30% still left, but I see no reason to continue using a product that does not work.Disappointed.

This is really one of those disappointing experiences with a product I had high expectations for. And despite the many, MANY MANNNNY bad reviews warning us not to buy this, I still took the leap of faith and bought this only becuase it was within my budget at the time when I really wanted the Nutribullet or Nutri Ninja.First of all, I bought this magic bullet from an Ebay Seller named drugstoreinc. DO NOT buy from this seller as this seller will absolutely not respond to any email you give them. Don't believe me? Look at the store reviews. I tried to get in contact with them when my Magic Bullet suddenly stopped working after like 5 times of usage. And I take care of it as I normally keep it clean and store it back into the original box it came with. What happened was I was using the cross blade in which the recipe book it came with CLEARLY said it was for frozen fruit, ice, and things of that nature. All I had in the container were raw orange slices and lemon juice, and maybe even a small amount of ice. When I tried pressing down, I noticed the blade wasn't moving the stuff around. The motor was roaring, but there was no movement. It just made this really awful, almost high-pitched sound. I lifted the blade to see that there was some kind of white powdery stuff as if something was deteriorating or being scratched up. I noticed one reviewer said it was the plastic powder/shavings. I assumed that maybe the ice was too hard against the blade and the blade couldn't take it. Then again, the blade looked fine.After trying to get a hold of that idiot seller, I eventually contacted the official company of Magic Bullet and showed them pictures of it and what happened. This occurred over a series of emails. Since it wasn't clear if it was actually the blade or the motor, they were very nice enough to send me a brand new motor and the blade, but I had to pay $8 in shipping.So, I started using the second one...........Bummer, it happened again after maybe like 8 or 10 times of usage. And I made SURE to take care of this extra harder. I did not put ice in it this time. Instead, it was frozen fruit with some juice using the cross blade again. In fact, I tried using both flat and cross blades it came with, and it would not spin at all. All it does is make that sound as if the tires on a car are screeching but they're not really going anywhere. In fact, I think I could have sworn I smelled something burning. The company did tell me to cut the cord to the old motor for safety reasons. Ugh. So disappointed.Now, for the experience itself, the Magic bullet is not very powerful anyway. It does not necessarily grind up everything. It does come out lumpy, especially with oranges and grapefruits. But it worked successfully with the frozen fruit. But that was 58 bucks down the drain. Sorry I cannot give a full review on every piece it came with. I had only used it for the sole purpose of smoothies (fruit).But seriously, invest your money into something more promising. I do not trust this company's products and wonder if they even do inspections or investigations/followups on their own products.This was very disappointing.

**DVD Menu**You will see the following:- All Mini Walks (104 Minutes) and this can be with music or music only- Choose One of Leslie's Pre-planned Combinations: 1. Total Body Walk (53 minutes)`2. Advanced Walk (32 minutes) 3. Fun Walk (32 Minutes) 4. Choose One Mini walk - which will bring you to its own menu page where you can choose one. 5. Create your own custom walk - which will bring you to its own menu page where you can mix up the combinations. It will also allow you to play music only in whatever you choose. You can even choose the same mini walk twice if you like.** Experience**I chose to do all of the walks, which got tedious the more I went. According to my calorie count watch, I burned 846 calories surprisingly. Then again, I was moving for almost two straight whole hours. When I did this the second time, I burned 733.The All mini walks segment are as follows:1. Light Walk - According to Leslie, she wants you to use this mini walk as a warm-up. And that's exactly what it felt like. There is no jumping or anything brisk. Again, it feels like a warm-up or gentle walk.2. Dance Walk - You're not really dancing, but there is cha-chas, and Mambos. There are kicks toward the end but knee-lifts. There is no jumping.3. Walk, Kick + Jab - First, it starts out slow, and then it gets pretty brisk. You'll do mini squats that almost feel like side steps. You'll turn to the side and do side steps along with jab-cross movement. She also mixes in a kick with your double side steps. That move really took me off guard a bit, but I caught up. You'll also do some back taps while your arms swing forward and back. There is no jumping in this.4. Tummy Trimmer - It had a slow start and then it picked up in speed. She'll have you do regular skaters, but as you do double side steps, she'll ask you to tack on a skater along with that, which can be a little tricky. There are kicks and the knee lifts come with arms that will rise over your head and come down with your elbow touching to your hip. I really felt those in my core. There are no shifts, twists, or bouncing in this.5. Short & Sweaty - I was tricked on this mini walk as I assumed it was going to be a lot of jumping, bouncing, shifts, and all those high intensity moves, but all it is, is that you're going at a fast pace. The walk starts off already brisk and then gets brisker. The only hardest move for me was doing those twist side steps that almost make you have to hop.6. Interval Walk - You will have 3 interval rounds where you start off slow and then she'll have you run up 4, stay in place for 4, and then run back 4. This lasts about 60 seconds.7. Upper Body - It's pretty much self-explanatory. With almost every move you do, you'll do something with your hands like lateral raises, overhead press, chest press, pushing your hands back when you do kickbacks. One thing I noticed was that there were no knee-lifts.8. Lower Body - This mini walk got me teeth-gritting becuase she just had to include lunges. Lunges make me feel weird around the knee and ankles. You'll do squats with your feet close together along with other common movements like kicks.9. Brisk + Sweaty - It's just as the title says. You'll be moving pretty fast but there's no jumping or high intensity movements.10. Flexibility Walk - This is most definitely, or should be the last mini walk in your customize walk. It's very low-impact and really, probably the best cool down she's had in a long time, because she's not rushing through it.Now, at the end of of these mini walks, she'll kind of slow it down, but there's no cooldown up for each of them. The Flexibility walk is the walk for cooldowns. She kind of tricked me when at the end of the light walk, she started to breathe in and out with her hands stretched up and coming back. I thought she was going to stretch after that. But she said to keep walking if we're going to another mini walk or skip to flexibility walk for stretch.***Pros***1. The music is pretty leveled out. I could hear her very well as well as the music at the same time. So, this is not a DVD where you can hardly hear her, or can't hear the music at all.2. The music itself is pretty decent. It kind of reminds of a trance dance club just a bit. But it has a decent beat. There was one I really liked in the lower body mini walk.3. She gives one healthy tip in each of her mini walks. The one I loved the most was when she said it is very expensive to be unhealthy. And she's right. You don't want to visit the hospital all the time. Exercise and eat right, and your body will take care of you in return.4. Nobody on the set was annoying. I already know three of them, such as Nick from from Walk it off in 30 days, Tina from Walk to the Hits, and Nikki from her various DVDs back in 2012. So, there's only one new one there on the set and she moves with fire, almost motivating you to give your best. But there were a lot of powerful smiles. Nick has the best smile.***Cons***1. Leslie does get off step a lot. Sometimes even when a scene goes to another and then back to her, she's on a different step.2. Sometimes I've noticed they were not quite correlated with the beat, as if whoever put the DVD together kind of had a little botch in the audio. So, I'd be going to the original beat she had me on, but all of the sudden, they were either slow or fast for a few seconds.**Neutral**1. There is no time clock. But all should be 10 minutes. So, you have an idea of how long they are.2. I've noticed people have said in the past that she's pretty loud or talks too much. Sometimes her laughs can be exaggerated, but here, she's pretty laid back, very gentle.**other**I am 154 pounds if it helps. So, if you're around my size, you can definitely get this done. My mother is in her early 50's and has lost around 10 pounds doing Leslie DVDs. Leslie has helped me lose 11 pounds so far. So, the stuff works. If you have questions, please ask. I'm connected to my email daily.Overall, I think the best part about this DVD is just that you have more power and options to set up your workout out the way you want it. If you're just too tired, pick out gentle walks. If you want a challenge, you can even pick the toughest mini walks.

I was walking through a grocery store here in Louisiana, and this woman was advertising the different products/dressings, including this particular one. She said the creole tomato dressing was their special one. I gave it try and ended up asking for seconds. Due to being on a budget at the time, I could not buy it.I passed the dressing quite a few times later on until I finally bought it to have for a vacation snack. Painfully, it is expensive. It was $7 a jar. But I later realized that this stuff really does last long depending on how much you consume it.This stuff is so good that I could not stop dipping crackers into it. I soon turned to dipping shrimp and other seafood as well. I have not tried it on salad yet; didn't get to that part. But it almost reminds me of an all-purpose dressing. And it had me losing track of how much I was really eating it. It was perfect! The taste is really hard to describe. It does not taste anything like tomato, but almost resembles that special type of sauce you'd expect to be in a little cup that goes along with seafood at seafood restaurants.The only bad thing about it is that it's about 85 calories for ONE tablespoon and is 14% total fat, and 10% in saturated fat. All this in one tablespoon. So...it's bad. I don't even feel good mentally when I know I'm putting this stuff inside my body.But it's delicious. I just wish it was healthier.

If it helps, I have African American skin. I wanted something to help aid in healthy skin. I used this for months, twice a day in the morning and before bedtime.Around the first few months, I massaged the foam with my fingers onto my face as it turned into foam once you move it circular motion. After a few seconds, the form disappears, but the stuff is still on your face. Then it says to rinse your face. Afterward, it left my face so dry that it felt like my face wanted to stretch from being so stiff. Sometimes I had to resort to putting on lotion afterward to get rid of that irritable feeling. I do have oily skin. But sometimes the extreme dryness was just too much.I then got a rotating facial brush and used CeraVe with that, thinking if I applied by a different method other than my fingers, I could probably see some results. I also left the foam on my face longer by putting on first, then brushing my teeth, and after my teeth are clean, I then rinse my face. But I got the same outcome.It does not have a smell, nor have I experienced it bothering my eyes.I still experienced acne. So, this wasn't any kind of miracle worker for me.I gave it two stars for two reasons, 1) It did not seem to make my skin worse. So, that's a plus. And 2) becuase for $8 to $10 you really do get your money's worth in terms of quantity. It's a big bottle and it will take forever to use every bit of it. But I'm down to at least 25% left, and I don't think I'm even going to bother with the rest. I'm now moving on to another product. There's no reason for me to even waste my time any further this foam. But at least it was worth a shot.

For size reference I was between 166-163 pounds, I am 5'4, with chest 39 inches and was able to fit this with a breeze. It feels VERY lightweight and goes well with some skinny jeans, ripped or smooth.It covers the chest area very well and the tail end in the back does cover my butt cheeks entirely. I did notice near the strap area that on both sides it's tied in faint knots. I believe if you loosen that a little you can probably adjust the length of the straps.It is a tad darker in person, but overall, it's a good little tank to have for the summer.

When I pulled the wig out of the package, it came in these medium waves. It barely had any body. Yes, the wig is very long. It has two combs up front, but oddly, there's no comb in the back. There is no lace around the forehead at all. The only lace you see, is the parting space, which is about 3 inches long. So, it's not really that much for a wig so jacked up in price. It also does have adjustable straps.There is no shedding at all. Yes, the wig can curl. Please look at the video I uploaded to help you get an idea of how it looks curled. This is in a 1B. I did curl it with a curling iron and pinned the curls closed until they cooled down, and then I released them. I have to say, they look really good.I gave it three stars because I hate the hairline. There is nothing natural about it. You do have to be careful up front becuase I could see where the track begins. The only reason they made a big deal about this wig was becuase of the 'invisible L' part. But it's not really all that great and even all that realistic looking. Plus, you don't have a lot of diversity with wig to part it yourself. You might have to tweeze it a bit. But it was hard for me to adjust the wig on my head to a proper setting to make it look real. It's already if you need to get out and run some errands.

I'm not one to go crazy over any type of granola/nutritional bars or things of that nature. I gave this a try and realized I had been missing out. I've passed these Fiber One bars on the shelves so many times in Wal-Mart and can kick myself.For one, I like that it's high in fiber. I've had years of constipation and have tried many things. There was one time I ate three of these in one day, and the next day, I had to run to the toilet.The taste is very flattering. It does not taste like it has 'medicine' in it. It actually tastes fun, almost causing me to eat too many than I should. I try to eat them in between means for a little snack. The peanut butter taste is very real. They don't feel hard or feel like they'll break your teeth. They were always the right feeling to me.My calorie count profile gave this product a grade B. It said high in fiber as a plus, but bad becuase it was high in sugar.Can't just eat one.

I'm 27 years old5'4 and in between 164-3 pounds and was able to complete this 60-minute workout.From the DVD menu the workout is broken down into sections if you do not wish to do all of them.Ada and her partners are situated on some kind of airship base with idled helicopters stationed in the background. Her partner's bodies give excellent motivation for me to continue my toning and firmness. They are very disciplined, helping you keep count of the repetitions, which seem to be 16-count for a set of moves almost every time.The first part is a lengthy warm-up, one that already made me fatigue a little, especially in my arms. This is about 7 minutes.The next part is the low impact aerobics. Some of the moves will frustrate you becuase of the long 16-repetitions. There are lunges, squats, lots of arm movement, knee-lifts, which will be exaggerated. But there is no hopping, running, or jogging. It's low impact, but because it's low, she's going to make you make up for it. This is about 25 minutes. But stopping at this level, I burned a little over 200 calories.The Strength training is dealing with weights of maybe 2 to 4 pounds. I would not go higher than that unless you're just a really big guy. You'll be standing for the dumbbell part. Then toward the end of the dumbbell, she work on the front and back squats, then some lunges. She'll then take you to the floor/mat where you'll work severely on the abdominal. Believe me, I FELT that workout, but it excited me becuase I knew it was working. She'll have you do tiny pulse sit ups and lots of them! She also aims at the buttocks as well. This is about 22 minutes.The last part is the total body stretch and that is 7 minutes. This DVD is definitely worth the money. I'd highly recommend this.

***Menu Screen***1) Play Entire Belly Blast Walk2) Play Just the Belly Blast 2-Mile Walk3) Play Belly Blasting Floor Session 14) Play Belly Blasting Floor Session 2***PROS***I have way more than a pudgy stomach and have always hated it. I noticed in both miles she really fires up that area with some really good unique moves I had never seen her do in her other DVDs. These more are very effective. For example, when you do kicks, she'll make you hit your knees as if you have a hammer. I noticed when I did that, I could really feel my core fire up. There is a LOT of high intensity moves such as hopping, jumping, shifts, twists, and leg swings. Bre is there to modify the moves if you prefer a low-intensity workout.I was out of breath, my feet hurt,and she kind of got on my knees, which I should have wore a knee pad for this workout. You will need a sports bra or your stuff will jiggle :pThe first floor work session is my most favorite becuase she spends about 15 to 20 minutes targeting your abs in many different ways. I noticed when I woke up the next day, my stomach was sore. So, it's very effective stuff. Plus the music during this session is WAY comforting. I raised the windows to let the sunlight in, put on cool air and just relaxed through the session.I burned about 204 calories during the mile part.***CONS***I knocked one star off this rating becuase the music was tough to hear. That was the ONLY thing I disliked about the workout.She does tend to get off step a lot when she's trying to match with the music.***OTHER***Unfortunately, I can't review the floor session 2 part because it was too difficult for me. So, I apologize for that. All I know is that she makes you get on your stomach and tries to help you balance your weight on your core. I could NOT do that! So, I believe you're on your back in the first session, and on your stomach and knees on the second.This is worth buying becuase every time I did this workout, I felt my abs.

I'm a 27-year-oldBetween 163-157 pounds***PROS***I do tons of Leslie Sansone workouts where I'm either twisting, jumping, bouncing, or jogging in place. Also I use a Stepper exercising machine. When doing both of these workouts, sometimes one or both of my knees began to feel a little pressured. So, I tried on the Bracoo knee support and actually did notice change, A LOT.When I'm on the stepper, my left knee is very relaxed and absent of pressure. Sometimes I forget about my knee or even wearing it. When I did the Leslie Sansone workout while bouncing, I noticed my knee was still improved.***CON***I'm a big disappointed that only one was packaged. I know it said it was only one, but when one knee improves, you want the other to feel the same. You can tell a difference between the two knees.***NEUTRAL***If you don't wrap it around your knee correctly, the part that suppose to stick on can irritate you or make you feel like something is stabbing into your skin. So, just take your time when you're putting it on. I'd recommend not too tightly.I've used this at least 8 times and it's going strong. It is definitely a big difference and when I take it off, my knee is still okay.

If you're looking to buy the Teal Stripe color AS shown in the picture, it won't look like that color. Please be advised that many of these photos are used with a flash. When I got it in the mail, it just looks similar to a regular green. I already have a regular green. The seller apologized for the inconvenience but did not bother to resolve the issue.As a customer I know I should have known better, but at the same time, sellers really need to represent their merchandise as accurate as possible. The teal color was a beautiful color that I couldn't wait to get, and I get something that was not the same and am very disappointed. I can sort of see a difference in the color, but it's not the tone that I wanted. It's not even worth shipping back for a return since the price of shipping will be equal or more to the refund.As far as my size, I am between 163-157 poundsChest 39inWaist 38 1/2Hips 42.A simple large fit very well. It's soft, it stretches, and I even wore a sports bra under it and I still felt comfortable.Copy the link below to see the comparisons between the picture and the one I received. And yes I did use a flash.[...]

The directions say to leave the foam on for 4 minutes and do NOT exceed 10 minutes. Then it says to use a damp cloth to rinse it off, but don't rub. After that, rinse your whole leg thoroughly and then dry. It says to clean the actuator and replace cap between uses, which does not make a lot of sense considering it only came with one cap (somebody correct me if I'm not understanding).I've used this about three times and there's still half the bottle left. It has a good amount. I usually spray a thick coating over my legs just to avoid not being able to get some hairs removed and having to do it a second time. I don't spray my whole legs. I only spray the obvious hair areas. I have African skin with a huge problem with hair spots, and I'm just scared that using razors will just create more of them.I usually take a small towel, dip it in warm water and then apply it to my legs in circular motion. There is no pain or feeling of hair being yanked out. It just easily washes away. I have exceeded more than 4 minutes for sure, but even so, I have not felt any pain or stinging, etc. But you do feel like some chemical is on your legs; like you can tell there's a difference going on.Afterward, my legs do feel soft. On a scale of 1 to 5, I would say 2 about the some irritable feeling when you rub or touch your legs, but I usually apply lotion to make it all better.Would I buy this again? Probably not. I'm not entirely comfortable with chemicals on my skin. But it's something nice and easy to have during the spring and summer seasons when you want to look nice.

I am a 27-year-old woman5'4and between 163-157 poundsShoe size 8When I got this in the mail, I was too excited about it. It came in a two to three inch wide box with a set of instructions. It was already assembled, so all I had to do was just used it. I immediately put it on the floor and jumped on it. And to my amazement, this actually does get your abs fired up. It's not a machine, which I thought it was. It just has plates that help or make it easier for you twist your body, or give you that sensation that you want to twist.I did this for 30 minutes three days in a row. The first time, I watched a TV show with it. The second time, I played music worth 30 minutes, and then the third time, I watched another TV show. I developed what felt like a cramp below my ribcage but then it went away eventually. It is REALLY tough keeping this up for 30 minutes because once your stomach starts stinging, you want to get off. But don't, because it gets easier as you go. You have to move your arms side to side positioned at chest height to help you move. The instructions said to have one knee bent, which in some ways can be tricky because you feel you might step off balance. But I've had a habit of just keeping my legs straight. My balance abilities have actually been impressive. It's rare of me to step off unintentionally.Your arms also get tired as well. So, it's like you're getting a workout for your abs and arms. The instructions did say if you want to pump it up a bit use some weights. I tried that with 5 pounds but it was too much. Try 2 pounds. I also felt my bowel movements going to work. I love ANYTHING that makes me run to the toilet, especially when you have those days where you can't.**CONS**1) Some cons are that if you are barefoot on this, the structure of the plate can hurt or irritate your feet. I wore house shoes or sandals the second time and had no problem.2) I HATE that the plate twists around when you're trying to watch or keep an eye on something. So while you're twisting, it also kind of makes you twirl around. So, I can't face the TV the entire time I'm on it. For a few seconds I may be facing a wall, then a window, my computer, and then back to the TV a few seconds. Absolutely despise this.3) I'm surprised that by as much burning that I feel in my stomach, I have not woken up the next morning to aching abs, which makes me feel like I have not done enough. So, maybe this can be a pro if you have no aching muscles that prevent you from working out. But I really would have liked to have felt that I just made a difference.My stomach is currently 39 inches and I'm looking forward to seeing that go down. I hate my stomach and am trying to flatten it down. Ugh! I will keep updating you guys!UPDATE 3/14/13When doing this for 30 minutes, calories burned (according to my calorie watch) are around 151 calories. When I did the exercise today, the cramps were actually worse than they were before. So, for every song that finished, i took a small break in between songs worth 30 minutes. Honestly, I believe this disk will work, but it's a dreadful workout. You're on a disk twisting for 30 minutes. Ugh.

I done tons of fun voice overs and other fun projects and this mic has been my friend, my only friend. It's easy to store when you don't need it and it does not take up a lot of room. The cord to it is pretty lengthy for comfort and it's very easy to install.Now, this mic does pick up on a lot of white noise, either that, or I'm just using the wrong program.

**INFO**I am a 27-year-old womanaround 163-157 poundsI am 5'4 and my first round on the stepper has been a success. My progress was doing 1442 steps in 32 minutes and I burned 200 calories. The workout REALLY hurts, meaning if it's your first time using one of these things, you'll feel your muscles being challenged. I know the front of my thighs were kind of firing up, but so was my upper butt cheeks. I could have sworn I felt something in my abs as well. I don't know. But you get tired easily because it's hard work, especially depending on how the resistance/tension knob is set. But I am impressed.**PROS**1) It already came assembled. The only thing I had to do was tighten the pulley under it.2) It does record your time, repetitions, and calories burned. And they are easy to see from above.3) I didn't really feel like i had to balance on anything else since the machine does not have any handles to keep balance on.4) It does not heat up, not to my knowledge. I used it for half an hour and things were still going great.5) It is very easy to store away. It is not really heavy, but heavy enough to break your toes if you're not careful. I just slid it under my futon.6) Your progress does not reset. If there is a reason you have to step off the machine to do something, it will pause. It will not reset without your permission.**CONS**Can't think of any at the moment.I will keep updates on my progress.Update2/12/14I am using this for the second time and I had a little squeaking on the other side. It probably just needs lubricating.2/23/14The stepper is still going strong. I had lubricated the squeaking sounds successfully. You can really feel it burning your upper buns. I think soon I'm going to have a butt that everybody will stare at. O_o!

When you open it up, there are three sections; one for your cards, which there are two slot areas. The second section consist of a zipper section with two sides inside. To me, this is the most secure area becuase of the zipper for money and coins. The last section in the back is where your phone can be stored. However, I don't use it for that. I just put coupons and other things back there. Be aware the section is not very secure. So, if you put change back there, it will fall out from the little spaces below.I've had this wallet for about half a year and it STILL looks very good. There are no tears and wears. I got mines from EBAY for around 5 bucks, free shipping.2/14/14 UpdateI did discover that even from the middle zipper section, some coins can still slip from under and into the back area. Ugh. Anyway, It's best to get a little coin pouch you can hook it up with then to rely on coins for this wallet.2/15/14While I was in the store, my coins kept falling out onto the floor. Sometimes we're very quick with shoving stuff in our wallets, but this lets you know that the back part of the wallet is VERY unreliable for coins. Just wanted to point that out.

I am around 163 pounds27 years old5'4 and this little thing got me tired by even just 30 seconds into the workout. I did not want to give up just yet because I really wanted to get my money's worth. I had eaten two Subway Oatmeal cookies which total 400 calories. I really wanted to burn those suckers off. But with only doing 1442 repetitions in 30 minutes, I managed to burn 205 calories (that's what the monitor read).**PROS**1) It will get the job done. I know it's cheap and looks like it's not a lot, but it got my front thighs and my upper butt cheeks on fire. I would love a full and firm butt not only for looks but your butt muscles are the biggest muscles and if those are firm, they really  help out with your metabolism (Or so Leslie Sansone said). I was really tired on the first round but I had to push myself.2) You can adjust the tension/resistance at the bottom front if you want to push yourself. I had to loosen it. it's really tough work.3) It's not heavy at all or takes up a lot of room. No, it cannot fold for lower storage.4) It does record your time, your repetitions, and calories burned.5) The machine will not reset your progress. So, if you stop working out like to go to the bathroom or answer the door, it will pause until you come back.6) It does not make a lot of noise.**CONS**1) The machine is very simple, meaning there's not a lot to it. For example, there's no place to hold your remote or water bottle.2) It does not record your heart rate.3) The manual instructions was a little confusing despite putting it together around 30 minutes. There was a picture in the instructions with all the parts creating a skeletal scene of it, and that was rather more helpful than the actual instructions.**NEUTRAL**1) The stem coming up does rock a little, but not much (It could just be the way that I set it together). Sometimes I'm afraid to even lean on it.2) I'm 5'4 as described earlier, but getting on it makes me feel like I'm too tall. The machine is not very leveled, as if it makes me feel like there was a part I missed that I did not install.Overall, I love the machine. It's not perfect, but I'm glad I'm getting something out of it. I will continue to give some updates as I go becuase I read that this thing does break apart earlier than expected. So, we'll see.2/16/14 UpdateI'm continuing on the stepper and you guys have no idea how much my upper buns are on fire. This stuff is VERY tough and I don't even have it on high resistance. It's TOUGH! I don't really feel it as much in my back leg, but rather my front thighs, but the butt area is the worst. That's what makes you want to get off.3/2/14 UpdateThe stepper is still going strong and the workout is still very tough. I managed to get past 30 minutes and into maybe 45 minutes becuase I played a video game and that really got me distracted from the workout.

Keep in mind that I promise to give numerous updates about this product as I go along**PROS**1) The product already came assembled. The only thing that was detached was the resistance/tension knob. That was no big deal at all. The Instructions manual looks like it comes in three languages, English, Spanish, and maybe French. However, there's not a lot to read though. It just shows labeling of parts of the machine, how to unlock and lock the legs, how to work the tension knob and then it goes into detail what the machine operation records.Yes, there is a battery but you need a screwdriver to get it open.2) It's easy to use/operate. The legs can fold inward for easier storage. I just slipped mines under my futon when I'm done.3) The peddler space is pretty spacey. So, if you have big feet (size 8 for me), you should fit it perfectly. I did leg workout without any shoes or socks and I didn't really feel any discomfort.4) It has a nice height. I was doing this on my futon, which my futon is about a foot in height off the floor, and I was still able to workout out comfortably by watching TV.5) If you stop working out for whatever reason, like you have to answer the phone, the machine will pause your progress such as calorie count, number of repetitions, and time. It won't reset unless you make it reset. Even if you get back to it hours later, it still has your last progress. So, it looks like it won't reset without your permission**CONS**1) The ONLY con I had so far was that I wish the bridge that holds the legs could be adjusted more. So, if you have a small table you wanted to set this on, it may not work. It is possible to have one of the legs not lock to make it narrower, but then as you're doing the arm workout, it might move and became imbalanced. With the legs spread out like you see in the picture, it is slightly over 18 1/2 inches wide. So, make sure your desk or table can handle that.**Neutral**Yes, it does overheat, it even has the warning sticker on there about it. I was using this for about 25 minutes and noticed the metal parts near the peddles were warm. But that was never a big deal to me because I used it for nearly 60 minutes and it's not like it was ready to scorch something. It was just noticeable that it was hot. Now the metal part near the black machine are the hottest parts.**My Progress**I'm 27 years old163 pounds5'4 heightSome reviews said that this was meant for people that could do minimum workout. But as I did it, I could really feel the burn in my arms, mainly in my right arm for whatever reason, but that's because I was using it in a chair while sitting on the futon. That might not have been the best thing. But it definitely got to my arms.It is a really good workout plan while watching TV for leg workout. I cozied up with the blanket over me and my legs and I just peddled all through the TV shows and did not realize I ended up burning 511 calories, basically that tasty Wendy's burger I had just a few hours ago was now burned off.**Results**25 minutes1529 repetitions218 Calories burned40 minutes2468 repetitions352 Calories burned59 minutes3581 repetitions511 calories burnedThis was all done in one night. And it looks like if you do 700 counts, you burn 100 calories. I just stopped here and there to record progress. I love it. I am very pleased with the machine. Good price as well. I just hope it lasts awhile. If you have any questions feel free to ask. I am a heavy loyal Amazon customers. So, I log in everyday to check progress.Update2/10/14I was playing a video game and burned 600 calories with 4200 spins in 70 minutes. I found out you can also reverse the peddling. It really does help time fly by. It still gets warm as you go, but it's not really hot.3/2/14For some reason, the monitor at one point stopped counting my progress. I just happened to look down and it was stuck on the same numbers even as I kept peddling. I tried resetting, but nothing worked. So, I left it alone. I pulled it out another day and it happened again. So, I figured it must have been the battery, but I haven't even used it that much for the battery to already be drained. I snapped off the monitor but couldn't really understand anything. I tried putting it back on but it's mysteriously tough to secure it back on. Now, it's just hanging. Also, every time I tighten the tension, I notice that it just resets by itself. So, it's like you can't really workout with a difficult tension setting for long.3/14/14I finally was able to snap the monitor inside again. But it took much effort and I really could have hurt myself. It pinched one of my fingers and it hurt a lot. I had to start by sticking the bottom part in first, and then leaning the rest into it. Then, I had to mash down or apply pressure. Ridiculous.

Ladies, you need to be aware that sometimes sellers just can't seem to correctly advertise something. The picture is amazing! That's why I bought it in the first place. But if you're 5'4, this is just going to look like a regular sweater. It did not even go past my hips. I bought mines from Ebay from an oversees seller for around $16 and I forced the seller to give some kind of partial refund for selling me something that wasn't promising. You have to be really short for this to mimic the advertising picture. Very disappointed.

I was unsure about this DVD becuase I have tried dancing workouts, especially Zumba and just could not keep up or was convinced my body was getting a good workout. But given that I'm a big Leslie fan, I went ahead and experienced it. Boy did it leave a smile on my face!**TIME**There is no timer at all, but given the fact that the music and positive faces keep you occupied, I highly doubt a timer is needed. But it's consisted of 3 miles, which each mile is typically 15 minutes each. The 1 mile complete message will pop up on the bottom left corner without her even saying anything. I think she only mentioned it once. So, the three miles are really connected as one. You just keep going.**WORKOUT SETUP**This DVD is really HIGH-intensity. My mother is 50 years old, 202 poundish and was able to keep up. But it wasn't her kind of thing just yet (she's lost 12-16 pounds with Leslie workouts). She just had a problem with not wearing a sports bra, which you WILL need for this workout. But she felt she wasn't entirely ready for a workout like this. There is a lot of jumping/bounce, twists, shifts. I am around 163 pounds and this workout was fine with me. It got me catching my breath but it wasn't an impossible workout.The first part is kind of like a warm-up and then afterward, she gives you a small feel of what to expect. But after that is interval time. You'll do a steady and calm walk for 2 minutes and then for 20 seconds you go into high intensity. I can't help but get so pumped up and excited every time the high intensity part comes, becuase the people are so positive and loud. I think she does the intervals four times. Then after that, you kind of really get into the dancing, which pretty much are the same moves you've done with her before, there is just some modification.**PEOPLE**Someone mentioned that it looked like she hired professional dancers. It seems that way for SOME of them, but I don't think so. Sometimes you will see them doing their own thing, having just a little too much fun. Some will sing and maybe even be too dramatic about it. I remember sometimes being a little annoyed, but oh well. Laura from Five Really Big Miles DVD is there. I LOVED seeing her still in the game and I hope to see more of her in other DVDs. My most favorite person was Marvin (in all black with a hat). He seems like a sweet guy and I never fail to develop this warm feeling every time the camera is on him. Nick from Walk it Off in 30 days is there. He looks way different without his beard. Overall, everybody is in rainbows and unicorns. Way too happy, but VERY inspiring.**MUSIC**The music is actually very impressive. It's very moving and it makes you want to give your best. There was maybe one song that was 'bleh'. But I'd give it a 4.5/5.**MY EXPERIENCE**First try = Burned 292 caloriesSecond Try = Burned 285Third try - Burned 272 caloriesThe trick is to exaggerate arm movement!I did try this workout with wrist weights and while it's possible, your arms will get really tired, especially with all the jumping and twisting, but it really adds to the arms getting a more fair workout. I had 1.5 pounds each.I usually combine this workout with her other DVD called Walk to the hits Party Songs and just do them both at the same time.Very cool workout.

I had took a leap of faith to purchase a different kind of bread from the normal routine bread I and my family buy (From Wal-Mart). I'm actually not really big on bread. It's the kind of food I normally don't eat. But I have been suffering from constipation on and off throughout my life. I picked up the Nuttygrain flavor for three reasons1) To eat something healthy2) It was around a reasonable number of calories per slice3) It had 20% fiber!It's even got a grade A on my calorie counter profile after I input it into my daily calorie intake.To give you a background on my form of constipation (not that I'm trying to be gross, but hopefully, this could help someone else), I go to the bathroom for #2 at least once a day, and that's usually in the mornings or around early afternoon. I'm lucky if I can go again. It's not that I have a hard stool, it's the fact that my body does not give me strong enough signals to push. So, sometimes I have to force myself to go and while I have some success, it still does not feel effective. I am active in exercise and have been eating fruits like crazy. Barely see a change. I have used suppositories and even drunk that nasty Lemon flavored Magnesium Citrate (if you drink this, I  highly suggest you get the grape flavor).Well, all that changed when I started eating this bread for just a few days. I was visiting the bathroom twice to triple than my usual visit. I am beyond impressed and feel like I made a new friend. Even as I type this, I have the urge to go!As far as the taste; it's not the most delicious but definitely not the nastiest. It takes exactly what you'd expect it to taste by just looking at it. In other words, it's easy enough to eat. I eat one to two slices a day just to make it last. I had bought the 18-slice package.***EDIT***1/16/13I ate two slices today and all throughout the day, my bowel movements or stools came out smoothly without much effort to push. I am beyond impressed right now. Maybe I should start making a sandwich out of these slices.

I got this around May of 2013. I used it almost every time I worked out doing high intensity aerobics, or walking on track. It has the adjustable band and the back of the watch does have that cold plate.**Some Main FEATURES**It does allow your to input- Time- Your Weight- Age- Height- Gender- Time- High, Medium, or Low sensing to track your movementDuring workout you can track your heart rate, steps, miles, and calories burned. There is a light button for if you can't see in the dark.***PROS***1) The heart rate is accurate, at least in opinion. I checked it by watch and by counting my heart rate another method. Both came to similar numbers.2) The calorie may not be accurate in how much it keeps up with your movement, but it seems to count up to the same amount of calories for specific workouts. For example. I do Leslie Sansone workouts. For her 4-Mile Power work, the watch would always tell me I burn between 400 and 500 calories. I never got below 300.. For A Gilad workout I've done at least two to three times, it always came out to around 200-261. So the watch does not give you crazy numbers you have not seen before for the same workouts.***ANNOYING CONS***1) There would be times where I'm afraid to do high intensity workouts becuase there were times where the watch reset either by itself, or I'd move my arms so intensely that the 'reset' button brushes up against my wrist and resets my progress. There was one time I was doing a long workout and wanted to see my progress at the end. I was VERY disappointed to see that only 42 or so calories were burned after nearly an hour's worth of exercise. One reason it may reset without your consent is that maybe it was shaking too much/dramatically. The other reason is that when you bend your wrist against the watch, the reset button is mashed.2) If you do not turn the watch off, it will just continue running, counting calories even when you do nothing or not wearing it. If you do turn it off and then turn it back on, all of your data will be erased. You will have to input it all back in. It's such a shame this watch does not have a 'sleep' mode at least.3) I would say around the middle of December 2013, I've grown detached from the watch becuase I felt it wasn't keeping up accurately, like it was slowing down. I don't ever turn it off, though. So, maybe the battery was degrading. I don't know. But I did some exercises where I knew based on instinct I was burning more than what the watch was showing me. to me it was slowing down. Now, I don't trust it much.I say buy this watch if it's on sale. It's not worth $20. I'm currently looking to get another brand.

My size is between 165-157 poundsChest size 39 inWaist 38 inHips 425'4 in height.I bought a size Large and this shirt seemed like it just fit so perfectly. It makes you feel like it brings out your figure. It sticks or hugs you but at the same time, you're comfortable. It is MUCH gorgeous in person than online. The colors seem to brighten out. Awesome!

I've been playing games ever since i was about 13 years old. I'm a female video gamer and i'm almost 23 now, but i've never ran into a game like THIS. Yes i've played the other metal gears, but nothing like this!!! I dont even know where to begin.To start off with the Graphics in this game, its fantastic, its almost as if youre watching a movie. everything is perfect and neat, even movements of their mouths in coversations. everything just about looks as real as it can get.The Bosses are just like your normal Metal Gear bosses like Raven, Mantis, Sniper Wolf, Fortune, Vamp, The End, The Fear etc... Only this time you'll get a blast out of these new bosses. I must admit, the bosses were challenging. like for example, when i fought Laughing Octopus, i was having a hard time finding her, but i was also like "crap, this is a good boss fight!!" and when i fought Crying Wolf I spend most of most of my time hiding under the truck becuase i was getting a bit freaked out, but it was fun as heck!!!!!!!!!!The cutscenes are a bit longer then the past metal gears, there's ALOT of explaining and you have to pay attention and try not to doze off. I did not understand everything they said, but there were times where i wish they had'nt exaggerated some points in the game. but the majority of the cutscenes were actually pretty goodMetal gear fans get to do ALOT more in this game then you could in other Metal Gears. one of the first events i enjoyed doing was trying to find Naomi's footprints, then afterwards being chased by the GECKOs while Snake had protect the tank from being attacked, i loved being on the bike with old Eva and seeing slow-motion scenes. and *******Spoilers, i enjoyed that they brought Snake back to shadow moses. It brought back memories, i enjoyed that mission more than anything in this MG4 plus getting to ride the very thing that tried to Kill snake, the Rex. *********Thats another thing thats awesome about this game, you'll have reappearing characters. bascially MG4 will answer all the remaining questions you have.In this Metal Gear you can buy weapons, or more like buy the license for it. when you pick up stuff or depending how youre doing in battle, you get points for it. so yea, now you have a little shopThe ending is the richest I've ever seen. I've never seen a game that had an ending that was almost an hour long.*~Bad Parts about the game *~The only bad parts about the game is that1)they did mix up the controls a bit, but its pretty tolerant. I was still use to "O" being the confirm button but they changed it to "X"2)Everytime youre in a different chapter the game has to install everytime, no matter how many times you've played the game3) Snake reloads TOOO slow.I didnt like the new Codec actually. I do give points up for the amazing movements of the characters on the screen, but i actually prefer the old fashion codec.If you've been a metal gear fan for a long time, Please i suggest you buy the last part of the story. i loved it ALOT!

I wasnt sure if I should buy this product since nobody had given a review, but i went ahead and bought it because i've been wanting a bible on DVD for a long time. So I decided not to put it off any longer.The bible is divided by the books and then by chapters. For example, Genesis chapter 1, 2, etc. You can easily pick up where you left off.I laid in my bed one night, and just listened to the narrator. He is a very good speaker and is very GOOD at pronouncing some of the difficult names people had back then. The screen shows an open big book with the text there. The background behind it is just of some kind of land with a lot of trees.  There are no sound effects but just the sound of his voice going through the story with us.its worth buying. But keep in mind that you may need to keep hold of that remote because since the bible is hard to understand at times, you may need to pause or slow down. I did rewind a bit.**Update** 7/17/13It's unfortunate how this DVD seems to lack a lot of commands. For example, I can't pause. I'd press the pause button over and over and a bit red circle with a slanted line in the middle pops up. How can a DVD not let you pause? It's the same with fast forwarding. Playing it from a PS3 seems to work a lot better.

**bad things about it**There was nothing wrong with the story, actually it was just a continuation of Legend, so there was NOTHING wrong with THAT part, however i believe they really screwed it up this time. I mean Tomb Raider Angel of Darkness was much better then this.Camera angles. everyone has already said it before, its too awkward.Numerous glitches. you die, you came to life, your bike is somewhere else, far away instead of being by your side. you get stuck in places that don't make sense. there was one time i moved a rock, all of the sudden the camera got stuck behind it and then my screen turned black, i had to kill her to start over from the save point. There are no boss battles, you have LITTLE enemy encounters, meaning, you battle the SAME kind of creatures throughout the game.There are TOO many secrets that she finds, there like 50 secrets in one level and 20 in others. its like she finds them in OBVIOUS places but then 20 steps later, she finds another. whats the point in having them if they are too obvious? plus the secrets only unlocks pictures, no cinematics, no outfits, just pictures.you cannot replay levels.you don't get to really keep all your weapons, you are given a choice to pick ONE before the level starts and it runs out of ammo.SPOILERSat the end i was pretty disappointed, i mean I felt that Lara never got a real closure. once her mother appeared in the form of a Thrall, Lara just shot her off the ledge and THAT WAS IT. that was the end of the moment that we've all waited for. I dont think it even lasted a minute.another thing, the ending didnt make sense. Did Lara leave amanda to die or not? they cut that off.**good things about it**The graphics are BEAUTIFULLara looks good, thats about it.

When I first saw the teasing trailer, i was about to fall to the floor and die. I wanted the game so bad, and it was all i thought about while i was in School. I even visited their website on a number of occasions. well, my dramatic acts were all for nothing. Its like waiting for santa to come down the chimney to give you a toy, but instead gives you a pile of crap.The reason i gave it a low rating, was because this game did NOT CONCENTRATE on Yuna's mission. It barely explained anything. Yuna was ALWAYS distracted, someone was always in trouble, someone always needed her to do something, she was always in some kind of tournament or running errands. I mean this game should have been called "Final Fantasy X-2: Sidequest", becuase 80% of the game was just sidequests, had NOTHING to do with the storyline.Yuna goes through a HUGE transformaton. she goes from this goodie two shoe I-must-follow-the-teachings-of-Yeavon down to earth Summoner, to this pop-singing, skin-revealing Sphere Hunter, she hopes to find these spheres that would explain why her beloved Tidus disappears or maybe hopes to find him again. She's more energetic, she's still loved by the people, you may encounter a few who believer her fame days are over and wont even bother giving her the special treatment.The reason i say her missions barely have anything to do with the story is becuase she finds all these spheres and almost everyone of them is a disappointment accept one she found in Kilika of Shuyin. THAT sphere was a pretty good one, why couldnt they find more spehere like that one?I wanted to know more about Shuyin, I wanted to Know more about Lenne and WHY they had such a strong connection to Yuna and Tidus, besides the dressphere she wore. They should have gave Yuna another dream where she woke up as Lenne and had the story shift into THEIR time and see how their lives were portrayed. I really wanted to know just STUFF about them, how did they meet! how did Lenne do in battle?They do introduce some new characters such as Paine, LeBlanc, Logos, Ormi, Barilai, Nooj and Gippal. It would be nice if they made a seperate game for Baralei, Nooj and Gippal.YOu can revist some places from the first Series and even speak to the same characters. the music wasnt really all that great, the moonflow song made me want to go crazy.I have to admit, i did enjoy the battle system, the girls have a handful of dressphers to choose from, so i enjoyed all the different kinds of magic and transformations.Yuna can play blitzball, but you can't control her, or anyone for that matterthere are 4 endings depending on what you do during the game.The game was bascially just a charlie's angel type. three girls on random missions. *sigh*

Anytime there are highschool to college students in a horror film, I think you pretty much know what's going to happen. Once always decides to check out a spooky place, a couple splits up from the group to make out, one by one their friends start dying off. The Movie is pretty good, it has some very creepy scense, but you have to keep your eye on the movie. There are things that happen pretty quick in my opinion. it also has Days Of Lives Actress Rachel Melvin who plays Chelsea. This movie is probably what got her started. It's worth seeing.

This was an early Solstice gift for someone and the recipient loved it. Would definitely recommend for any Coheed and Cambria fans in need of some warmth without sacrificing repping some excellent music or their style.

I know most people are looking at this for the kids in their lives but I got this for my boyfriend who is a huge TMNT fan and has been his whole life, because I totally don't mind sharing our sleeping space with the turtles :P I agree with the other reviews that say it's not the softest pillowcase but it's not painfully scratchy ot anything. It looks super cool and the fact it's reversible is nice. I would definitely recommend this for the TMNT loving kid (or kid at heart)  in your life.

I've bought these in both the 3 and 6 feet lengths for my phone. I keep a small one in my bag and the long ones are great for at home. The downside is that I've owned at least 6 of these in less than 4 months and they have all broken except for one small one. The micro end ends up coming loose and it won't charge devices anymore. Each time I've bought a new one I've made a point to be even more gentle with it than I already had been. I do love these chargers when they work, they just don't seem to work long enough :/ ...yet I keep buying them.

These are really cute and super cheap. I ordered my usual size and they fit, but like other reviewers said, they're a bit snug but not uncomfortably so. I think they'll break in from being worn. If you're worried, order a size up.

I hadn't bought a new bathing suit in years and decided I needed to. Ordering this type of thing online is always tricky but Amazon is pretty good about returns so I went for it.I read the other reviews and decided to order a size up to help combat the shorts-riding-up problem, but unfortunately it's still an issue. The top fits well when dry but it starts to float up a little bit at the bottom when swimming. I've labeled this as fitting "somewhat small" due to the shorts, but the top is as expected. For those who have said the top doesn't have enough room in the chest, I'd like to point out that the little tie in the front under the bust is actually adjustable and not just decoration, in case you didn't know.So, I can exchange this for my usual size and get a better fitting top and have shorts that ride up even worse, or I can keep this size and deal with the top being a bit loose and floaty in the water, or I could keep this suit AND buy a smaller one and mix the tops and bottoms, but a big reason I went with this suit in the first place was the price, so I've decided to just keep it. If this bathing suit had drawstrings in the sides like many do this problem would be an easy fix!All in all, it fits okay. It's not uncomfortably tight or so loose it's a tent that you can't keep down. It's also simple but cute and under $50 so it's worth trying out. Worst case, you return it.

I almost want to give this tent 4 stars but I just can't. Let's start with the pros and cons:Pros:Easy to set up. As others reviewers stated, getting the ends of the poles in the pockets was a little tricky but it wasn't half as difficult as other people made it sound. 2 adults (and by "adult" I mean an 18 year old girl and a 20 year old girl) had it up in about 10 minutes.It's pretty roomy for a 3 man. I'm only about 5'4 but my friend who set it up with me is around 6". There was more than enough room for her to lay anywhere in the tent, but since the middle goes further out, that would probably be the best place for a taller person to lay. We were going to have another person tent with us but stuff came up. Anyway, the third person is around 5'7 and I have no doubt she would have comfortably fit in with us.Cons:It leaks quite a bit in 2 places, but I think seam sealer will take care of it.Even with nobody sleeping in it for 6 days (we left it up in my backyard for a bit to see how it handled some pretty strong rain) it got a small hole in the inside floor. It's so small that a tiny duct tape patch will be more than enough to fix it, but I think the fact it wasn't being used and was on soft ground and it still got a tear is a bit ridiculous. I'm worried about ripping it now. On the bright sid, these tents have pretty long warranties (10 years), but I'm not 100% sure what it covers.The ventilation is so-so.I'm not outright disappointed in this tent but I have a friend who's equally priced and sized tent of another brand survived being left up from summer all the way through a snowy New England winter, then was ready to use as if nothing ever happened by the following summer. That tells me that even for the cheap price, this tent could be better.

I’ve been using this type of cat litter for the last month or so and lemme tell you, it blows. It’s supposed to be “natural” but still clumping/scoopable (or in my case, roll-able with the Omega Paw Self-Cleaning Litter Box) but IT LIES. All it does is make the entire room smell like pee and oranges (cats hate citrus so wtf?), no matter how often I clean it it smells like piss and fruit, and possibly most importantly: it doesn't clump very well at all. It crumbles apart and you can clean the box all you want but there'll still be dirty chunks and grains of used litter you just don't get out -- ESPECIALLY if you're not manually scooping the clumps.This litter currently has like 77 one star reviews, 14 two star reviews, and 10 three star reviews on Amazon out of 170 reviews total which means it it has 101/170 bad to ‘meh’ reviews so clearly I’m not makin’ this up. It's awful. My cat doesn't see to like it either. I'm switching ASAP.For the record, Precious Cat clumping litter is the best I’ve used to dateYou will never know when your cat goes to the bathroom with that litter because you will never smell it and when you scoop the clumps, it actually stays together and leaves the rest of the litter clean. Her litterbox is currently located in my room (I got a new, bigger box recently that doesn't fit where the old one did and I'm yet to find a better place for it) and I still never know when she does her business with that litter. With this litter, it's impossible to not know. Both Cat and I are unhappy with this :(

For a while I wasn't feeding my cat the best food. I'd been wanting to switch her to something healthier for some time but I couldn't decide what type to go with, and while I want the best for my cat, I didn't want to shell out a good chunk of money on super expensive cat food only for her to end up not liking it or getting sick from it, y'know?I took into consideration grain free cat foods and 100% wet cat food diets, but decided that even a higher quality dry food would be better than what I was already giving her (Purina Kitten Kaboodle. Awful, I know!) That helped me narrow it down a little but I was still faced with a never ending list of brands and formulations to pick from. Purina One? Purina Pro Plan? Natural Balance? Wellness CORE? Taste of the Wild? Blue Buffalo? I settled on Pro Plan after talking with the person who runs the company's Twitter -- they were quite the salesman. Even if they hadn't reached out to me when I tweeted about my adventures in choosing a cat food, Pro Plan seemed like a good middle range option - it's significantly better than what I had already been feeding her, but not ungodly expensive. It also doesn't have as many bad reviews or claims of cats getting rashes, illness, etc from this food as other, pricier cat foods do. The only complaints I saw were from longtime customers whose cats noticed a change in the formula and would no longer eat it, but since my cat had never had Pro Plan before that didn't really matter.Even though I gradually switched her food by mixing it with her old kind, she was very picky at first and tried to eat around the Pro Plan. She eventually learned to like it and has been eating Pro Plan for about a month now. In that time, I've noticed that her fur is significantly shinier and softer, but hat's about the only difference I've seen, but it's better than seeing no difference at all. It hasn't made her sick and it's definitely better for her than her old food without being super pricey, so I'll probably be sticking with this for a while!

I used this dye on my sister who dyes her hair red a lot. She's currently out of work (recently had a baby) and hadn't dyed her hair in months (pregnant), so we decided it would be fun to do. She chose this color because it's a bit deeper than she normally does, and she wanted to have a more intense red than she can get away with at work while she doesn't have to work. Our plan was to use this and use something like Manic Panic over some pieces to make them even more red (which we've done before with her usual reds, and it always works out well), but this came out soooo dark it looks black until it's in the light. It's like purple-red black. It's lightened up after a wash or two, but still much darker than she anticipated. We didn't even bother with step 2, adding Manic Panic over sections, because we know it's so dark it won't make much of, if any, difference. It's a nice color, but not anything like it looks on the box. She's very fair (like me, which you can see in some of my other reviews of hair dyes I've used personally), so it's a much starker contrast than she anticipated.That said, the dye itself works well, processes quickly, and wasn't overly damaging to her hair. The shampoo/conditioner combo that comes with it seems to be working well for her also (she has very long, thick, curly hair). The dye starts out a deep cherry red which lead us to originally believe it would be much brighter than we expected, but it then turned purple-ish as it processed.

I have no idea what the other reviewers are talking about (fortunately!). I'm not saying that they're wrong or lying, just that I've never experienced what they have. Maybe they've gotten bad batches or I've just gotten lucky? I've purchased this watercolor set on two different occasions, the most recent purchase being last week. I saw that it was only about $12 on Amazon as opposed to $25-$30 elsewhere (which still isn't a bad price), and I wanted to see if they were somehow worse than the previous set I bought from Blick, since the reviews are erratic.The paint arrived in good condition, though the box had clearly been opened and taped back up. One of the tubes had some leakage -- not of the pigment, just of the carrier(?) fluid, the actual paint base. The paint inside looked perfectly fine and unaffected. It wasn't a big mess, all I had to do was rinse the tube under warm water.Other than that, the set is just as nice as the last time I bought it. The brush that comes with it is decent, the palette is just cheap thin plastic and you'll want to get something better, and the paints are, in my opinion, are impressively pigmented and smooth considering their type (student) and price range. Yes, they are the "academy" line, so they're not the same as you would get from Grumbacher's Artist line, or as perfect as Sennelier or Holbein, Old Holland, etc, but they're better than a lot of other student grade paints. I would recommend these if you're interested in trying watercolor or if you want a budget paint set that's better than a lot of others in the similar price ranges.A little goes a long way and they fairly easily re-wettable, as well as consistent in pigmentation and color saturation. The only issue is the tubes can be a little too pressurized at times, and sometimes I have slight issues with the pigment and the actual clear-ish paint base separating. Surprisingly, it doesn't seem to affect the quality, it's just annoying when semi-clear fluid comes out without pigment at first, but it all mixes back up fine if you squish the tube or just blend it back together in the palette. It's a small drawback, but other than that I've never had any problems. Definitely no color mixing issues or gritty textures like other reviewers describe!Maybe Amazon has a bad bunch, because if you look on Dick Blick's site, 100% of reviewers (12 currently) would recommend this product to a friend.

So my goal for the new year was to limit (and eventually entirely eliminate) animal products from my life, but then I was suddenly struck with the realization I might be gluten intolerant (it runs in the fam' and I've had persistent seemingly unexplainable and randomly occurring body ailments for over a year now so I figured I might as well try avoiding it and see what happens!)I knew I definitely wouldn't be able to work on cutting out meat, dairy, AND gluten if I couldn't find some tasty snackage in the process. Lucky for me, these definitely fit my requirements! While they are  a bit pricy in comparison to something like a pack of Oreos, it's worth it if you can't or don't want to be consuming gluten or animal products!They're hard cookies which I don't mind. The chocolate chip is probably my favorite because, obviously, the chocolate adds more sweetness and makes it taste more like a regular ol' chocolate chip cookie. The others aren't bad either but they are a little bit bland in comparison, but they definitely aren't gross or inedible. They're still sweet and yummy as a cookie should be. I'm almost certain you could give anyone these cookie without telling them that there's anything 'different' about them and they wouldn't complain.
Slightly smaller and slightly darker/softer than your typical .7mm HB mechanical pencil leads. If that's what you're looking for, then you'll be happy with this.

I love this stuff, it really does help clear your skin without drying it out too badly (though you should still always follow up with a moisturizer). I HATE the packaging though! I like pumps, but this one isn't very secure. Make sure you don't ever accidentally knock the bottle over because you will end up with pink goop everywhere, a room that reeks of salicylic acid, and wasted money. I have done this more than once. It's super annoying!

This is a nice, decent sized toy. The ball WILL come out with some tugging but I don't think any cat would be able to remove it. I like how it comes with catnip. My cat mostly just scratches or sits on the scratch pad, occasionally batting at the ball. She doesn't usually go nuts, but it does keep her interested and entertained at times.

Yes, you read that right. Don't laugh! I have an indoor cat but I like to let her go outside sometimes in warmer weather. I live on sort of a dead end road but it's right off an extremely busy 4 lane street and I just don't want to take the chance of having my cat get hit by a car or eaten by an animal (there's some woods in my backyard. I live in quite an odd space!). While she doesn't like to be walked, I'll put her in her cat harness hooked up to this and bring her out. Sometimes I put the leg of a patio chair in the hand slot, and she can roam around to her hearts content without me having to be worried about her going too far!

They're quite thin, but I'm okay with that. The other reviewers who had issues with the sticky pads are exactly right. They don't like to come off the paper easily and I ripped and ruined many of them. These will work if you have patience. They're fairly inexpensive (definitely more inexpensive than buying a standard bulletin board) so I can't complain a whole lot.

Other than the fact mine arrived cracked and I can't be bothered to go through the return/exchange process (not the product's fault!), this is a nice mirror. It's your standard regular/magnified makeup table mirror and it serves its purpose.
It feels cheap, the batteries are nearly impossible to get out once they're in, and it's quite flimsy but it DOES froth milk so there's that.

I prefer Punky Colour or Special Effects over Manic Panic but they don't always have the colors I need in stock or on Prime and I have to settle for MP. The color is pretty but I find that all Manic Panic shades fade and bleed much worse than the other brands I named, and they don't tend to fade out lighter/pastel versions of the original color, but to dulled, muted tones. This is especially true of the blues and greens.That said, this will work if you have no other color available. They look great when they first go one. They aren't bad colors but I prefer the longer-wearing brands I mentioned before. Also, Punky Colour smells like grapes!

I really like all of the lipstick in this line. I was expecting this one to be more purple than it is, it looks more like a darker version of Spellbound to me. I still think it's lovely though. The Lip Perfection lipsticks tend to have a long wear time and they leave a nice, even stain even after the actual stick part has come off.

These cards are super pretty. Whether you're using them for purely psychological reasons, intuitively, for divination, or just to put on display, they are absolutely beautiful. There are no set meanings but each card is bold and colorful and holds more possible meanings than you can even fathom.I like the size of the deck and the card stock, but they can be a little bit tricky to shuffle. That's my only complaint.

Pigmented, smooth, blendable and matches my fair skin pretty well. This can be dusted on lightly or built up, which is great. I usually use it over liquid foundation for extra coverage, but it could be used dusted on by itself for a fair amount of skin evening and coverage on its own.

My previous palette ran away and I needed to get a replacement ASAP. This is serving its intended purpose at an affordable price. It's a nice size and has a good amount of different types of wells. My only complaint is that I wish it had more of the smaller circular wells for pure straight-from-the-tube colors, though 8 is quite a few. In all reality, you can paint with just the 3 primaries so I shouldn't be complaining. I use about 9 colors on average so I only have to do without or find an odd space for one color which isn't too bad.The palette is made of a sturdy plastic and the 8 larger square wells are nice and roomy for mixing color. I like that they are separated instead of there just being one big white space. I am a (somewhat) clean and precise mixer, so the more wells and dividers a palettes has, the better. I haven't really used the 4 larger round ones for much yet, but I assume they'll be good for creating large amounts of needed colors or for very watery colors for washes.If you need a cheap but relatively large palette, this is a nice option. Don't worry about its lack of lid. You can use a large Ziplock bag (like the gallon sized ones) or even the clear bag it comes in if you can remove it carefully enough. If all else fails, plain old kitchen wrap will work. Don't fork over a ton of extra money for a locking lid you don't really need (unless you plan on traveling with it a ton, but even then...)

This isn't absolutely 100% waterproof and budgproof, but it is very long lasting and very black. This is one of the best eyeliner pencils I have found in this price range. It's very creamy when applied and while not waterproof, it does set pretty well and it is nicely pigmented. Try setting with black eyeshadow for added staying power (I do this with all eyeliners, waterproof or not)

I agree with what everyone else is saying: These are lovely but they aren't being advertised very well. When dry, they do look almost like tinted graphite, but they are not. They feel mostly like colored pencils - smooth and a little waxy. When wet, they look like muted but beautifully pigmented colored pencils. They are worth picking up and trying out if subtle tones and a versatile wet/dry media is what you're looking for.I like how they look and perform both wet and dry so I've got uses for these, but I'm still a bit disappointed in that they aren't what the title suggests. Derwent (or someone else) really should make some color-tinged graphite pencils, though.

Oh, Moleskines. How much hype you have. I've only been using Moleksines for the last few years so I can't really tell you for certain about the changes in construction and quality, but I can say that the current books are solid and nice, but I'm not entirely sure if they are worth the attention they receive or their often over-steeped price. There's nothing wrong with them, the paper is quite thick and lovely, the yellow tinted paper is pleasant to work against, and the construction is solid, but the fact of the matter is that I can find sketchbooks just as good if not better for the same or lesser price. I do like these sketchbooks and I may continue to pick them up on occasion (the watercolor Moleskines and the tiny pocket ones have more uses for me), but I am not as in love with these as everyone else is. However, I am still giving it a good rating because there is nothing wrong with the book, there just isn't much all that exceptional about it.I wouldn't try to deter anyone from checking these out, but know that it's not some magical hidden jewel of a sketchbook. You might end up preferring these and that's fine, but I don't think that's because it's special, just purely your preference. Maybe they were something incredible or above average in their prime, but they aren't all that amazing now.

The amount you get for the price is amazing. I'd rather buy rainbow holders and a bunch of white candles (which is exactly what I've done) for a cheap price then buy a few colored candles for much more. They burn cleanly, evenly and for their listed 10 hours - sometimes more.

This is super pretty. I love the Color Tattoos and the metallic ones are my new favorite things. Unfortunately, they aren't QUITE as smooth and pigmented as the originals, but they aren't sheer or patchy by any means. They set well and are long lasting and mostly waterproof. I recommend trying these out.

Ehh. Even when set with eyeshadow it tends to run. It doesn't like to go back down once twisted up. It's not awful, but you can get much better for the same price, and I suggest you do. Try Revlon Colorstay if you want a mechanical pencil, or Prestige if you want a sharpenable one.

These are not amazing by any means, but for the price they have pretty impressive sound quality. If you're in a pinch or need an emergency pair of headphones, these are a decent option. I hate horrible sound quality so that says a lot.

It's always a plus to have beauty with brains, and this gorgeous grinder has both. Works beautifully. Makes short work of grinding coffee beans by pressing down, and you control how fine of a grind you want. Easy clean-up too.
These almonds are fresh and delicious. I order them every month. Good value, can't get this in local groceries.
This has been my go-to top for the summer. Light, breezy, and totally cute.
Excellent read, thought provoking.
A little disappointed because "Zealot" was so good. This book just didn't hold my attention, and seemed a bit pedantic and choppy as far as the order of topic.
Deducted a star for arriving kind of dull, but a few swipes on a sharpener restores it to glory.
Well these are gorgeous. Look pretty fancy in my kitchen.
Love this! It's compact and perfect for infusing water. The hermetic seal takes it to the next level.
These glasses are the real deal. Very nice and good looking, perfect for entertaining or if you just want the finer things in life yourself.
I was drawn to this cute little shark, love it. Very soft and cute.
I absolutely love this set. The pieces are huge, sturdy, and quite nice looking. I also got the matching steak knife set (it's cheaper on Wayfair). These really add punch to my Fiesta collection.
Love the bowl, although a little smaller than I imagined, it's still a nice size. Great as a smaller serving bowl, or use it for a large bowl for soups, etc. Pretty design.
Nice Shams, they go perfectly with the bedspread. Soft yet durable, they feel great on the skin. The gray color is very attractive.
Good stuff, this. I put it in cocoa, tea, smoothies, you name it. It dissolves well and tastes great. I love the canisters it comes in too. Great product.
