Anything Fiesta gets 5 stars in my book. These are sturdy and colorful, a very nice addition to my collection.

Love this product. Received it from overseas in a really fast, timely manner.  The smell is so different...fresh like grapefruit, yet a hint of patchouli which adds a spiciness. I can't stop smelling it. I'll definitely order more from this brand.
This smells like you just stepped out of the shower or bath. The scent is clean, fresh, warm and soapy. If you want to smell delectable and like fresh soap, this is what you need. I love it.

These shoes are extremely good looking. They remind me of the shoes I wore as a girl that had flaps over the top of the shoe, and even remind me of my dad's wing tips. The heel and sole are great, and the leather is thick; they shoes are all around sturdy.  That being said, they are narrow. I could barely get my foot past the instep. I had to loosen up the leather to even get into the shoe because they are really stiff. I was going to send them back but they are too cute. I'm hoping with wear the leather will loosen up.
This was a Christmas present for my niece who has an American Girl doll named Isabel. My niece wears a hat very similar to this one, so of course she loved it, and so does Isabel.

If this set of tools were any more adorable I couldn't take it. Not to be too girly and only rave about the pink stubby cuteness, they are also very sturdy and functional. The hammer is very heavy. Great set to add to my pink tool collection.

These bowls are so cute. I needed to upgrade from the icky plastic bowls I had to these cute metal ones.  I got 2, one for food and one for water. They are pretty substantial in size, and the colors and design are great. Weighty enough to not slide around.

The presentation and packaging of this bouquet is the first thing you notice. It is wrapped in pink cloth like material, and when you remove that, you find the most beautiful, full bouquet of silk flowers that you will love instantly. Once you find the perfect vase, they can go anywhere. I have mine under a Renoir painting to mimic the flowers on the canvas. Lovely.

When I opened these flowers I felt like it was Valentines Day and someone had just sent me a fresh, lovely bouquet of roses. These look real, and they are stunning to look at. Perfect for a centerpiece or accent, simply gorgeous. They are boxed nicely too.
These shoes are very handsome, and they are comfortable as well. The heel height is perfect, and the ankle strap can be adjusted easily to fit various ankle sizes.

Good looking scale, seems to be very accurate. Heavy duty, and can take up to 400 pounds. Weight can also be changed to other units of measure such as kilograms. The large blue display can be seen clearly.

Nice looking bouquet, stem is wrapped, and you can manipulate the branches to arrange to your liking. The color is somewhat muted, looks realistic. Recommend buying several for a bigger bouquet, but a single stem is nice too with the correct vase.

I've always wanted a safe to put small valuables in, and this is perfect in size and security. I like that it has a key in addition to the combination electronic lock. This sturdy little unit does the trick for my purposes.

Interesting read for those who grew up at the same time as Brooke Shields like I did. I like her writing style, and there are good bits of information as well as photos I've never seen, like those of her father. The behind the scenes stories are a revelation, and the mother/daughter dynamic is intriguing.

This player is tiny, lightweight, plastic, wobbly, and looks like it's for a child. I normally don't cut corners on quality for price, but I let my guard down and got what I paid for. The LP sticks out though the slots in the cover when it's closed and looks ridiculous. The sound through the built in speakers is not good, and the volume at it's highest is not even close to loud. I was going to send this back and buy a real turntable, but I'm going to hook it up to my sound bar to see if it gets any better. Even if it does, I can't recommend this.

This open shelving was just what I needed in the kitchen for storage and display of all of my pretty appliances and cookware. It got them off of the counter, freeing up valuable space. The shelves are sturdy and attractive to look at. Easy to put together, and you can customize the shelf height. I have my microwave on top Panasonic NN-SN661S Genius 1.2 cuft 1200-Watt Sensor Microwave with Inverter Technology, Stainless Steel, as well as my tfal cookware set and wine refrigerator Haier 6-Bottle Wine Cellar with Electronic Controls. Everything looks amazing.
This hat is a bit smaller than depicted, but it fits, you just don't get as much of a slouch. It's warm and very cute, will do nicely for warmth and fashion this winter.

These shoes are comfortable yet cute. They fit great and the adjustable ankle strap adds flare as well as versatility, much more so than a regular buckle. There's a bit of a heel, which is great. Wonderful, cute, comfortable shoe.

I opened these and they are exactly what I have always wanted in a real diamond without the ridiculous diamond price. 1 carat in each ear, these are a nice size, and the sparkle and clarity are of course perfect. They are super comfortable; I haven't taken them off since I got them, and I usually don't sleep in earrings, even studs, because they bother me, but these don't. Lovely and glam, a wardrobe staple.
Silky and pretty pillow cover.  I purchased a 20 inch pillow to go inside because I wanted to make sure it was full, but an 18 inch pillow will work fine too. I like the cool earth tones.
These shoes inspire me to actually exercise. Love the colors, fits great, looks spectacular.
These are lovely little hugger hoop earrings. Big presence on the ear, but comfortable because of the camel back closure. Lots of sparkle and shine.

These are nice glasses, but they seem smaller than what is pictured, and the shape is not the same; the ones I received are more like a white wine glass. Nevertheless, the colors are vibrant, and the glasses are a good alternative to use for a party.

This shirt is soft and casual, great to throw on to run errands. It's warm and cozy. I like the color and pattern. The sleeves are the perfect length, and it fits nicely; not tight, but not big and bulky either. I'd like to order more colors so I can stop wearing out the one I have.

I've had this for some time but never really used it until now because I lost my iPad cord. I use this with a different cord that won't charge the iPad on it's own, and it works perfectly. Nice gadget to have.

These gloves are the epitome of luxury. The leather is extremely soft and supple, and the cashmere is warm and silky. This pair of gloves are like butta. I got the pink to contrast with a gray wool coat, and the pop of color is fun. Worth every penny.

VicTsing was kind enough to send me a sample light strip for evaluation. This is a fun set of lights. The copper with is thin. It is a smaller guage, thinner, than solder. The leds embedded in the wire about a fist length apart and not much bigger than the wire itself. The leds put out a yellow light that is similar to the copper wire's color. All bundled together they do not put out much light but once strung they will cut through the darkness on a porch or patio. The wire bends easily and stays bent so it can be formed into any shape or contoured around any object . The lights do not give out any heat that I could feel. The lights plug into a slim profile ac transformer with a 6 foot cord. The lights also come with a remote control and receiver that can be plugged in between the light string and ac plug. The smaller than credit card size remote not only turns the lights off and on but it has 10 brightness buttons and can make the lights flash at 2 or 3 different speeds and pulse so they slowly brighten and then fade. The yellow light is warm and inviting and not harsh like white lights can be. These holiday lights are the kind that are not out of place if left up and used throughout the rest of the year.

G. G. Martinsen was kind enough to send me a sample MP4 player for evaluation.The player has a nice bright blue metal case.  On the bottom is a charging/download port, a headphone jack and a little tab for a wrist strap, that is not included. The on switch is on the top. The operating system takes a few seconds to load. Then it displays a text menu of choices. Besides being a mp4 player there is also a radio, a sound recorder, and a picture viewer. The device with also display text files. It comes loaded with a simple game. You can also use the player to watch videos. the batter seems strong enough to power the unit. There are no drop out in the sound and videos play smoothly. The controls are easy to use with a volume control in the middle, navigation buttons on the side and a menu button on top.  16 gives should be enough memory for over 2000 songs with room to spare. Transferring files is quick. After charging for 2 hours or so the this device will play music for about a whole workday. This is a good choice for a small mp4 player.

Nezarco was kind enough to send me a sample wallet for evaluation. This is a lightweight soft leather wallet. It is smaller than my last wallet but it is plenty big to use. The billfold is divided into two sections . This part of the wallet is about two inched longer and just as tall as American paper money. The credit card slots will hold multiple cards and are also wide enough for RFID envelopes. There is a flip-up cardholder with an RFID shield sewn in. The wallet looks well made. The outer edges are folded over, are single stitched,  and look like they have small tooling marks. The corners appeared to be tacked.  The billfold interior and the insides of the card pockets are a papery vinyl of some type that stays in place when the wallet is loaded and twisted. The hinge is big enough so that the billfold can easily hold 50 or 60 bills. This would be a good choice for anyone looking for an easy to use lightweight wallet that doesn't have to be rugged and stand up to a lot of abuse.

These crunchy snacks remind me mostly of breakfast cereal except the little balls are larger than the kernels in a cereal box. The taste is similar to fruit roll ups  and not so sour that I would not eat more. Rasberry is the strongest flavor for me. The crunch is more similar to a cracker than an apple and they look more like grain than they do fruit.

Tomameri was kind enough to send me a sample MP4 player for review. This is a good compact MP4 player. This latest new form factor design eliminates the on off switch from the end and moves the sd card slot to the side. That means the device is about a half inch smaller and still has the same size video screen about the size of two postage stamps. The metal case is sturdy. On the front here is an on off button surrounded by a 4 position toggle ring and two other press button controls above. Once the device is switched on and the operating system loads  there is a choice of a set up and 8 different operations: music, e-reader, games, video, voice, recording, photo, and radio. The default is music.  An animated menu displays each of these choices one at a time. Once one of the functions is selected  you can access a text menu or default to the previous operation. Uploading to the device is simple and the file system is straightforward and can be customized. The player reproduces music without pauses or dropouts. The video plays smoothly.  The music player allows you to skip on to the next song with a press of a button. The menus are easy to operate and most of the content should be accessible with  5 clicks of less.  8 gigs of memory is plenty for over 1000 tunes and still have room to spare. A micro SD card will give you all the versatility you need content-wise. The battery is still long lasting and the player will operate about a whole day. It takes a couple hours to fully charge.This is a good choice for anyone looking for a small, easy to use MP4 player

Steep Wellness was kind enough to send me a sample package of tea for evaluation.  The tea is a complex mix of flavors that is very drinkable. It has a sweetness to it that tastes like anise, some lemony flavor, and a spiciness that might be eucalyptus.  I have been brewing the tea by covering the bottom of my french press with the mixture and filling it a little over half full. The tea has a reddish brown color when brewed. I haven't tried to reuse the mixture. After a few days of a cup in the mornings my sinuses suddenly cleared. It was a little scary to be able to fill my lungs up so easily. I didn't even know my sinuses were plugged up. I wouldn't expect the tea to have caused this. Maybe it was a change in the weather or a fluke. I haven't changed my diet or routine, except for a cup of morning tea.

QooWare was kind enough to send me a sample light for evaluation. This small bright dome light comes with a 5 foot cord. There is an on off switch in the middle of the cord.  It has a USB plug at the end. It does not have a battery. The base of the light is magnetic. The magnet holds the small light in place. There is also an adhesive pad  in the box in case you want to mount the light permanently.  I think the light is more useful to take with you while traveling or to use outdoors where you might have a laptop but no AC.  The dome puts out light comparable to at least a 25 watt bulb.  Although dome is frosted the the light is blinding. I wrap a napkin around it as a shade. Electrical tape would probably work as well. The led doesn't heat the light's plastic lens.  It will work fine as a reading light with the light behind you shining over your shoulder as well.

These are large square chocolate bars with smooth tops scored into 15 smaller sections and bumpy bottoms  where the nuts are showing through. The chocolate can be broken apart more or less along the scoring so the bars are easy to share. The  chocolate is creamy and sweet. The nuts are soft and crunchy and fresh tasting.  I don't see any green color poking through.  They do not have a sour aftertaste like many chocolates do. All in all they taste great.

Senty was kind enough to send me a sample headphone for examination. These headphones cone with an attached 8 foot cord that is fairly thick and has a usb connection.  The ear cushions are held against your ears by two bendable plastic rods and held in place on top of your head  an elastic band that stretches out from the tops of the earpieces. This is actually more comfortable because there is less actual weight resting on your head. The earpieces are large enough to fit over my whole ear. These are one of the more comfortable headphones I have worn. They have a volume control and and also a switch that  lights up a blue led behind the normally dark outer ear cushion covers.  The sound is warm and blended. There is a good amount of bass response. Instead of isolating the different sounds they all combined and blended together. There is a little bit of imaging on recordings where the engineers boosted distinct sounds into the left  or right channels. That is rare. The headphones have very little high end response. High hats are clear and at normal volumes but the resonant tones are absent. It's nice not having the voices and cymbals hissing and shrieking. These would be a good choice of phones for  anyone looking for muted sibilance.

VicTsing was kind enough to send me a sample light strip for evaluation. This is a fun set of lights. The copper with is thin. It is a smaller guage, thinner, than solder. The leds embedded in the wire about a fist length apart and not much bigger than the wire itself. The leds  put out a yellow light that is similar to the copper wire's color.  All bundled together  they do not put out much light but once strung they will  cut through the darkness on a porch or patio. The wire bends easily and stays bent so it can be formed into any shape or contoured around any object . The lights do not give out any heat that I could feel. The lights plug into a slim profile ac transformer with a 6 foot cord.  The lights also come with a remote control and receiver that can be plugged in between the light string and ac plug.  The smaller than credit card size remote not only turns the lights off and on but it has 10 brightness buttons and  can make the lights flash at 2 or 3 different speeds and pulse so they slowly brighten and then fade. The yellow light is warm and inviting and not harsh like white lights can be. These holiday lights are the kind that are not out of place if left up and used throughout the rest of the year

These are good kegger cups. They seem a little smaller that the standard red cups and  have more of a paper  feel than a plastic feel. The tops of the cups extend about an inch above my fist. They are sturdy and will last all night. They come in 3 tubes of 28 nested cups.  The colored band in the middle of the cup is at least 1/2 as tall as the whole cup. One side says Gators in orange script and the other side has the Gators logo.

Syrinx was kind enough to send me a sample device holder for evaluation. This handlebar clamp holds devices more firmly with less movement while riding than other clamps I have tried. It is all plastic except for the hinge pin, the very thin locking screw and two rubber inserts that fit on the handlebar clamp. The handlebar clamp will not fit around handlebars will both rubber pieces in place. You will only be able to use one. I got rid of both of them and was able to fit the clamp around my cork handlebar tape.  The clamp is big so it will work best with wide handlebars.  I think what makes it so stable is the swivel is located right next to the handlebar clamp. The device clamp is spring loaded and opens with a push of a button. There are rails with rows of closely spaced teeth that hold the side clamps. The side clamps are large  and probably two or three times as thick as a phone. the clamps can be squeezed tightly  and hold the phone as tight as you want. There are also two pegs on the bottom that swing out for added support.  The clamps will probably not open wide enough to hold a phone horizontally.  The phone clamp  connect to the base  by locking 4 hooked posts into slots on a round plate. The slots are at an angle to make the clamp less likely to come loose.  Once the clamp is locked in place  it is a firm fit and won't shake loose. I had to jump three curbs before I could make the phone swivel on it's own. If you have wide handlebars and are ok with your phone positioned vertically this clamp is one to definitely consider.

Tomameri was kind enough to send me a sample MP4 player for review. This is a good compact MP4 player. This latest design new form factor eliminates the on off switch from the end and moves the sd card slot to the side. That means the device is about a half inch smaller and still has the same size video screen about the size of two postage stamps. There is an on off button surrounded by a 4 position toggle ring and two other press button controls on the front. Once the device is switched on and the operating system loads  there is a choice of a set up and 8 different operations: music, e-reader, games, video, voice, recording, photo, and radio. The default is music.  An animated menu displays each of these choices one at a time. Once one of the functions is selected  you can access a text menu or default to the previous operation. Uploading to the device is simple and the file system is straightforward and can be customized. The player reproduces music without pauses or dropouts. The video plays smoothly.  The music player allows you to skip on to the next song with a press of a button. The menus are easy to operate and most of the content should be accessible with  5 clicks of less.  This is a good choice for anyone looking for a small, easy to use MP4 player

Aukey was kind enough to send me a sample of this wireless headphone for evaluation. This is a large lightweight headphone. The earpieces are bigger than my thumb and almost twice as thick from the outside of the earpiece to the tip of the ear cushion.  The  ear loops  are hard plastic and not bendable. The comfort and fit are  going to depend on the shape of your head. The wire loop between the headphones is tight enough to hold the earpieces against your head but the distance between the earloop and the sound tube is fixed. These headphones  didn't rest on the top of my ears. I could only wear them with their weight resting on my ear canals or outside my ears.  The good thing was the earpieces were curved enough so that there is enough room for sunglass frames.  These earphones last a very long time. They lasted at least a day and a half on a single charge.  Maybe the extra large size allows for a bigger than normal battery. If you are looking for a long lasting set of headphones  these may be a good choice.

Brainwavz was kind enough to send me a sample S3 headphone for evaluation. These lightweight earbuds have aluminum earpieces with comfortable cushions attached to a 5 ft. long ribbon cord. Sometimes I like the shorter length and sometimes I wish the cord was a full 6 feet. The cord does not make a very good antenna in case you live in a poor reception area and you have a device that uses the headphone cord that way. The earbuds are very comfortable. The earpieces are big  but they don't cause my ears to ache.  I can't hear people talking two feet away when I am wearing them. My first impression of the earbuds are they are very fast. The sound is clear, accurate and detailed. Each instrument is distinct and does not interfere with the other instruments on the recording. The earbuds are sometimes hard to listen to because they reveal all the buzzes  and echoes and scratches that never make it through to my speakers. With proper positioning it is possible to hear many of the bass harmonics in the lower octaves and  the midbass is very clear.  I kept switching from source to source and to me it sounds like there's a bump in about the 2k range. Most sound has an eq boost in the upper midrange these days and maybe these earbuds are just reproducing that. Still for the most part the highs just sound like hiss to me. I think the earbuds would sound better with a little high end attenuation.  The earbuds come with a large carrycase which has room for sd cards or maybe a credit card. A tie clip and a generous handful of extra ear bud cushions are also included.

I received 3 long thin bars, less that a quarter inch thick. The tops of the bars are wavy as if the chocolate was hand poured and left to harden, but the wavy could just as esily be made with a top of a mold. The bars are hard, similar and maybe a little harder than paraffin of the same thickness. You can not sink your teeth into the bars, they bars will break but they do not crumble. Also like paraffin the chocolate has is bland and almost tasteless and somewhat chalky. The chocolate is chewy in one's mouth without being gooey. A bitter aftertaste eventually develops that is long lasting.

The Bibigo Gochujang Sauce is thinner than a paste and browner that other gochujang. It looks in color and has the consistency of a barbecue sauce. When first opening the bottle and using it as a spread the sauce tasted smoky and the peppers tasted slightly sour more than they did hot. Once the sauce was refrigerated and poured over rice the hot spiciness of the sauce was revealed. A little of the sauce goes a long way but  the sauce is thick and it is difficult to use sparingly.  The sauce has a long lasting aftertaste.  Using the refrigerated sauce again as a spread it had less of a smoky taste and more of a tang.  This is a good hot sauce for rice and a good flavor enhancer for other dishes and meals.

These laundry pods come packed inside small plastic tubs with widemouth tops. There are 12 pods to a tub. The tops pry off rather than screw off and have an incomprehensible tab system that allows the top to turn and not fasten tight. I can smell the bleach from several feet away.  There are 48 pods in all so you will want to make sure you can use that many before the pods start to deteriorate.  Clorox has come up with a good compromise measured amount of bleach suitable for most washes.  Since these are pods they are really not practical for other uses besides laundry and bleach in a separate powdered or liquid form is still available to augment the pods or for other non laundry uses.

Brainwavz was kind enough to provide me with a sample pair of headphones for evaluation. These small lightweight headphones  may provide the most accurate sound quality ounce for ounce on the market.  The headphones  are barley 6 inches tall and the earpiece foam is only 2 1/2 inches in diameter but a lot of sound quality in packed in this small package. I didn't have any trouble wearing them on my 71/2 inch hat size head. They were not fatiguing to wear and the ear pieces  were not irritating. Most of the pads on larger size headphones aren't big enough to cover the whole ear anyway. What is most impressive about these phones is the soundstage is huge and as deep as it is wide.  I don't mind the lower bass roll off. It is better than low end muddiness and distortion. The headphones were plenty loud for me. I turned them down from full volume.  The detail and the isolation of the sounds is truly impressive. The reproduction is truly realistic.  The timbres are natural. The dynamics of the headphones reproduce the room acoustics along with the different voices and instruments.  The bluetooth coverage is good  and does not drop out where other devices drop out. There is a voice prompt for connecting the bluetooth and not tones. The voice doesn't lower with the volume level so there will be a woman screaming at you about a low battery after about 5 hours of play.  These headphones are a good tool to really help kids appreciate good sound and music.

Coolife was kind enough to send me a sample  corkscrew for evaluation.  This  fairly large corkscrew comes in a well crafted cardboard box  with the corkscrew device fitting perfectly inside. The burnished brass is shiny without being bright. The corkscrew is foolproof. The handles align the screw in the middle of the bottle's neck and the lever guides the screw straight down.  It doesn't take much effort at all to drive the screw down into the center of the cork and the cork pops out just as easily. The separate foil cutter actually works  and is a lot easier to use than cutters built into the corkscrew.  The all-metal heavy duty construction  means no weak plastic parts to break, so the corkscrew should last a lifetime.

EliteBaby was kind enough to send me a sample packet of safety straps for evaluation. These straps do the job. They are difficult to open, even for adults.  The sliding  latch  is very difficult to move. Once the latch is slid open  the  tongue doesn't slide out freely and must be bent and curled over a series of ridges to free it. The locking straps most likely will take two hands and several seconds to open.  Trimming the tongue will make them look nice but they are easier to manipulate and bend if the strap is longer. The neon green latch color stands out. The glue pads are about two inches long. There isn't two inches of space between my kitchen cabinets  so I wasn't able to use them there.  I wasn't able to slip the pad  underneath the edge on the adjacent cabinet. These locking straps  will not hold  cabinets closed  if the cabinets have bad or misaligned hinges and are partially open. The little bit of force from the hinge will peal the glue pad from the wall unless you tack it down.

This is a smooth white cream with a light  mostly citrus fragrance that applies  easily and is quickly absorbed into the skin without leaving a shine. Skin feels softer after applying and seems to plump up nicely leaving wrinkles less noticeable. I noticed some restorative properties  because dry spots became soft and did not reappear. Washing does not make it's effects disappear.  A little only goes a little way and its best  to use plenty of cream and give your skin a good coating for the best effects.

The Kicking Mule was kind enough to send me a sample mug for evaluation. This is a nice looking copper mug what is dimples inside and out with what look like hammer strikes, except they are too uniform and must have been stamped by machine. The top edge is rolled  about twice as thick as the cup walls  so it feels a little different when drinking from it. The soldered handle is firm. The cup itself is very lightweight and easy to handle. The copper does it's job and does keep warm beverages warm and cold beverages cool. Even an hour later the cup walls still feel icy after pouring refrigerated water into it. The cup is not double walled so the cup and handle are going to feel cold when the cup contains ice beverages. When brewing coffee into the cup or pouring boiling water into it for tea the handle will be too hot to touch for a period of time. This is a nice lightweight large capacity cup that does a good job of keeping cold beverages cold.

Pro-Sys was kind enough to send me a sample toothbrush for evaluation.  This lightweight toothbrush has a large thick flat handle and a small head.  The  bristles are thin and packed close together. The plastic bristles are very flexible but because they are packed so close together they feel very stiff.  After a few uses I can already see  the tips starting to flatten and flair.  The bristles are close together and don't  reach very well on the sides and in between my teeth. The toothbrush does a very good job at scrubbing the front and backs of my teeth and they feel cleaner after using than other new toothbrushes

Ipow was kind enough to send me a sample of their patellar tendon straps for evaluation.  These straps really work in taking the pressure off my knees. it's  I feel the difference immediately.  I must have larger than normal knees because the  wider end portion of the pad is still on the front of my knee and not on the sides. There is still plenty of velcro left over so they should fit knees twice as big as mine. The plastic buckles on each side that the velcro fits through are surrounded by plenty of padding and do not cut into my leg. The padding is thick and comfortable, and more comfortable than just a plain plastic strap. I think because the padding is a little bigger and taller than other straps is the reason they are so effective.

RFID Secure was kind enough to send me 10 sample credit card sleeves for evaluation. These thin paper holders with a gray coating inside are thinner that the credit card they are holding. With a card inside they still fit in the slots in my wallet. The sleeves are slightly longer than a credit card and have a cut out on the open edge so the cards can be removed easily. The top edge is sharp at the corners but they will probably wear down quickly because the folder paper is so thin. I  tried them out with my transit pass. The card reader would not register my card when it was in the sleeve. They really work.

Father.son was kind enough to send me a sample  scraper set for evaluation. These are nice small very flexible spatulas. The smallest have about 3  inch handles and there are 3 scrapers with about 2 1/2 inch heads. There's a scraper with a larger square head that is very flexible and won't support much weight at all.  These tools would be most useful for guiding batters, creams, and sauces out of their mixing bowls. They are also good confectioner's tools for shaping frostings and decorating baked goods.  They also may be good for certain art projects.  they seem to be well made. onlt one scraper same with a rough edge  from not being trimmed close.  The handles seem well glued

Magnum Solace was kind enough to send me a sample bottle for evaluation. I received a medium size spray bottle of the oil. The spay nozzle  delivers a very fine mist. It is so light I can't feel it hitting my skin. This  magnesium oil beads up  more than others I have tried.  Maybe slower absorption means it will last longer.  I know the magnesium is there because I can feel the heat if I put on socks after applying it on my feet. I haven't notice any staining from the oil. My skin feels slick and not sticky after use. Magnesium oil is a great sleep aid for anyone wanting a sounder sleep and is a  great topical pain reliever for deep muscle discomfort. I get immediate pain relief from this particular brand.

Despite the cutesy  cartoon play illustrations this is a pretty good rubber football. It's  only weighs about 3/4 of a pound  but its not soft enough for indoor use around breakables.  The smaller than regulation size and the too prominent rubber lace ribbing makes it easier to throw and truer in flight. It has an air valve so it can be re-inflated  and not just thrown away.

I am not interested in tracking temperature over time. That information is not valuable to me. An electronic thermometer  that takes a temperature in seconds does have some value. This device won't pair without the app. I thought I would be able to use this on my home computer but that is not the case. I need the app to get the thermometer to pair. The packaging says that the app can be downloaded from the Vicks website. That is not the case. On the website there are only links to itunes and google.  I should have checked the website first.  I have another device that needed an app to work but there was a home computer program available for that device. When I put the phone in pairing mode my device manager does not see it. About all I can say about the thermometer is the beep it produces is unique and not too loud

Proimb was kind enough to send me a sample pair of gloves for evaluation. These nice thick glove fit tight on my hands I have to  use one hand to pull them onto my other hand. Because they fit so tight they are not very flexible.  They are large enough to extend past my palms onto my wrists.  The silicon is quite thick and the gloves provide as good heat protection as a potholder or woven oven mitt  and provide a better grip than either of those two products.  They are easy to clean too. There are holes for hanging the gloves at he openings that are too small.

Victec was kind enough to send me a sample wireless speaker for evaluation.  This speaker comes packaged in a nice clear plastic box.  The hard plastic speaker housing is about 1/3 taller than other portable speakers I have with the same size driver. Add to that  the extra height  from the suction cup at the bottom and this is a big total package.  The housing is bigger but it weighs about the same as other small potable speakers.  The driver fires downwards towards the plastic suction cup so it's not reflecting off of a very acoustically friendly surface. Placing the speaker on a hard surface does give the sound some depth compared to propping it up on its side, but the sound quality is only average.  It doesn't play all that loud.  The volume control has 32 positions. in a quiet room I can hear a buzz with the volume all the way down. The speaker doesn't clip at full volume but may be hard to hear over a running shower. Even though the speaker doesn't weigh much the only surface I could find that the suction cup would support it's weight was a mirror. I couldn't get the suction to hold on porcelain or tile or a window. Plastic is too porous. I couldn't find a metal surface where it would hold.  It's probably best to stick the speaker somewhere and leave it, except you are going to have to recharge it periodically. It will play at least 30 hours on a single charge. It took some repositioning to make a good connection and get the charging light to come on.  It's not easy to carry around without hitting the function buttons by accident. The bluetooth connection is pretty foolproof. The speaker automatically goes into pairing mode when turned on. I might have gotten a bad speaker. The device paired fine but the speaker won't play a complete set of tones in test mode. There's no rattling inside but it was sent in only a bubble wrap envelope. There seems to be something wrong  with the caching because there's drop outs every few seconds in stereo mode. This could also be caused by interference from one or more of my other bluetooth devices. I'm thinking my bluetooth mouse may be interfering a bit. The bluetooth range is good and it connects better than some devices at a distance and  where some devices lose signal.  The sound streams with almost no dropouts in mono. I actually was interested in this speaker because of the temperature display. I can not choose between Fahrenheit and Celsius. The temperature displays first in Celsius and after a period of several minutes it switches to a Fahrenheit display for what seems like a shorter period of time. It was about time I learned the Celsius scale. This is a good speaker for sticking on your bathroom or bedroom mirror and shaving, putting on makeup, or brushing your teeth while listening to morning radio.

Tomameri was kind enough to send me a sample MP4 player for evaluation. This is the smallest music player of this type that I have tried. It's nice that they've moved the card slot to the side instead of on the bottom. You can't get much smaller than this player and still have a good size viewable screen.  The removable storage is a nice feature for music sharing and downloading.  The screen is brighter than  other similar players. The device has 2 extra control buttons on the front. The bottom two silver circles are just decoration.  The on off switch is the middle button on the front instead of a switch on the bottom or the top. Most of the complaints people have about these types of players is the menus. They've gone to an animated menu that you can click through to get to the different functions like radio, music, recording, video, etc. Then you can click to a text menu if necessary. Most of the time it isn't.  For people used to the old style menus it will take a few clicks to get used to it. For new users, this is probably the easiest MP4 player to use.

Hippidion was kind enough to send me a sample mouse for review. This is a nice lightweight small mouse. After switching to a larger adjustable weight mouse I am switching back to  a smaller lighter mouse. For me it is easier to control a mouse that's not much larger than my fingers are long. This is a simple mouse. It is well made  although that might not be so apparent because it's feather light. The light weight makes it easy to move. the scroll wheel is ratcheted  and barely protrudes over the left and right buttons so it is easy to reach.  The wheel acts as a mid click button too. The forward and back buttons on the left side are not programmable. The left side thumb well is slightly textured but not irritating and  not weighted down with padding. The right side is smooth.  The mouse used up a brand new fresh battery in 3 days. I've switched to an alkaline. I hope the alkaline lasts longer.  The mouse does go to sleep and shaking it doesn't wake it up so you have to be careful what you click to make it work again.

Orrous & Co. was kind enough to send me a sample of these earrings for evaluation. These are nice easy to wear earrings. the fixture is a curved hook which slides easily through a piecing and is bent slightly at the end to better prevent the earring from falling out. The pearls are well matched in size  and color. One is slightly bigger than the other. One of the pearls is bluer than the other. The other pearl is a little duller or maybe slightly red. The pearls are flattened on the back side so they lay closer to your ear when worn. The fixtures are small and there is only a hint of gold above the pearls. These are a good choice for anyone looking for a simple unadorned earring.

Kingstyle Supplies was kind enough to send me a sample selfie stick for evaluation. This lightweight selfie stick folds up a little smaller than other selfie sticks but it still extends a full arms length.  It's only 7 1/2" long when folded. I think the handle may be a little shorter, which is nice. The handle is a hard plastic and lightweight so it's easier to hold. I think the whole device is a little lighter than other sticks I've used. The spring loaded phone holder is the same as on other selfie sticks. It swivels forwards and backwards but not side to side. You will have to twist your arm for that. The locking nut will hold your phone in place but it will not fully tighten so you can still adjust the phone slightly when it is secured. There is a little bit of flex in the stick when fully extended and loaded with a phone. The stick has a wrist strap attached to the handle  and comes with a nice vinyl drawstring carrying bag

The cups are just small regular thin pleated paper with a colorful design. As long as you are careful in filling the cups they should retain their shape standing alone when baking. It didn't seem to make any difference using a batter with nuts or chocolate chip filling. The nuts didn't tear through the cup sides.  I didn't adjust my baking time  but they may be ready quicker when not using a a pan. The muffins browned about the same on the tops as they did on the sides. A thorough baking should insure that the paper doesn't stick so you might want to increase the liquid in your recipe very slightly to make sure your muffins are moist.

This Panasonic is easy to use. It charges fast. The motor isn't loud.  The shaver is lightweight and must not have a very big battery inside because a full charge won't last an hour. It gives as close a shave as any electric shave I use. It is comparable to rotary shavers. The head is about as wide and a rotary head  but it is a lot narrower so the shaving action is easier to control.  The shaver doesn't stick in case your face is damp which is nice. It comes with a lot of accessories that I will never use.  I suppose the shaver will last longer if it is well cleaned using a motorized cleaner, or maybe not. The shaver still provides the convenience I want from an electric shaver.

Orrous & Co.  was kind enough to send me a sample of these earrings for evaluation.  These are very bright small earrings with a gold u-shaped setting. There are small zircon chips on one arm of the  setting. A small jewel fits loosely between the arms of the setting. The jewels can be turned with a finger but are not loose enough to move with a turn of the head.  The earring posts  stem from the middle  of the jewel  and the fitting raises above the jewels. These earring are suitable for someone that would like an eye catching ear ring  that does not dangle.

Hallomall was kind enough to send me a sample solar panel light for evaluation. This  is a small lightweight light whose outer housing  is only about 6 inches long. It is made to fit vertically on the wall. The solar panel is slanted slightly upwards and the led light panel  is slanted downward.  when lit, the light spreads outwards and slightly downward. The light will shine dimly once it is dark. The motion sensor activates the very bright  high light setting from about 10 feet straight on and  closer from the side. The high light setting lasts about 5 seconds before dimming and if there is continued movement the  light will switch back  for another 5 seconds of brightness after a few seconds. The light will last the whole night  at the dim setting. There is an on/off switch  inside the housing that can be reached through a pinhole by the motion sensor with a paperclip. The hole in the housing  has a plastic tube to help guide the paperclip straight down so there is less fishing around for the on/off switch than there is with other lights like this.  The dim light setting does not produce any usable light. The high setting puts out plenty of light from what looks light bigger than normal LEDs but the light doesn't last for a very long period of time. It would be a race to pull your keys out and get them into a door lovk before the light goes out.

Zenik was kind enough to send me a sample lavender eye mask for evaluation.  This is a very fragrant  therapy mask.  The lavender fragrance is strong and woody.  It is well made with the seems sewn internally on  3 sides. The pad is thicker and not at tall  as it appears in the picture.  This product seems to bemore of  a hot and cold therapy pad than a sleep mask. There is no strap to hold it in place, although the granular filling does flow easily into the eyesockets  The silky cover is not irritating and the weight of the pad does not put pressure on my eyes.  When the pad is taken out of the freezer or a microwave it will stay hoy or cold for about 10 minutes.  The pad is useful for other samll areas of the body as well.

Stronker was kind enough to send me a sample power strip for evaluation. This is a small lightweight extension device.  It has a heavy duty ac cord  with a 3-prong plug and  a velcro strap to keep the cord coiled. The strip  on/off switch on top has an indicator light. I've had problems with Chinese made extension  cord that have mis-sized sockets but plugs fit well and easy into this power box. This is really a usb  power strip with a few additional ac outlets. The AC outlets are spaced too close together. Any cord with a transformer or has a new narrow shape is going to block access to the nearby outlet.  Even conventional AC plugs  might not fit next to each other without shaving the sides a bit.  This box gives you access to 6 usb  plugs but maybe only 3 ac plugs

Orrous & Co. was kind enough to send me a sample pair of earrings for evaluation.  There are fairly large pearls that dangle from these earrings but it is the gold setting that makes there ear rings stand out. gold shines brighter that the  zircon in the middle of the upper part of the setting. The small chips directly above the pearls are almost unnoticeable. The  fastener attaching the pearl is delicate. THe pearls swing a bit but do not rotate much at all. These earrings use a small round clasp at the end of a post to attach them to wear.  These pearls  look almost blue on some light.  This is a nice set of earring to wear whenever pearls are called for.

Always Wireless was kind enough to send me a sample  retractable leash for evaluation.  This is a small compact easy to use  leash. It's  not much bigger than my hand. It only weighs about 5 ounces.  The handgrip looks more slanted to me that it does in the photo. It is larger at the bottom than it is at the top.  It is a tight squeeze to get all four of my fingers around the grip The trigger is easy to use  and doesn't need to be moved far to activate. the clasp swivels and  there is a plastic stress relief at the cord/clasp connection. The leash  is a cord which is better that a ribbon and less prone to bet wrinkled and kinjed. Rgw spring  hold the cord ting and retracts quickly. A dog has about 10 ft to roam, which is plenty. There are round red reflectors on each side of the leash. I do not see why this leash will not last for years.

LiteXim was kind enough to send me a sample dek lamp for evaluation. This is a great little versatile lightweight lamp. it comes with a  5 foot detachable power cord. The poser cord ends in a usb plug and  an adapter is supplied to convert  the plug to a standard AC plug. You can probable use this adapter to  charge or run other devices but I haven't tried. The light actually runs on a batter in the base. There isn't a charging indicator so I don't know how long it takes to charge her battery.  The light will operate about 3 hours at medium setting without being plugged in.  the power switch is a touch switch on the base. It operates easily for me. I often have trouble getting switched like this to recognize my touch. This light activates every time with just a light touch. There are 27 small dots in the head behind the lens as a light source. The neck of the lamp is very flexible and starts to bend about a fist length above the base. It looks like if would turn 360 degrees.  the neck can bend so that the head will lie flat. Although the base is lightweight the light always stays upright no matter how the neck is bent.  I did get a little flickering with the light set to low using the usb connector on my desktop. I don;t know if it was due to the way  the battery in the lamp regulated it's power or my desktop's power supply. The fix is easy to either  turn the light higher or  unplug it from the computer and just use the battery power. I like this lamp so much that I am using it  as a portable light to take with me from room to room. It works better than a flashlight of any of the other portable lights I have.

Zen Factory was kind enough to send me a pair of bunion pads for evaluation. These  squishy silicon pads are cut perfect for me feet with the thick part of the pad pad covering  the side of the ball of my foot. the silicon toe separator feels about like wearing a pair of thongs does. The hole for your large toe is small and fits tight sso the pad will not move much the end ov the pad curled away from your foot. wearing a sock will hold the pad closer to your foot and you can also adjust the pad higher of lower while the pad is inside the sock. The pads are solid and will not compress like foam  or if there was a liquid center so the volume can only shift. For any relief you will have to make sure there is room  in your shoe to accommodate the extra volume.  the set come with one pad for the left and one for the right; they aren't interchangeable.

Orrous &Co. was kind enough to send me a sample of these earrings for evaluation.  These are very impressive earrings. the large gold settings have a large round zircon in the middle  surrounded by small zircon chips.  They are almost too reflective. The gold colored setting is almost hidden by the shine. Pearls bigger than he setting dangle delicately just below. the pearls will swivel as well as move from side to side. There is a small round clasp that locks on the end if the post  to lock the earring in place when worn.  These earrings are for someone wanting a small earring that will catch the eye the way a larger earring would.

This candy is for caramel lovers. There are supposedly 3 different flavors in the assortment but they are all very similar. It's hard for me to tell the difference from one to the other. The bite size candies are individually wrapped. Two of the wrappers are only distinguishable by the edge trim  but since they all taste basically the same  it would be hard to favor one wrapping over the other. The best feature of this candy is the creaminess. There candies aren't chewy and won't stick to your teeth. And there's no bitter aftertaste. Just creamy caramel goodness.

This fairly large ride-on toy is safe for toddlers. The wheels do roll free but your child isn't going to get very far with only short little legs as propulsion. You may end up pushing the child around more than the toy being self propelled. When the rear wheels are placed together the bike  will stay upright on its own. Still it will teach a child how to balance. While a child is sitting on the bike there is a play radio to tune, and a key to turn, and a horn and turn signals to operate. If those are too complicated for an infant there is still a rattle to spin to keep a small one occupied. The sound effects don't always make sense. Pressing the buttons and the recorded voice will say circle, square and triangle  when there are no such shapes. The sound effects make more sense. Ir's easy to get the same sounds to repeat over and over. Hopefully one of them will catch your child's fancy. The recordings play back at two different sound levels. A child should find the toy a fun place to sit even when not moving around.

VicTsing was kind enough to send me a sample mouse for evaluation. This is a larger wired plastic moulded mouse. The wire has a braided rather than plastic housing. The mouse is a little bigger than average size. It has a thumbrest on the left side and a finger rest on the right side. the laser light is very sensitive and this mouse can really fly. It is also heavy when fully weighted. The mouse is heavy enough to move my mouse pad. the scroll wheel has a rubbery net like cover to give it texture and is ratcheted; it doesn't spin free.on the top of the mouse outside the left click pad is a button that can be set for double or triple clicks. It is out of the way and a reach to use. The forward and back buttons are near the top left side edge and are also a bit of a reach to hit. colored lights shine windows cut into the top of the mouse. he colors can be changes from yellow, to green , the blue , to purple and to red. The colors can be set to remain constant or to flash on and off. through Behind the forward and back buttons is another button that will turn off the mouses lighting. Pushing this on off button together with a button near the scroll wheel in various combinations allows you to select the colors. it is very clumsy. It is also easy to hit the on of light button when bending your thumb to reach the back button. The on off button is supposed to control the dpi rate and a red lights flash three times when the speed is change. The red lights flash three times but it is the button near the scroll wheel that selects the mouse's speed. This must be part of this mouses new design. There used to be an on off switch on he bottom of the mouse but that has been eliminated in this new design. when the lights are turned off part the laser glows through part of the top of the mouse. The laser turns off when the mouse isn't in use. This will either make the mouse last longer or wear it out faster from the constant turning on and off. This is a very good product for anyone wanting a hefty mouse with accurate movement and adjustable speeds.

CopperJoint was kind enough to send me a sample knee sleeve for evaluation. I cant figure out why it works, but it does. I have a hyper-extended knee. I've tried knee braces and they have no effect. This CopperJoint sleeve shouldn't work. It is as shear as a nylon stocking. It's not opaque and you can see through the fabric. The only support is from a thin seam in the back. Yet when I wear the sleeve I don't have any knee pain. I thought  that maybe the sleeve would only be good for knees cranky in cold weather but it is summer time here.  The sleeve seems well made. The sewn seams are fairly invisible. There is a double  line of what looks like hot glue  that runs around the inside of the top collar for some unknown reason. The elastic hasn't stretched out of shape so far. Maybe the hot glue will preserve the elasticity. The sleeve is almost small enough to ball up hidden in my fist but it extends from almost mid thigh to almost mid calf.  After wearing the sleeve for 4 hours or so It feels like I'm still wearing it after I take it off. This phantom sleeve feeling lasts for hours.  The CopperJoint sleeve is definitely worth a try.

Teikis was kind enough to send me a sample set of glass bottles for evaluation. I was lucky that only one of my bottles broke. The styrofoam packaging doesn't hold the bottles still. The movement  during shipping cracks the bottles. Even alternating the bottles upside down and right side up would cut the breakage in half. Expect only 6 bottles to arrive intact and be happy that you have a couple extra bottle caps. I was looking forward to a good bottle brush and was disappointed again. The bristles on the brush I received  were uneven  and had less bristles at the end where  there should be more.Update.For some reason another case of bottles arrived. I never contacted Teikis asking for a replacement for the broken bottle. This time all 8 bottle arrived intact. I think it was luck. The  Styrofoam packing was  in pieces.

Ruban was kind enough to send me a sample scanner and stand for evaluation. This is an easy to use trigger operated scanner. It comes with a easy to assemble stand that requires tightening two screws to put together. The stand is bendable and light weight but the base can be screwed in place. The scanner has a loud beep that I can still hear while wearing 33db earplugs so it will work even on a noisy shop floor. When the reader is used as a wand the a light on top of the wand goes out when the laser is activated but does not come on when it read a barcode. A read barcode makes the wand beep. The scanner requires no adjusting to work. In the box was a foldout  with various barcodes to set up the device. One of the choices is continuous mode so you can use the device in the stand without having to press the trigger.  Trying to change the speed by scanning these barcodes did not have any effect that I noticed.  As it is set out of the box I am able to scan about a barcode a second. The data cable that powers the device is about 6 foot long. I was able to get an incorrect reading once by turning a barcode upside down. Other than that one time I could not fool the scanner. I wasn't able to make the scanner error otherwise.

G.G. Martinsen was kind enough to send me a sample of this MP4 palyer for evaluation. I really how easy the device is to carry around. It's about 1/2 as thick as my finger and if I place my hand over it it disappears from view.  I haven't been able to scratch the aluminum case yet . The controls feel solid and react at a light touch. They  are very intuitive, moving up and down the device menu and selecting a function. The big button in the middle activates the volume control there is no mute other than stop.  The display is small  and I was surprised at how much detail I could see. For text  the screen displays about a tweet's worth of text. The playback is flawless with no hesitations in the video and no dropouts in the sound. The AVM  video allows for most other video formats  and will play avi.  The downloading is easy and allows you to set up a normal file system. It plays about a a workday and charges in a couple of hours. It's soundless operating and doesn't build up any heat when on.

Tomameri was kind enough to send me a sample MP 4 player for evaluation. The control buttons look just like an ipad and so does the font used on the menu.  The Toamri is much more than an ipad. The menu is a lot longer though because there is a built in radio and a built in voice recorder. The color screen reproduces both images and pictures well. There is no lag  when trying to playback either songs or videos. It's easy to carry around  as it's about a third of the size of the smallest old flip phones. and only weighs a couple of ounces. I can almost hide it in my hand. The  removable storage is a great added feature and will hold enough content for  more than a couple charges.  The battery lasts about a day at work playing music and charges in a couple of hours.

This is a fun little device that is convenient and quick to use and gives better results than I can get  using a nail file a buffer. The three different pads are color coded so all I have to remember is go from darker to lighter to use them in the correct order. The 3 pads are thin, being under an 1/8th inch thick, and will not last much longer than the battery will. This might just become something I will use on special occasions or in an emergency.

UM Jewelry was kind enough to send me a sample of this attractive lightweight necklace set.  The two charms have a plastic look about them and sometimes look like dark chocolate brown rather than black depending on the light. The silvery design is etched well into the charms and will not chip or scratch away.  These charms will still look good after they are worn many times and bounced around in a jewelry box.  The charms are somewhat reflective and will shine a bit to catch the eye. There is a small round loop at the top of the charms. The set comes with tapered clasps attached to the loop that will accommodate the large chains or even a decorative ribbon or string. The clasp  will unhook from the loop in case you want to wear a daintier chain. The chains that comes with the charms are about 21" long. The charms hang to the base of the neck. The chain is heavy duty and looks like it will last and not break easily.  These charms are suitable for either men or women. They come with a small felt drawstring pouch.

Entertech was kind enough to send me a sample set of 3 bags for evaluation.  These seem like well made bags. The plastic looks about 7 mil or so. It is a thicker plastic than lawn and garden trash bags.  The blue tint in the plastic is light and it is easy to see the contents of the bags. The seams  are about a half inch wide so they will not tear easily. There is a double seal on the open edge. One of the  larger size bags has an extra seam near the top so that the opening is expandable at the top but the bag does not expand at the bottom.  The largest bags are about 2/3rds the size of a garment bag, but they do not expand like a garment bag does. The bags are easy to use and the air seals are tight and don't come loose when shaking. I only received two valve covers  with my samples and not the 3 necessary for all the bags, but these people seem very nice and I'm sure they would  go out of their way to make your order correct should there be a problem. Over time my towels become unfolded and scattered. Now my towel shelf no longer looks light a tangled mess of fabric and these bags have given me a little extra room.

This chocolate has the bitter taste and sour aftertaste that I associate with Hersheys and many people like. Their milk chocolate always tasted closer to dark chocolate to me. The almonds are fresh and crunchy and not too hard. Hersheys has  divided the bars with ridges making 8 chocolate squares so the bars have a machine-like manufactured look rather than an artful molded look of a one piece bar with chocolate poured over almonds. The packaging with its gold color and heavy duty box makes an impressive presentation that will be appreciated by any one lucky enough to receive this as a gift.

Tomameri was kind enough to send me a sample MP4 player for evaluation. The control panel and the menu look just like an ipad except that the menu is a lot longer. This small player has a lot a few extra capabilities. It will also play video files and has a good screen that is easy to watch and  bright enough to see in shaded daylight. It's as easy to watch as most phones although the picture is only as big as two postage stamps.  The radio is a nice feature to use without a sd card loaded. The best feature is the sd card memory which allows unlimited storage  only limited by the number of mini sd cards you have on hand. Removable storage means you can swap cards  with friends too. The player works well and I didn't see or hear any dropouts on either music or video files.

This is a quality made money clip Nice leather and stitching.  Very sturdily made and a strong magnet. I do feel $50.00 is a pretty steep price for such a small item. In my opinion $30.00 would be a fair price for this tiny gem. But as the old saying goes "you get what you pay for."  If it holds up and still looks nice years from now it will take some of the sting out of the high price. A suggestion to the manufacture for future design improvement would be to have the opening end slightly flared out on both flaps. This would make it easier to slip your finger in to open it. As I stated, it has a pretty strong magnet, and that is a good thing. It is small touches like that that would differentiate it from an ordinary clip and make the $50.00 price more palatable.

The  price range of this quality of band is interesting to try and rate. It is inexpensive yet looks fairly nice. It is definitely not a luxury band but that being said it is not bad either. It is too soon to know how it will hold up over time. If the manufacture made the band a little thicker it would have a more expensive look to it. But it is not overly puny either. I have compared it to the Apple Leather Loop (for thickness) and the Apple is definitely thicker. But not $130.00 thicker which is about the difference in price. Now don't get me wrong, the Apple Band is top quality right down to the way it attaches to the watch. But for under $25.00 this band is not that bad in the way it looks. I doubt that it will keep its looks for years if you wear it every day. But if you change bands quite frequently as I like to do you could get some decent usage from these bands. When I first opened the bands (I bought two, black and blue) my first impression was to send them back. But after examining them for a while and then comparing them to the Apple Band and determining there was not a $130.00 difference in quality, I decided to keep them. These bands are not great but also not that bad. If they hold up without the leather cracking in non stress areas, they will be worth keeping. If the leather does crack, then I am not out that much money. And I have no issues with them attaching to the watch, but they don't attach as smoothly as the Apple Band. More thickness would make this band perfect even if the price was increased a bit. While the Apple Band is better quality, it is ridiculously priced. I have purchased top quality leather bands from jewelry stores for other watches for 75.00 or less and they were great.

This is hands down the nicest wallet iPhone case I have come across so far. It is top quality. The leather and stitching are perfect. I purchased the croc black case. It is crafted to perfection, nothing cheap or any shortcuts here. I chose this model because there is a fastener to keep the case closed even when full. I have my driver license and three cards plus a small amount of cash in it. It locks shut and looks good even when full. The company responded to my question about compatibility with an iPhone 6s plus should I purchase one in the future. They responded to my email within a couple of hours. They said this current case will fit the upcoming iPhone 6s plus. I was glad to hear that. This case exudes luxury right down to the gun metal colored trim edging where the phone snaps in. This company also makes a case similar to this one that does not use any type of lock/snap closure. It is beautiful too but this particular case fits my needs better because I like the ability to snap shut the case. If you desire a wallet style case this one has an executive look and feel to it and is top quality down to every detail. It also does not interfere with any of the ports on the phone.

For the money this is a beautiful case. It is finished very nice. The stitching is good and the overall appearance of the leather is nice. When using the case with no card in it the magnet will keep the case closed if the case is laying down or in an upright position when on a charging stand. It is a very weak magnet. That can be bad and good at the same time. The good is that you can open the case with one hand should you need to if your other hand has something in it by flipping it open. Very easy to open the magnetic closure.The bad is that you cannot put one single card in it and expect the magnet to keep the case secured. It just won't stay closed. A slightly stronger magnet would solve this problem. One other reviewer also mentioned that the case covered part of the speaker port. That is true but I have not noticed a reduction in sound. Why not put that holding piece on the other side of the phone where there are no ports?The case keeps the phone very slim. If you have no intention of placing a card in it you will be fine. Since I am using Apple Pay wherever I can I was hoping to keep my driver license in the slot. Won't work. I even tried placing it under the phone. No go, won't stay closed. So I am just going to use this as a phone case only. Really does look good. It is too new for me to tell you how it will hold up but it looks like if you take reasonable care of it you will be fine.With a little modification this could be a 5 star case. But since you can't really use it as intended, it gets 3 stars from me. If it was advertised as a case only and the case didn't cover part of the speaker port (which again I can't tell any reduction in sound, just a poor design feature) it would get the full five stars. As a case only and the fact that part of the speaker port is covered I would give it 4 stars only because of that poor design factor. I want to clarify that I am rating the case that holds one card on the inside of the case.Update:  I like the way this company responds to reviews that are less than perfect. They are cordial and polite and listen for future improvements to their products. I want to reiterate that this case makes a perfect leather flip style case. Very sophisticated/executive looking. I am using it without a card in it. As a case only it is perfect. As I mentioned earlier there is a piece of the case that covers the last two holes of the speaker. But there are 5 holes left uncovered. I can't tell any difference in the volume level with the case on v.s. off.  If you want to use it with a card you can and if you don't mind the case staying slightly ajar you will be fine with it. The case is beautiful for the money and I am going to use it.

This is a very nice wallet and has plenty of space for your cards and cash. This is my second wallet, the first one is tan, this one is brown. For the money it is very good quality. As you know you can spend $100.00 plus for designer name wallets. The way it will hold up and look nice depends on how you take care of it as with any wallet. I have read some reviews where the finish will wear off on the edges especially where it folds. This is true as that has happened with my tan wallet even though it is minor. I found a way to disguise the wear and you can't even tell it. Get a magic marker close to the color of your wallet and rub lightly along the edge where the finish rubbed off. Problem solved. In the case of the light tan wallet I used a maple wood colored staining pen used for furniture touch up. I can't attest to how well it blocks thieves trying to electronically scan your cards but it is nice knowing it is supposed to block those signals. All-in-all this is a $50.00 wallet that has a $100.00 look, feel and smell to it. For all it holds it is not majorly large too. While it is not little, it is a pretty good space saving wallet. I have a total of eleven cards in it which includes driver's license and insurance card plus cash. You would think it would be bulging at the seams but it is not.

These headphones exude pure luxury. They smell like a fine leather coat or the way an expensive pair of dress leather shoes smell when you open the box. Their craftmanship is impeccable. No plastic or cheapness of any kind on these headphones. They are very comfortable. They are not as light as some headphones but that is due to the use of metals instead of plastic. But that being said they are still not heavy.If I had to classify these headphones as a dress accessory they would be under formal attire, or executive business attire. To me they look more suited for a man because they have a business executive masculine look to them but that is a matter of opinion. If headphones can draw attention, these definitely will.Now on to sound quality. They sound fantastic. But here is the deal. If you are comming from a cheaper set of headphones the difference will be dramatic. If you are comming from a quality set of headphones such as Bose, the sound difference will be less dramatic at first and except for the fine craftmanship you will wonder if they are worth the extra money. However after repeated listening here is what I found. The sound gets even better after a breaking in period. After repeated listening and comparison to other quality headphones these headphones have a richness and warmth to the sound that becomes obvious as you keep listening. Are they better than say a good set of Bose? Let's just say they are different in a good way.These headphones have the capability of reproducing different aspects of sound that you didn't hear before depending on the device you are using them with. For example they sound very good when using an iPhone or iPod. But if you really want to get them singing with an iPhone/iPod and get more out of them buy yourself a portable DAC headphone amplifier. I purchased a light weight Sony PHA-1A model from Amazon and the difference is between day and night with the sound quality and volume. The amplifier is also great with your computer. You can also listen with the headphone jack on your stereo receiver because of the adaptor plug included with the headphones. With your stereo system the headphones are superb.To me these headphones are best suited to home or relaxed settings where you can sit or lie back, chill out and do some serious listening. Even though you could take them on a run or even to the gym I just won't do it. This is a luxury item that makes me want to treat it as such. I have Beats Studio Wireless and Bose Wireless for those activities. They are great headphones too but better suited for the gym or activities.I like the way they made the thickly padded ear cushions easily removable should they need replacing to change the audio cords when you need to, or for replacement should they ever wear out. I can't see replacing them for many years unless they are abused.All-in-all these are a great set of headphones both in look and sound. I am sure that all headphones in this class, wired $400.00 range will have superior sound in their own way. What it may boil down to is the look and style of the headphone in addition to the sound.

This cable is just the right size to use in the storage area of your car where you would attach your iPhone/iPod  through the USB port and then close the storage area door for concealing purposes. You don't have a ton of extra cable to deal with. However if you want to use the device  outside of the storage area you will need a longer cable. It works great with my iPhone and car sound system. It is certified to Apple's specifications according to the manufacturer. All functions of the phone work perfectly and sound quality through the car system is fine too. Once my phone is attached I use the touch screen on the dash and steering wheel controls to operate the iPhone and use the hands free system for calls.

At this point I am only using this device with an iPhone 6 Plus and iPod Touch Fifth Generation. I previously purchased the Bowers and Wilkins P7 Headphones from Amazon. They sound pretty good just using the Apple devices but I wanted to see if better sound could be coaxed out of these headphones. I researched and settled on this Sony PHA1A DAC Amplifier. It is not cheap and I was planning on sending it back if it did not make the headphones sound better. I am proud to report it will not be going back. The headphones really came alive with added richness to the sound and more volume than you will ever need. To realize what this little gem can do you must have a high end set of headphones however. It is very sleek and light weight. These headphones along with this device are not what I would be using during activity like exercising, running, the gym, etc.  To me they are for when you are in a relaxing environment and you just want to sit or lay back and chill out with the music. I am pleased with it. It is too bad for that money they did not include an AC wall charger for it. The wall charger is an added accessory if you don't want to charge it through the computer. It does use micro USB for charging however. And since it says made for IPod/iPhone Apple products you would think they would have added an appropriate size lightning cable. They added every other type of cable for connection. I do like the unit enough to keep it. If it had made only a marginal difference in the sound quality I would have sent it back but it pleasantly surprised me.

These are exceptionally nice valve stem covers. However they do not fit my 2015 Sonata 2.0T Limited with the 18 inch wheels properly. When I say "properly" I mean they are not deep enough to cover the entire valve stem. Plus this particular tire valve stem flanges out at the base. These valve stem covers cover about 3/4 of the valve stem. And also the tire valve stem is brass (gold) color. These stem covers are chrome. If they covered the entire stem thread they would be ok. But since they don't you see the gold where the chrome cover stops. I just didn't like the way they looked and fit. I give them a 5 star rating because they are very well made and good quality. They just don't fit this particular car model. I placed them on a 2013 Corolla S and they fit like a charm.

I will start by saying this is a "slim fit" shirt. I did not know this when I initially ordered it in medium size. In a regular shirt I wear medium. But in a slim fit I wear large. The medium fit like a rubber glove. The large is perfect. So when I say "fits as expected", I mean for a slim fit shirt.  This shirt is designed for "fit" guys. If you are over weight this may not be the shirt for you. That being said the shirt fabric is excellent quality. The stripe design is designer. You most probably won't see anything like it out there. Is it expensive? YES. Is it too expensive? YES. But if you want a casual shirt in your wardrobe that is comfortable with quality material and tailoring and a look that stands out from the rest, this one will do it. Worn with white or Navy pants you can't beat the look. And with just the touch of an iron any wrinkles disappear.

Finally a pouch holster that fits an iPhone 6 Plus with a case on it. The Speigen Tough Armor case fits right in it and it would accept an even larger case. I have to tell you it is big on your waist, but comfortable. You have to expect big with such a large phone. It is very easy to remove the phone when needed. I bought it because I was always carrying the phone in my hand and would lay it on the counter in stores and would sometimes leave it. I thought to myself one day I am going to loose that phone. This holster solves that problem. Before I could not find a holster large enough to hold the phone with a case on it. It appears well made. The clip is a little tough to open but that should improve with use. So if you don't mind a larger phone on your waist, this should be perfect.

I ordered this holster to use with my iPhone 6 plus case in conjunction with the Speigen Tough Armor Case. In my experience the holster fits the case perfectly. I am not going to comment on the durability of the plastic release tab because I am returning the holster immediately. I will say that the release tab does function properly out of the package. My problem is that the hard plastic of the latch has to rub along the side and edge of the Tough Armor case to secure it. This leaves fine scratches and rubs the finish off of the edge of the case where the pressure points are the strongest. I noticed this with just a few openings and closings of the latch. At this point it is minor but with repeated usage it will just keep marring the finish further. It is too bad they did not place some felt lining under the latch to eliminate the marring. And I opened and closed it with care. This may not bother some people but it bothers me. I realize the Speigen case is not the most expensive case out there but it is very nice looking and has nice finish colors. I keep my phone in pristine condition and I don't want marring and scratches on it.
