By contrast, on my old trimmer, I'd have to change the line about once every 1/2 hour, as it would get chewed-up really fast around fences and posts and other obstructions.  Funny, too, because one of the reasons I chose this Hitachi over the Echo SRM 225, is because of the ease of changing it's line; and the split spool, which seems like it will prevent the line from binding! Although I haven't had to change the line...I did take the spool off, and it is so fast and easy to do.....I am just amazed! Also, the split spool does indeed prevent the line from binding on itself, as this baby feeds line effortlessly!Basically, this is a well-designed product, that works as it should. No gimmicks..no BS. -just solid performance; and it gets the job done, without making you have to fool around.Between the quietness; the easy starting; and not having to constantly wind new line...I will be weed-eating a LOT more with this Hitachi than I did with my old Bolens!Anther great feature: The throttle control is well-designed and sturdy, and is very responsive. This, in conjunction with a clutch that kicks in at quite low RPMs, allows great throttle control- which in-turn allows one to just feather it (use very low RPMs) around obstructions- so the line does not break....and there is less chance of damaging things. I LOVE it!Natrurally, since I've only had it for a few hours, I can't speak of it's longevity...but I'd done plenty of looking around on the internet for info and experiences with this model, and I've yet to see any complaints about failure of major parts, such as the motor, clutch or driveshaft- so I have  no worries that this unit will last. (Heck, I got 9 years out of my old el-cheapo Bolens...and I live on 28 acres...). Have only seen a few colmplaints of ignition module failure- which is the most common malady with most 2-cycle engines...so hopefully all will be well.A FEW CAVEATS: The muffler guard (little plastic cage around the muffler which prevents you from burning yourself on the hot muffler) was already broken in several places when my unit arrived. I was a little worried, because Hitachi is not known for great customer service, I figgered[sic] they might not send me a replacement part, but rather, might insist i send the unit back to the retailer or to an "authorized service center"- but luckily, they are indeed sending me a new muffler guard, as they admitted that this is a known defect (The guy on the phone acted like he was doing me a big favor by doing this!).For those counting on the 7-year warranty....I wouldn't count on it, unless you live very close to a service center- as Hitachi will generally not ship replacement parts to the consumer under warranty, and insists that you deliver the unit to a service center (Except for the exception above)- which generally costs as much in gas/postage [Not to mention being without your tool for who-knows-how-long....] as just buying the darn parts and fixing it yourself- which I guess is what they count on. But, hopefully, unless one gets a lemon, they will not be needing warranty service.The only negative reviews/complaints I tend to see about these Hitachis, seem to be from people who aren't familiar with 2-stroke equipment- and that is understandable, because if you don't already have a clue about 2-strokes....the manual is NOT going to help you at all- but if you have at least basic experience with weed-eaters/chain-saws; etc. then you'll be right at home with this Hitachi, and pleasantly surprised at how great it truly is!As mentioned, I live on 28 acres, so my outdoor power equipment gets quite a bit of hard use. I've learned to pay a little more, and just get the good stuff. I'm good at keeping the cheaper stuff running...but considering the hours of use, I can tell you that it's a joy for just a few more dollars than a generic junk brand, one can get something like this, which pays huge dividends in ease of use and by not creating frustration. Ultimately, I can get more work done with this Hitachi, in less time, and feel like I haven't even done anything afterwards!Oh, and some other reviewers have complained that the shield down by the trimmer head is not big enough to be effective. I don't know if perhaps Hitachi has fixed that issue or what, but I have found the shield on mine to be better than previous trimmers I've had. I get less junk thrown on me while weed-eating with this Hitachi...and the line cutter on it works very well, also.All-in-all, this is the best weed-eater I've ever had.I will update this review in the future/as needed.Very glad that I bought this Hitachi. Many of my neighbors have Stihl products...which, despite their high cost, always seem to be in the shop with carburetor troubles and other maladies. And you can forget the Poulan/Bolens/Crapsman[Craftsman]/Ryobi/Homelite/etc. products...unless you have a tiny yard, and don't mind a lot of frustrations and poor design which ends up sapping your energy. Get this Hitachi....you will LOVE it! If it works for me on 28 acres......Bottom line: For just a few dollars more than what you'd pay for the junk generic box-store brands, you can get this machine which many pros are using; and which is a pleasure to use, and will make you ENJOY trimming! I'm looking forward to trimming, now! As They Say In The Vernacular: Totally Awesome, Dude!

I grew-up in, and spent a good part of my life in Ronkonkoma. Back in the late 60's and 70's when I was a kid, there were still a lot of the landmarks and remnants of it's glorious past, which are documented in this book! I was hesitant to buy this book at first, figuring that the pictures would be the same ones which I've seen for years on the internet....but they're not! (O-K, a small percentage are...but  not most!). Or I thought perhaps half the book would be occupied by pics of the ubiquitous Agnew & Taylor Hardware store (There are some, but the book is not dominated by them- thankfully!)I can sit with this book and daydream about my wonderful childhood in the still-glorious 60's and 70's when Ronkonkoma was still a nice mix of rural charm and suburbia, and yet only 60 miles from NYC. My mother and I would walk to the lake on hot summer days; passing many of the remnants of Ronkonkoma's hey-day; and I'd even play on the ruins of the pavillians at the beach. I can even see my childhood home in several of the photographs- which is the first opportunity in my life I've had the pleasure to see what my former home and neighborhood looked like prior to myself having lived there!The author's employment of several of James Mooney's wonderful aerial photographs from the 50's and 60's was a natural! One could only wish he would have used more of them, as nothing captures the essence of the place like those photographs! (Some of you may remember, back when Robin's Hardware was still extant, the owner, Georgie Erotakis(sp?) had a bunch of Mr. Mooney's photographs displayed along his counter. It was such a treat just to go in there to buy a nut or bolt, and spend an hour looking at the photos and talking to George and his wife!)There are a few inaccuracies- such as where a photo is shown of the old original bank at Hawkins and Portion- and the caption says that it is now owned by the Ronkonkoma Fire Dept. -He fails to mention that the building now there was built in the late 50's and is NOT the same building pictured in the photograph. And a few other inaccuracies; locations slightly off, etc. But such does not in any way detract from the enjoyment of this wonderful book!And I could also wish that there had been a little more coverage of the kinds of places where the average people lived and worked- instead of the houses of the "great men" and the former tourist accommodations(yawn). I would have liked to have seen some shots of just ordinary residential streets of different decades. What did the residential core area look like in the 30's? How about a few shots of the suburban paradise of the 70's? The bungalow community west of Rosevale avenue?[Small bungalows, mainly used as summer houses in the hey-day, and later used as permanent residences. Sheesh! At least one shot from the 70's, showing some of these converted tiny bungalows, with more modern houses interspersed, as became the case by the 60's and 70's. This was a big part of the town's character!)These are not really complaints, mind you; more like suggestions. Perhaps the author/publishers will see fit to expand the book for a future printing? (And C'mon! We really need a shot of the old Woolworth's which occupied Ronkonkoma's first shopping center. Or how about: What did that parcel of land look like before the shopping center was there? I could think of SO much more- but still- for the limited size and scope of this book, the author did a SUPERB job!Kudos for showing a shot from the early 80's, when downtown was starting to look like a slum- after the fire that destroyed Fayne's drug store and Straub's Market, et al. THOSE are the kinds of photographs which are often omitted by others; and which really help to tell the whole story of a point in history that anyone who was there remembers. (More photos from the 70's, PLEEZE!!)As you can tell, I ramble.... But this book is a great trip down memory lane for anyone who remembers Ronkonkoma before it became the over-taxed, oppressive rat-hole that it is now (along with the rest of "Lawn Guyland")- or for anyone who wants a good description of what the area was like in former days. I am truly grateful to have had the advantage of having grown-up in what was then such a wonderful place. (I left NY at the turn of this century, and will never again set foot in the hell-hole that it has become!)If you have any connection to or interest in Ronkonkoma....get this book! (And if you still live in the crud-hole that LI has become, get the heck out of there!!! There are still some nice, inexpensive, somewhat free places to live in this country, where the neighbors are still normal...and far enough from you that you don't have to care!)

As an avid cyclist myself, how could I go wrong with a movie about cycling? Well, it was easy...I bought THIS movie! Boring; poorly made; You can't understand half the dialogue for the thick Scottish accents (and I'm usually great at understanding even foreigners with broken-English and thick brogues!); It was formulaic; There's no reason to identify with or have any empathy for the characters; and it seemed like half the movie consisted of the riding of a bicycle around in circles. Total waste of time- not one redeeming quality! It's as if someone assembled a series of images and cheap video clips for a Youtube video! SPOILER AHEAD - STOP READING HERE IF YOU DON'T WANT TO SEE THE SPOILER -** SPOILER** I was really wishing that the main character had succeeded when he tried to commit suicide! It would have been a bigger accomplishment than beating some record for riding a bicycle around in a circle.....

If you have pre-2010 Shimano STI levers......GET THIS! It stays put (Doesn't get knocked around in the wind or on bumps); is unobtrusive; gives you a great view (So much easier than turning your neck- you'll check your rear view 20x as often, because all it takes is a glance). It's made of very sturdy ABS-like plastic- I've had one for over a year now, and it's still like new after 3000 miles...and I just bought another one for a newly acquired bike. I wouldn't be without one!If you ride on the road, you need a good mirror to be safe- and this is it! This, and a hi-vis jersey will increase your safety exponentially.Assembly may seem difficult to some, as the screws can be a little tight and hard to turn- but this is the way it's supposed to be, and it works, because once properly assembled and installed....it never loosens up. Installation is very easy. The instruction sheet they provide could be better- it would benefit from clearer diagrams...but it's not rocket surgery....you'll "get" it.This is the single greatest bicycle accessory in the history of the world!And it even looks nice- not cheap-looking. They seriously need to make a SRAM and Campy version!It even includes 2 allen wrenches, for the tool-deprived, which is all you need for assembly.Just be careful when you unpack it, as there are a few TINY screws and washers that could easily get lost.

I have the older incarnation of this saddle on my Klein. These babies are light; high-quality and very comfortable! In my opinion, these narrow saddles are the way to go [Of course, saddle comfort is a very personal matter- and is dependent upon your own bodily proportions...]. Saddles of this shape are getting harder to find, as many manufacturers are going with more "modern" designs- but this more traditional style offers the perfect blend of performance; comfort; and even looks, without any compromises. They are comfortable even if you ride without chamois- as I often do. I'm surprised to see them here on Amazon and for such a low price, while Brooks saddles are much more expensive and more popular, even though, in my opinion, they are inferior to these wonderful saddles!I just happened to "luck into" these saddles, as one came on the used bike that I purchased....and what luck it wa- as it enabled me to discover the perfect saddle, which I otherwise might not have tried.  If you tried others- even more expensive ones- and are still searching- give these a try...if they agree with your anatomy, you'll never ride anything else!

This hamper does not look as nice in person as it does in the picture. Looks almost black, in actuality. The finish is not of the quality I would expect for such a price ($73)- instead of looking like a quality, classy piece, it looks rather cheap and "dirty". Also, the woven panels feel cheap and flimsy- I wouldn't expect it to last. Not what I would expect for this price- seems more like something you'd get at the dollar store for $20. (I will actually be replacing this with a dollar store hamper! The dollar store hamper seems light years ahead of this one, for little more than a quarter of the price).I rarely return things...but there is no way I'm keeping this thing for what I paid for it! If you're looking for quality...this isn't it. And the packaging! It was wrapped in plastic acetate, and cushioned with a very wimpy styrofoam, which breaks into a million pieces if you just look at it- and had such a charge of static electricity, that it seemed to have it's own force field! If you do buy one of these, unpack it outdoors, because it will make a MESS in your house, that you will be cleaning for days to come.This is one instance where I am very thankful for Amazon's liberal and accommodating return policy- because i wouldn't be thrilled with this piece if it were $25- much less for the $73 that I paid for it! I'm going to pack it up right now, to ship back- can't wait to get it the H-E-double-hockey-sticks out of here. Bleccch!

Just tried this for the first time, and I can say that this will be my tape of choice, from now, on. It looks great; is stretchable and forgiving and easy to apply; easy to re-do; it's comfortable and just feels great....and they give you plenty, so that even if you do figure-8's around your brifters, as I do, and even if you have wide bars, you'll still have plenty of tape!I just taped both of my bikes today- one with this, and one with another brand.....now I wish that I had just bought this for both bikes.

I wanted some cages for my beautiful Klein- something that'd look nice; be light and functional; and not be expensive. These fit the bill, perfectly! Very nice quality at such a low price- they look more expensive than they are- no worries about making your nice bike look cheap. Nicely made and well designed....they're pretty much perfect.On the backside of the mounting holes, there is a raised area, so that the area around the screws is the only part of the cage that actually touches your frame- a very nice consideration if you have a nice bike whose finish you want to protect. I put a piece of electrical tape on the back of the part that contacts the frame, just to be safe.I'm really impressed with these- I think I will order some more for other bike...they just look so good and work so well!

Got a cat who won't play with any toys? Get it these! I've bought these in the past for someone's cat who wouldn't play with ANYTHING...and I just bought them again for another cat....they all love these balls! The balls are a nice density- firm enough that cats don't get their nails caught in them; and they even bounce; and yet they are soft. They don't make noise...they're durable....they're not quite foam; not quite rubber; not quite sponge...but whatever they are, cats sure love 'em! I'll be back for more (They DO get lost!)

EDIT 11/11/13: I just had to bump this up to 5 stars. After a few thousand miles on this tape, it has become my absolute favorite! I love the way it feels; I love the amount of cushioning; and it still looks and feels like it's brand-new. I'll be sticking with this, exclusively!As others have said: This is a very nice quality tape and at a great price- comfortable and good-looking; stretchable and very easy to apply/allows do-overs. The only complaint I have is that the rolls are a little short. If you like to do a figure-8 around your brifters, you'll come up short if you have wide bars. On my narrowish bars, I just BARELY made it to the end- nothing left to cut.They do provide those little strips to tape on around the back of your brifters [I still do the fig-8, even if I use the strips), as well as nice shiny end-caps and finishing tape with the Profile Design logo on it.C'mon, Profile Design- just give us a few more inches, and you'll win a lot more customers! (And it's not me- with other brands, I always have a lot left over)

The build and design of the of the Verus Crystal Bumper case for the Galaxy Note 5 is very beautiful and tough as it can get without harming the aesthetics of your phone. The spaces or cut outs where the camera lens are located stands out perfectly, not a millimeter short or over its intended space. The fit is snug but not overly tight. The material is very light and feels very durable, and will protect your phone nicks, scratches, dings and shock when you accidentally drop your phone. This is first hand information I can guarantee. Dropped my phone a few times already and if it were not for this case, phone would have cracks or scratches all over. Protection is all-around. The grip is sound and secure, firmly in your hand. Overall, top notch protection for your Galaxy Note 5. Highly recommended!

The Village Candle Warm Buttered Bread 11 oz Glass Jar Scented Candle gives out a pleasant smell. Nothing strong or overpowering, just a soothing, pleasant smell that kinds of calms you as you walk past by it. I placed it in the bedroom at it gave out a soothing smell which I thought aided me in my sleep. I don't often use scented candles at home but the trial of this candle makes me want to try out other varieties in the Village Candle line of scented candles. Highly recommended!

The Frigidaire Square LED Forecast Station provides simple, on-demand weather information that can aid you in how you plan your day. The simple design displays the time and the temperature for both indoor and outdoor and the weather outlook for the day, i.e. rainy, cloudy, sunny. The display is big and bright, you are able to see its entirety on a single glance. The set-up was simple too, no weird or complicated wiring to do. Just place the sensor in a clear, no obstruction, dry site and it will receive time information from the NIST time signal radio station based in the Fort Collins in Colorado. It self synchronizes itself and adjusts for Daylight Saving Time. Great implement to have at home to get the precise time. Highly recommended!

Although the Evalar Seeds of Beauty Complex Viatmins seems to be a great supplement to promote skin health, I kinda dislike how it tastes. I am a firm believer in collagen supplements but I would rather take this in tablet form. At my present age, I have not have any kind of significant wrinkles but I am really headed that way although I try to be as realistic as possible that as we age, no amount of collagen treatment would totally prevent you from getting wrinkles. It is just a fact of life. Nevertheless, you really have to continue this collagen regimen if you want to have tight, younger-looking skin. I have finished the whole box, being complementary. But I don't think I would continue this regimen if the in the long run, wrinkles cannot be avoided.

The Hefty Slider Storage Bags never runs out of usage in my household, from storing left-over food to storing just about anything you can put in these bags. They are very strong, can hold a lot of weight without tearing or breaking. This is definitely one of those little stuff that makes life easier in the kitchen and just about anywhere in your household. Highly recommended!

The Ringside Gel Wraps is great protecting your knuckles from injury when you are engaged in any kind of activity where you box. I am not a fighter nor a practitioner of any kind of MMA but every once in a while when I work out in the gym, I hit the punching bag as a kind of cardio workout to put up the proper heart rate before lifting weights. I used to do it with bare knuckles, care not to hit the bag hard as to injure my knuckles. With these wraps, I could hot the bag harder than ever before and the cushion these wraps have really protects my knuckles. It conforms perfectly in my average sized hand, not too tight but not loose either. The wrapping around the wrist is also great at giving your wrist the proper support every time you throw a punch. Now instead of warming up in one of those cardio machines in the gym, I just box all around the punching bag until I sweat and hit my target heart rate. This is one change that I'm glad I made, thanks to these wraps, in my exercise regimen. Highly recommended!

The Vitamin World Ultra Woman 50 Plus Multivitamin gives you all the essential vitamins and minerals in a 2-tablet daily dosage. The vitamin composition and their contents are right on the spot for your daily recommended dose. Like all gals nearing 50 or are in their 50's, I take these multi-vitamins as a form of supplement, to rectify or reinforce what you lack or may get from normal food. Great supplement!

The Vicks Sweetdreams Cool Mist Humidifier is a handy implement to have in your house, especially during below freezing temperatures in winter where the indoor air tends to be really dry and starts to affect a variety of malaise in your household. Aside from the great functionality of the Vicks Sweetdreams Cool Mist Humidifier, it is also very easy to fill with water and very easy to clean. I like the fact that this can be used with the Vicks Scent Pads where you can use it if someone has a cold and clogged nose. The menthol vapos from the vapopads relieves clogged nose and can help a cold sufferer get a good night sleep. The projector feature is another plus and can help calm your sick child by looking at the images. Great implement and I highly recommend to have this in your household.

The CAILLER Praliné Chocolate Selection is probably one of the best Swiss chocolates I have ever tasted. You can absolutely tell just by the packaging that these are not just ordinary Swiss chocolates. The quality just stands out and once you put one in your mouth, your eyes will close from pure, mouth-watering satisfaction. Yes it is expensive just like all other Swiss chocolates but the Cailler Praline is just pure, out of this world chocolate goodness.

The Minions Hit Them Out Board Game is fun game for kids who saw the movie. My 4-yr old daughter saw the movie and we have bought her some things like stuff toy, Mcdonalds happy meal Minion character, stickers, etc. This board game adds to her "mini" collection of anything that is from the movie and the fun factor of bowling with the characters as pins is priceless for any kid that loves this character. My daughter definitely loves this and as a parent, I highly recommend it!

I gave the Goody's Back and Body Relief Shot 3 stars not because it is not effective but because it is kind of an overkill considering the 1,000mg dose you get per shot. Unless you have recurring back pains or the pain is debilitating, the 1,000mg contents per shot is more than enough to address any kind of minor pains. Sure it will relieve the pain but reading the literature of this OTC med, especially the liver warning part, gave me caution in actually using it as recommended. Use this only if the pain is unbearable or if it the pain restricts normal movement. Otherwise, a smaller dose is all you need. Also drink plenty of water when using this to fully dilute it and flush it out of your body once pain relief is achieved.

The Goody's Headache Powder, Mixed Fruit Blast provides a quick relief to minor headaches. I used mine one night at work while having a nagging headache which I thought would go away as my work night progressed. Well, it didn't and it got worse. Taking the right dosage with water and my headache was gone faster than when I took Advil gels. The caffeine in this medicine kept me alert too, working all through the night. The mixed fruit flavor is kind of "medicine-like" just like when you take cough syrup. But after washing it down with water, there is no after taste. I highly recommend this if you are looking for a faster relief for pain. Much faster than what you would get compared to other OTC pain meds.

The Westcott iPoint Orbit Electric Pencil Sharpener is a good sharpener that works with one click when sharpen a pencil. I brought this to my work place to really test it out as co-workers use a mix of pencils and ballpens. It has worked pretty good considering it is used several times throughout the day. Some people here complained that it is loud but from my experience, the sound it produces is pretty much tolerable. Its not that you are going to hear it all through my work day. Obviously, when someone is trying to sharpen, it will produce a sound but nothing like so loud like the other people have complained about. So far, its been holding out pretty good. Gave it a 5-star for now but will update in a few months.

I have 2 dogs, both picky eaters. But surprisingly, they both ate the Solid Gold Wolf King Bison and Brown Rice Recipe with Sweet Potatoes Holistic Adult Dry Dog Food. I was thinking maybe because this dog food has Bison in it. For us humans who has tried Bison meat and liked it, Bison is more tastier than beef, chicken or pork. They seem to have a great time consuming this dog food to the last lick in their bowls. And they have no hesitation whatsoever, once you fill their bowl, they go at it right away. So from plain observation on how they eat this, I would say they loved it!

The Aladdin Stainless Steel Vacuum Mug really keeps the contents either hot or cold for an extended period of time. It is very well insulated that I put piping hot soup in it and brought it to work. 3 hours later, the soup was still hot! This goes to show that the insulation of this mug is so good, it maintains the cold or hot temperatures of the contents for several hours. It also has a great leak-proof design so even if you accidentally drop it or tumbles inside your car, the liquid contents will stay in the mug. And this mug is so huge, at 16oz, it holds a lot of liquid. The mug is also ergonomically shaped to ensure it will not slip your grip. I like this mug so much that it becomes part of my lunch box. Always great to have this mug and get a consistent hot or cold beverage. Highly recommended!

In my opinion, the OtterBox Defender Case for Sony Xperia Z4V is by far the toughest case you can get for this phone. This rugged case is built like a tank and with this protecting your phone, it can survive the toughest day-to-day accidental drops, bumps and whatnots you can think of. The layers of protection that this is made of is kind of an overkill but lets be honest, we always want our phone to look shiny, new and scratch-free. Otherwise, we wouldn't really get a case. The buttons are perfectly place to manipulate controls and the cut outs for the camera are precise. Also includes a holster for quick access. Tough and rugged, you can never go wrong with this case as far as protecting your phone is concerned. Extremely highly recommended!

The Belkin Wired Tablet Keyboard with Stand and Micro USB Connector for Samsung Galaxy Tablets is a total hit accessory for your tablet. Great when you need to do a lot of typing with your tablet, takes away the mistake is touch-typing. I have a 10-inch Samsung Galaxy tab that I use for work and this keyboard is very handy when typing a lengthy emails to my boss or my co-workers. The typo error is greatly minimized by using this keyboard compared to touch-typing in the tablet. This is a plug and play device, no other software is needed. The keyboard is also the right size, big enough to accommodate your hands while typing but not small enough to feel awkward when typing. The QWERTY button are neatly spaced out, minimal adjustment with your hands are needed to finally get that exact "feel" when you are typing. Also comes with a stand to hold the keyboard at a comfortable angle. Overall a great piece of accessory that totally complements your tablet, making it more user-friendly.

The OtterBox iPad Air 2 Symmetry Folio is an awesome protective case to protect your iPad Air 2 from the occasional bumps and drops. I work in an IT Healthcare environment and use this Tab for work. I sometimes do fieldwork, working from one location to another and bumps and drops happen along the way. The OtterBox is great at giving my iPad that extra layer of protection. The fit is very exact but I expected this since the exact fit of the case keeps it in place and absorbs the occasional bumps. The front part of the case covers and protects the screen when it is folded, great when setting your tablet down screen first, you will not scratch the screen. The material of the case is non-abrasive and ensures the finish of your tablet to be scratch free. The front part and also acts as a base stand. This is a great case that provides overall protection on any part of your tablet. Highly recommended!

The JAM HX-P930 Trance Plus Wireless Light Show Speaker is a decent sounding  Bluetooth speaker that produces soothing light as you are playing your favorite tunes. I listen to a lot of jazz and I found that while the sound is good in lower volumes, it kinda distort a little bit once you raise the volume up. I am comparing this to the Logitech UE MINI BOOM Wireless Bluetooth Speaker - Black which I currently use. Though the one from Logitech sounds a bit better, the JAM HX-P930 Trance outputs a more powerful sound. Just don't put the volume all the way up. There were no pairing problems with my Android smartphone and my iPod. Didn't take long for these devices to discover and pair with the JAM speaker. The light show adds a bit of touch to the audio. Love it while playing music in a dark room, trying to induce my sleep to sleep by looking at the speaker. Overall, a great product with decent sound output.

The OtterBox iPad Mini 1/2/3 Symmetry Folio is an awesome protective case to protect your iPad Mini from the occasional bumps and drops. I work in an IT Healthcare environment and use this Tab for work. I sometimes do fieldwork, working from one location to another and bumps and drops happen along the way. The OtterBox is great at giving my iPad that extra layer of protection. The fit is very exact but I expected this since the exact fit of the case keeps it in place and absorbs the occasional bumps. The front part of the case covers and protects the screen when it is folded, great when setting your tablet down screen first, you will not scratch the screen. The material of the case is non-abrasive and ensures the finish of your tablet to be scratch free. The front part and also acts as a base stand. This is a great case that provides overall protection on any part of your tablet. Highly recommended!

Great way to add instant shade to your car if you do not have tinted windows. I have tints in my windows and I have the legal 35 percent which I feel is still not dark enough. I used the Laser Shades to add the impression that the tints are darker than they usually are. This is especially useful now that it is summer, you are able to maximize the cooling effect of your AC without turning it all the way up. The ones for the rear windshield are great at protecting my leather upholstery from the searing heat of the sun. Adding this to your already tinted windows significantly minimizes the intense heat inside your car when it is parked. Another great thing about the Laser Shades is that they do not reduce or impair your driving visibility. You can still clearly see the vehicle behind you and gauge its distance even at night time. Being detachable, you can always take it down when you need to. Great implement to an un-tinted window and a great addition if you already have tints but want to gain a little bit more darkness in your tints.NOTE: Just to give you some sort of a heads up, before I bought these shades, I called up Amazon's customer service to inquire as to how many pieces of shades will come in this set. I was told  it was 5: 2 for the front windows, 2 for the rear windows and 1 for the rear windshield. However, when the package arrived, it only came with 3 shades: 2 for the rear windows and 1 for the rear windshield. I thought this was some kind of packaging mistake and called customer service to call their attention to this and ask for a replacement. When the replacement arrived, the same number of shades is still 3. I called customer service again and try to verify if there were indeed 5 pieces for this set. The description says 5 but the actual set is just 3. I still kept it though since I really needed it but asked for a partial refund since this was suppose to be 5 shades. Hope this information would help you out in deciding your purchase.

I don't even know how to begin my review on the Fisher-Price Imaginext Ultra T-Rex. This huge toy has a fun factor second to none! It can be intimidating to look at all the pieces at first but everything pretty much is very simple to attach to the already pre-assembled body of this toy.
